story:
Mark's Hammond C3 sound is a mainstay of the UK funk and soul scene and has been his prized possession for 26 years! 

Meet Mark. Mark is THE hardest working person I know. When I say hard-working I mean OBSESSIVELY hard-working. He became self employed 3/4 years ago and since then the only place you can find him IS AT WORK, day or night (I'm seriously not exaggerating). 

Having built is dream music studio, GTA Studios in Harlow, he offers an extremely professional and personal experience whether it be practising, recording or mastering all genres of music. He even runs summer schools for children to actively engage and promote music in the community. 

The land he rents for his studio has been sold off for housing development (meaning he'll get £0 as he does not own the premises), leaving Mark trying to sell off items in order to raise enough money to find a new premises, rebuild practice rooms and purchase enough materials to build another studio.   

Which brings me to his Hammond Organ. He has owned his Hammond C3 organ for 26 years and plays it regularly with bands to make a living. 

I started this campaign to raise enough money so that what ever happens, Mark doesn't have to sell his most cherished possession just to pay rent.

Probably the most well maintained Hammond in the UK, this beauty, as well as being at the front of the stage with his own band The Getup, has been played by James Taylor of the JTQ, Mother Earth, The New Mastersounds, Mr Greg Boraman from The Fantastics himself, and many many others. 

Imagine Jimi Hendrix without a guitar, or Stevie Wonder without a harmonica..... That would be Mark without his Hammond. 

If you've ever met Mark you would agree with me that he's one of the most generous, kind and funny individuals you know and I feel very privileged to be his friend. Playing and owning his Hammond C3 is one of the only self-indulgences he has and I can't let such a hard working man sell part of his soul. 

Help me raise enough money to save his Hammond, hopes and happiness. 

You can hear this fantastic instrument (and player) here: The Getup 'Straight From The Hob' Snippets.

Mark has told me that If you donate anything and we reach our final goal he will record an exclusive track as a personal thank you to all the people who have helped him.

story:
Both Kinds of Music

  • My name is Jeremy Steding, I'm an independent country and western singer/songwriter. My roots are in Florida, my home is in Texas and my bed is in Nashville. I have a beautiful/talented wife and a glorious, gifted, 2 foot 9 inch, 25 pound wild man of a son, named Jackson Daniel Steding. I work with exceptionally talented, good-natured musicians, and an incredible production team. I am very grateful to be surrounded by amazing people. In addition to maintaining a strong tour schedule, I currently work three side jobs; slinging salmon at Park Cafe, driving Lyft and building websites to keep the dream afloat. I write. I book, I create. I believe. I love my family. I keep busy. 
  • I have written over 50 songs since recording "My Own American Dream," and we have selected the best of the best to give y'all a moving listening experience; an alternative to mainstream country music. I believe this album to be a personal best.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We NEED over $13K total, but humbly ask for help with half. I am pouring all of my money into the project and am simply hoping for some help. If we are able to exceed the goal, as I hope to, all funds raised will go into the creation of this album.
  • Recording/Musicians/Mixing/Mastering - $7K
  • Printing of CDs - $2K
  • Artwork Design/Direction - $1K
  • Advertising, Promotion, Distribution Etc. - $3+K
  • I want everybody to feel like they are really getting something by contributing, so I am writing/recording unique songs, building websites and sending out quality fan packages

The Impact

  • I have successfully crowd-funded two albums, "I Keep On Livin' But I Don't Learn" and "My Own American Dream," both of which I am very proud of. I could not have created the music that I have without the support of my amazing group of friends and fans. Thank you so much. To help is to truly support independent, real music.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everybody is in a position to help us create the album and that's no sweat, I would still be so very grateful if you would spread the word!

  • Share, share, share, share on social media - Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, anywhere!

Thank y'all so very much, I can not wait to bring you new music!

story:
My Story

My name is Katherine Moller and I am a Celtic fiddler/violinist from Harvey, NB. 

I started playing the violin when I was 6 years old, and fell in love immediately!  Over the years I have released 5 solo albums, and one album with my Celtic band, Different Folk. 

 

The Album

Back in 2016 Facebook introduced a live feature where you could perform shows for your fans.  Since then, I have been hosting a weekly show called “Tea & Tunes” with my guitarist Tom Richards.  We have performed a mix of traditional and original music through the years.  After over 150 episodes, we decided to record an album!

Over the past few months we narrowed down the tunes, and then asked you, our fans, to help us chose the pieces that are going to be on the recording.

At this point we have recorded the tracks, and have done a photo shoot for the album. 

 

What is left to do?

We still need to mix, master, and duplicate the "Tea & Tunes" album.

Recording an album, even a relatively inexpensive one takes around $10,000.  We are only asking for help finishing the project as the majority of it has been paid for already at this point.

 

What can you do?

If you can contribute, thank you so much!  If you can’t, there are other ways you can help out!

Please share this with all your family and friends you think might be interested in helping us out!

story:
NEW! Stream the entire album at ghosthotel.bandcamp.com/releases


The Story So Far...

Ghost Hotel was founded on a warm night in the summer of 2011 by two childhood friends with a dream: to become indie rock stars. Since then, founding members Sam Paxton and Alison Crawford, newly added members Andrew Bassett, Dane Di Pierro, and Dani Mae Smith, and producer/recording engineer/musician extraordinaire/audiomancer Jordan Miller have crafted a 10-track, nuanced, rich album that explores the ups and downs of relationships and young love. With poppy hooks, diverse instrumentation, and clever lyrics, we hope our music will touch you in the same way our influences have touched us.

What's Next?

Over the course of seven months in the studio, we have produced a 36-minute album. Now that recording and mixing is completed, our 10 tracks will be handed off to mastering engineer Carl Saff of Chicago, to be tweaked, primped, and prodded into a shape befitting a debut release. Those finished tracks will be released both digitally and physically, and we will begin playing live shows to promote the album (once we find a drummer - contact us if you're interested)!

What We Need & What You Get

Releasing an album costs a ridiculous amount of money! Up to now, we have been funding the creation of this, our baby, out of our own pockets. Here are things we are hoping to do to finish/promote the album that we still need to spend money on:

  • Mastering
  • UPC Code
  • CD/Vinyl (Hopefully!) Pressing
  • Graphic Design (Album Artwork)
  • Band Photography
  • T-Shirt/Poster Design + Printing
  • Music Video Production
  • Musical Equipment for live shows

Because we are poor college/post-college students, we have reached the point where we can no longer do this alone. To this end, we are humbly asking you, our loyal fans, to open your hearts and your wallets to help us make our dream come true. We are asking for a total donation amount of $3,000 (or more...!) to cover the costs of everything listed above. Whether you can spare $5 or $500, any donation is welcomed and appreciated from the bottom of our hearts. You can rest assured that every single cent donated will be used only for the production of this album and related items. We are also offering some sweet perks for those of you who are so inclined to claim them. If we manage to meet or surpass the requested amount, that's amazing, and the remaining money will be used for future Ghost Hotel endeavors! If we don't meet it, we will be paying for the rest of this stuff out of pocket.

"What Else Can I Do?"

If you've already donated and you're still feeling in the giving spirit, why not help us out by telling all your friends? Here are some other places you can find us hanging out on the internet:

  • Facebook - www.facebook.com/GhostHotel
  • Bandcamp - www.ghosthotel.bandcamp.com
  • Soundcloud - www.soundcloud.com/slampaxton
  • Tumblr - www.theghosthotelblog.tumblr.com
  • Email - ghosthotel.band@gmail.com

The more traction we can gain with this campaign, the more successful it will be, and by directing people to our websites, you'll be doubly helping us by giving us more fans!

Why We Do What We Do: A Personal Appeal

I remember the first time I ever listened to Set Yourself On Fire by Stars, now my favorite album of all time. I was an 18 year-old kid, lost at college and reeling from a messy and prolonged breakup with the first girl I ever loved. A friend, doing her best to ingrain me with some sense of taste in music, had suggested the album to me several months prior, but I completely forgot about it until one snowy day, faced with a long drive, I decided to give it a shot.
The album completely blew me away. It was like nothing I had ever heard before; haunting, delicate, at once both angry and apologetic. It was hopeful and yet, filled with regret. It perfectly articulated so many of the things I was feeling and could never have put into words. I was enraptured by every second of it, and by the end of it I was softly crying, alone in my car.
Set Yourself On Fire completely altered my idea of what music could be, what it could accomplish. It also made me realize that what I wanted to do, more than anything else in my life, was create something equally beautiful, something that I could share with other people. I wanted my music to say to those lonely, lost, heartbroken kids out there, “Hey, it’s going to be okay. You’re not alone.”
This album is the proudest I've ever felt about an accomplishment in my entire life. I can't remember another time that something I've been a part of managed to exceed my wildest expectations. I can't wait for every one of you to hear it. I couldn't have gotten this far without my amazing bandmates and producer, and we won't be able to make it much farther without your help.
Ghost Hotel isn’t about becoming famous. It isn’t about becoming rich. Ghost Hotel is an outlet for creating something, someday, that can hopefully encapsulate all the misery, hope, joy, anger, passion, loneliness, love, stupidity, and profound beauty that our lives have to offer. I’m not saying that this album is it, but it’s undoubtedly a stepping stone in that direction. If I can have a positive impact on even one person through my music, then I consider myself successful. And that's why we do what we do: for you.

-Sam Paxton, singer/songwriter, Ghost Hotel

story:
Welcome to the Indiegogo fundraiser campaign for

Songs of Spirit

~ the debut album of Angela Blueskies



About the Songs of Spirit recording project

Over the past couple of years I have been blessed with inspiration and have had the opportunity to create quite a lot of original music.  This past summer while on personal retreat in the Sacred Valley of Peru, I found an abundance of opportunities to share my music, and was approached almost daily by people asking where they could find recordings of these songs.  After shrugging my shoulders countless times, I began to get a clear message:  once back in the US, recording would need to become a priority.

About one week after returning to the States, I received a surprising phone call from an old colleague and friend, Bob Novak.  He said to me, "hey, you want to record?"  I was stunned and thrilled by the question, as it seemed to be the answer to my prayers.  Bob and I had both been students at the Peabody Conservatory in Baltimore, MD in the 1990s, and since graduation, both of us had shifted our careers in new and exciting directions.  I had left my path as a classical flutist to create sacred music, and Bob had begun to invest his time more and more in recording and producing music.  The energy was perfect for us to begin this collaboration, and I was delighted to begin recording within a week of our original conversation.  Only one thing was missing:  as all of this came up unexpectedly, I hadn't exactly been budgeting for making a CD! 

Musicians showed up, and resources began to show up too.  This entire recording process has been an experience in trust, and in receiving the blessings as they appear.  True to the very spiritual traditions this music comes from, my debut album, Songs of Spirit, has indeed been created out of the inspiration, faith, and devotion of all those who have contributed to it.  Bringing together mantras and sacred songs from a variety of spiritual traditions, this music connects deep to the heart, and brings people to experience peace, harmony, joy, and pure love.  At this time, the album is nearly complete, and I am excited to take the next steps toward getting it out into the world.  


Songs of Spirit ~ Music with Heart

Let's face it, there is a lot of music written and produced every day, there are many inspired and gifted musicians doing their best to get their music out to the world, and most songs are born and quickly forgotten.  What makes Songs of Spirit special, and why should you contribute to this fundraiser campaign?  Why should the music of Angela Blueskies receive your support?  

I could tell you more about my background, about my career as a musician, and about what makes me special.  But what I find much more meaningful is the essence of the music I'm sharing with the world.  While all the music on this album is original, I can't claim to be the songwriter for any of it!  When the inspiration comes, the songs are fully formed, and I'm just blessed to be listening in at the moment when Spirit shares them with me, and it is truly an honor to be able to share them with others.  These are songs that carry the essence of Peace, Love, Harmony, and Truth, and in the midst of a world filled with so much suffering and insanity, music that carries a higher vibration is a much needed contribution.  

These songs are a celebration of living from the heart, and invite the longing we all feel to connect to something greater than the mundane daily existence in this world.  Whether we realize it or not, every one of us feels this longing, and it is through sacred songs such as these that our longing is given expression.  Most of the songs on this album contain Sanskrit mantras ~ prayers from the ancient traditions of India ~ that are meant not only to connect us to the Divine and our true selves, but also to create a more beautiful, harmonious, and joyful world through choosing to remember what matters most. 


Angela's Bio

Angela Blueskies is a musician, sound healer, songkeeper, and medicine woman who carries deep understanding of the healing powers of music and the Earth. A lifelong musician, she received her training as a classical flutist at the prestigious Peabody Institute in Baltimore, MD. In her performing career, she began to long for a deeper sense of connection and presence with her audiences. It was while travelling in South America that Angela first encountered traditions that worked with songs and music for healing and transformation. Deeply influenced by sacred ceremonies in Peru and the traditions of bhakti yoga and kirtan, she began to create original music that was a fusion of these traditions, with an intention of bringing people into meditation, ecstatic states, and profound connection with Spirit. She has shared her music in concert halls, churches, schools, yoga studios, temples, in nature, and in sacred ceremony across four continents. She is an enthusiastic teacher and facilitator, and enjoys empowering people in connecting with themselves, their gifts, and their own inner wisdom. Angela currently divides her time between Washington, DC and Pisac, Peru.


Meet the amazing musicians from around the world who contributed to the creation of this album!

* Adam Kandel, guitar 

* Keith Duckworth, guitar and keyboard  

* Bob Novak, percussion (as well as recording and producing!)

* Eunice Kim, violin

* Ignacio Rodriguez, hang drum 

*  Eran Fakir, ney



What will your contribution support?

Over the past year, I had been asked far too many times “where can I find your music?”  I already knew that recording a CD was a priority for the near future. The opportunity to record Songs of Spirit came as a perfectly timed surprise, when friend and recording engineer Bob Novak proposed the project to me. We agreed to begin, and figure out the details as we went along. 

We began to record without any clarity on budget, and recording has moved forward with a momentum of its own that feels unstoppable. Weeks of recording and editing have already taken place, and the details of financing the project have been unfolding right alongside the recording process. The key element that still remains to be funded is the production of the CD itself, including original album artwork and graphic design, pressing the music to CD with beautiful packaging, and connecting with the appropriate distributors to ensure that people can easily access Songs of Spirit through online ordering and digital download. The funds raised in this campaign will cover these expenses, and will also go toward the investment in studio time, as well as supporting the incredible musicians who have come together to create this album.


How will your contribution be used?

Creating an album of original music is a complex process, and there are so many steps and people involved. All contributions made toward this project will directly fund the production of Songs of Spirit. The fundraising goal listed for this project is the absolute minimum needed to get this recording project from the studio into its final form ~ MP3s and CDs. All funds above and beyond the fundraising goal will be distributed among the amazing musicians who have contributed their hearts and creative inspiration to the album, as well as continuing to support the work of my amazing recording engineer, Bob Novak, who is recording and producing the album in Baltimore, MD.  

Here are the details: 

* original album artwork and graphic design

* supporting the work of the world class musicians who have contributed their time and energy to this album

* recording, editing, mixing, and final master of Songs of Spirit in Baltimore, MD

* the manufacture of 1000 copies of the CD Songs of Spirit packaged in full color printed sleeves

* online distribution of MP3s and CDs through various companies, including CD Baby, Amazon, and ITunes


Original album artwork and graphic design

by Peruvian Sacred Artist, Klau Kyrlian


The Perks

Any contribution is welcome, and greatly appreciated, and no amount is too small.  My heartfelt gratitude goes out to each and every person who offers kind support to this project, as it is dear to my heart!  If you're not sure how much to contribute, the listings on the side share a variety of suggested contributions and the perks offered in gratitude for your support.  Below is a bit more information about the perks I'm offering, and which contribution package you can choose to receive each perk.  Most packages include multiple perks!!

                                                    

For the first three levels of contribution, you receive part or all of the music from Songs of Spirit in MP3 and/or CD form.

One Song ~ You will receive a link to download an MP3 of a featured song from the new album once it's released.  Earthly Angel Package

Digital download ~ You will receive a link to download the entire album in MP3 format once it's released. Jai Ganesha Package

Signed CD ~ Contributors to this campaign will receive the very first copies of the CD, lovingly signed in honor of your generosity by Angela Blueskies (and possibly other musicians from the album, too)!  Sita Rama Package 


For the higher levels of contribution, I'm offering some pretty unique perks ~ check them out, and see what calls to you!

Bonus Sound Meditation MP3s ~ These bonus tracks are beautiful sound meditations, guided by Angela Blueskies, with spacious instrumental accompaniment, all professionally recorded. These are meditations featured in the Free Your Voice workshops and individual sessions, and have never before been available in recorded form.  Jaya Lakshmi Ma Package

Free Your Voice ~ This is a program that Angela has designed that brings people into connection with their true voices through working with mantras, sound meditations, and songs from many traditions. Through deep connection with the body and feelings, Angela guides participants through encounters with their own limiting beliefs and stories, and through song, participants are able to begin shifting beyond blocks and into greater personal and creative expression. As perks, you may choose one session, four sessions, or a full series of twelve, and these sessions may also be gifted to someone on your behalf.  Pachamama Ma Package, Saraswati Ma Package, Gayatri Package

Original Medicine Song ~ In some indigenous cultures, there is a tradition of a woman seeking the song of the soul of her future child, and once it is received from Spirit, it is sung to the soul of the child until birth, and to the child throughout his or her lifetime. This beautiful tradition has been lost in modern cultures, but it is Angela's heartfelt desire to bring this tradition slowly back to life. In light of this, those contributors that request an original Medicine Song will receive a personal consultation in order to determine what is most fitting for the contributor. Then, Angela will invite Spirit to send her the best mantra, words, and melody for the Medicine Song. Once it is finished, Angela will make a live recording of the song for the contributor, and it will be sent as an MP3 file. In addition, whenever Angela shares the song in the future at concerts, kirtans, or other events, the song's contributor will be recognized as the one to whom the song is dedicated.  Jai Kali Ma Package

Kirtan Concert ~ Those who contribute at this level will receive a kirtan concert with Angela Blueskies dedicated to them in their home community at a venue of their choosing. The concert can be hosted in a private home that meets necessary needs for the concert, or can be at a venue of the contributor's choice. Arrangements for the location of the kirtan concert are the responsibility of the contributor. Location for the concert must be within a reasonable driving distance of the US Northeast/Mid-Atlantic/Southeast regions. Please contact Angela to inquire about your location if you wish to contribute at this level.  Jai Hanuman Package 


For more information on any of these offerings, I invite you to visit my website:

http://angelablueskies.com/

If for some reason the fundraising goal of this campaign is not reached, all the funds will still go toward the creation of the CD, which will be released in January 2014!


Angela Blueskies and Dennis Notten in concert, August 2013

Arts of Light Center, Pisac, Peru


Other Ways You Can Help

A financial contribution isn't the only way to support Songs of Spirit in getting out into the world! I am grateful for any support in this project, and there are a few other ways I can think of that your help would be most welcome:


  1. Share this fundraiser with friends, communities, or social media pages ~ this helps to spread the word far and wide and is more valuable than you know!

  2. Feature this fundraiser and/or the release of Songs of Spirit on your website, in your newsletter, or on your blog!

  3. I am happy to share about this fundraiser and about my album in interviews ~ both print and radio/web ~ and would love to talk with you if you write this kind of article, or if you host a radio show! 

Please feel free to contact Angela at angelablueskies@gmail.com with any questions or ideas, they are most welcome!
story_txt:
Welcome to the Indiegogo fundraiser campaign for 
Songs of Spirit ~ the debut album of Angela BlueskiesAbout the Songs of Spirit recording project

	
	
	
	Over the past couple of years I have been blessed with inspiration and have had the opportunity to create quite a lot of original music.  This past summer while on personal retreat in the Sacred Valley of Peru, I found an abundance of opportunities to share my music, and was approached almost daily by people asking where they could find recordings of these songs.  After shrugging my shoulders countless times, I began to get a clear message:  once back in the US, recording would need to become a priority. About one week after returning to the States, I received a surprising phone call from an old colleague and friend, Bob Novak.  He said to me, "hey, you want to record?"  I was stunned and thrilled by the question, as it seemed to be the answer to my prayers.  Bob and I had both been students at the Peabody Conservatory in Baltimore, MD in the 1990s, and since graduation, both of us had shifted our careers in new and exciting directions.  I had left my path as a classical flutist to create sacred music, and Bob had begun to invest his time more and more in recording and producing music.  The energy was perfect for us to begin this collaboration, and I was delighted to begin recording within a week of our original conversation.  Only one thing was missing:  as all of this came up unexpectedly, I hadn't exactly been budgeting for making a CD!  Musicians showed up, and resources began to show up too.  This entire recording process has been an experience in trust, and in receiving the blessings as they appear.  True to the very spiritual traditions this music comes from, my debut album, Songs of Spirit, has indeed been created out of the inspiration, faith, and devotion of all those who have contributed to it.  Bringing together mantras and sacred songs from a variety of spiritual traditions, this music connects deep to the heart, and brings people to experience peace, harmony, joy, and pure love.  At this time, the album is nearly complete, and I am excited to take the next steps toward getting it out into the world.  Songs of Spirit ~ Music with HeartLet's face it, there is a lot of music written and produced every day, there are many inspired and gifted musicians doing their best to get their music out to the world, and most songs are born and quickly forgotten.  What makes Songs of Spirit special, and why should you contribute to this fundraiser campaign?  Why should the music of Angela Blueskies receive your support?  I could tell you more about my background, about my career as a musician, and about what makes me special.  But what I find much more meaningful is the essence of the music I'm sharing with the world.  While all the music on this album is original, I can't claim to be the songwriter for any of it!  When the inspiration comes, the songs are fully formed, and I'm just blessed to be listening in at the moment when Spirit shares them with me, and it is truly an honor to be able to share them with others.  These are songs that carry the essence of Peace, Love, Harmony, and Truth, and in the midst of a world filled with so much suffering and insanity, music that carries a higher vibration is a much needed contribution.  These songs are a celebration of living from the heart, and invite the longing we all feel to connect to something greater than the mundane daily existence in this world.  Whether we realize it or not, every one of us feels this longing, and it is through sacred songs such as these that our longing is given expression.  Most of the songs on this album contain Sanskrit mantras ~ prayers from the ancient traditions of India ~ that are meant not only to connect us to the Divine and our true selves, but also to create a more beautiful, harmonious, and joyful world through choosing to remember what matters most.  Angela's Bio

Angela Blueskies is
a musician, sound healer, songkeeper, and medicine woman who carries
deep understanding of the healing powers of music and the Earth. A
lifelong musician, she received her training as a classical flutist
at the prestigious Peabody
Institute in
Baltimore, MD. In her performing career, she began to long for a
deeper sense of connection and presence with her audiences. It was
while travelling in South America that Angela first encountered
traditions that worked with songs and music for healing and
transformation. Deeply influenced by sacred ceremonies in Peru and
the traditions of bhakti yoga and kirtan, she began to create
original music that was a fusion of these traditions, with an
intention of bringing people into meditation, ecstatic states, and
profound connection with Spirit. She
has shared her music in concert halls, churches, schools, yoga
studios, temples, in nature, and in sacred ceremony across four
continents. She is an enthusiastic teacher and facilitator, and
enjoys empowering people in connecting with themselves, their gifts,
and their own inner wisdom. Angela currently divides her time between
Washington, DC and Pisac, Peru.
Meet the amazing musicians from around the world who contributed to the creation of this album!* Adam Kandel, guitar   * Keith Duckworth, guitar and keyboard  * Bob Novak, percussion (as well as recording and producing!)* Eunice Kim, violin * Ignacio Rodriguez, hang drum  *  Eran Fakir, ney
What will your contribution support?Over the past year, I had been asked far too many times “where can I find your music?” 
I already knew that recording a CD was a priority
for the near future.  The opportunity to record Songs of Spirit
came as a perfectly timed surprise, when friend and recording engineer
Bob Novak proposed the project to me.  We agreed to begin, and figure
out the details as we went along.  We
began to record without any clarity on budget, and recording has
moved forward with a momentum of its own that feels unstoppable. 
Weeks of recording and editing have already taken place, and the
details of financing the project have been unfolding right alongside
the recording process.  The key element that still remains to be
funded is the production of the CD itself, including original album artwork
and graphic design, pressing the music to CD with beautiful packaging, and connecting with the appropriate distributors to ensure
that people can easily access Songs of Spirit through online
ordering and digital download.  The funds raised in this campaign
will cover these expenses, and will also go toward the investment in studio time, as well as supporting the incredible musicians
who have come together to create this album.
How will your contribution be used?
Creating an album of original music is a complex process, and
there are so many steps and people involved.  All contributions made
toward this project will directly fund the production of Songs of
Spirit.  The fundraising goal listed for this project is the absolute
minimum needed to get this recording project from the studio into
its final form ~ MP3s and CDs.  All funds above and beyond the fundraising goal will be distributed among the amazing musicians
who have contributed their hearts and creative inspiration to the
album, as well as continuing to support the work of my amazing recording
engineer, Bob Novak, who is recording and producing the album in Baltimore, MD.  
Here are the details:  

	* original album artwork and graphic design
* supporting the work of the world class musicians who have
contributed their time and energy to this album* recording, editing, mixing, and final master of Songs of Spirit in Baltimore, MD* the manufacture of 1000 copies of the CD Songs of Spirit packaged in full color printed sleeves
* online distribution of MP3s and CDs through various companies, including CD Baby, Amazon, and ITunes
Original album artwork and graphic design by Peruvian Sacred Artist, Klau KyrlianThe PerksAny contribution is welcome, and greatly appreciated, and no amount is too small.  My heartfelt gratitude goes out to each and every person who offers kind support to this project, as it is dear to my heart!  If you're not sure how much to contribute, the listings on the side share a variety of suggested contributions and the perks offered in gratitude for your support.  Below is a bit more information about the perks I'm offering, and which contribution package you can choose to receive each perk.  Most packages include multiple perks!!                                                     For the first three levels of contribution, you receive part or all of the music from Songs of Spirit in MP3 and/or CD form.One Song ~ You will
receive a link to download an MP3 of a featured song from the new
album once it's released.  Earthly Angel Package

Digital download ~ You
will receive a link to download the entire album in MP3 format once
it's released. Jai Ganesha Package

Signed CD ~ Contributors
to this campaign will receive the very first copies of the CD,
lovingly signed in honor of your generosity by Angela Blueskies (and
possibly other musicians from the album, too)!  Sita Rama Package For the higher levels of contribution, I'm offering some pretty unique perks ~ check them out, and see what calls to you!
Bonus Sound Meditation MP3s ~
These bonus tracks are beautiful sound meditations, guided by Angela
Blueskies, with spacious instrumental accompaniment, all professionally recorded.  These are
meditations featured in the Free Your Voice workshops and individual
sessions, and have never before been available in recorded form.  Jaya Lakshmi Ma Package

Free Your Voice ~ This is
a program that Angela has designed that brings people into connection
with their true voices through working with mantras, sound
meditations, and songs from many traditions.  Through deep connection
with the body and feelings, Angela guides participants through
encounters with their own limiting beliefs and stories, and through
song, participants are able to begin shifting beyond blocks and into
greater personal and creative expression.  As perks, you may choose
one session, four sessions, or a full series of twelve, and these
sessions may also be gifted to someone on your behalf.  Pachamama Ma Package, Saraswati Ma Package, Gayatri Package

Original Medicine Song ~ In
some indigenous cultures, there is a tradition of a woman seeking the
song of the soul of her future child, and once it is received from
Spirit, it is sung to the soul of the child until birth, and to the
child throughout his or her lifetime.  This
beautiful tradition has been lost in modern cultures, but it is
Angela's heartfelt desire to bring this tradition slowly back to
life.  In light of this, those contributors that request an original
Medicine Song will receive a personal consultation in order to
determine what is most fitting for the contributor.  Then, Angela
will invite Spirit to send her the best mantra, words, and melody for
the Medicine Song.  Once it is finished, Angela will make a live
recording of the song for the contributor, and it will be sent as an
MP3 file.  In addition, whenever Angela shares the song in the future
at concerts, kirtans, or other events, the song's contributor will be
recognized as the one to whom the song is dedicated.  Jai Kali Ma Package

Kirtan Concert ~ Those
who contribute at this level will receive a kirtan concert with
Angela Blueskies dedicated to them in their home community at a venue
of their choosing.  The concert can be hosted in a private home that
meets necessary needs for the concert, or can be at a venue of the
contributor's choice.  Arrangements for the location of the kirtan
concert are the responsibility of the contributor.  Location for the
concert must be within a reasonable driving distance of the US
Northeast/Mid-Atlantic/Southeast regions.  Please contact Angela to
inquire about your location if you wish to contribute at this level.  Jai Hanuman Package For more information on any of these offerings, I invite you to visit my website:http://angelablueskies.com/
If for some reason the fundraising goal of this campaign is not reached, all the funds will still go toward the
creation of the CD, which will be released in January 2014!Angela Blueskies and Dennis Notten in concert, August 2013Arts of Light Center, Pisac, PeruOther Ways You Can Help
	
	
	
	A financial contribution isn't the only way to support Songs of
Spirit in getting out into the world!  I am grateful for any
support in this project, and there are a few other ways I can think
of that your help would be most welcome:


Share this fundraiser with friends, communities, or
	social media pages ~ this helps to spread the word far and wide and
	is more valuable than you know!


Feature this fundraiser and/or the release of Songs of
	Spirit on your website, in your newsletter, or on your blog!

I am happy to share about this fundraiser and about my album
	in interviews ~ both print and radio/web ~ and would love to talk
	with you if you write this kind of article, or if you host a radio
	show!  
Please feel free to contact Angela at angelablueskies@gmail.com with any questions or ideas, they are most welcome!

story:
This is the fully-staged performance of La Traviata from April 23, 2013.  The same cast put on a flashmob event in New York on May 15, 2013.

Christian Amonson of Arts Laureate recorded the fully staged performance of our production of LA TRAVIATA on April 23, 2013 at the Kimball Theatre in Williamsburg, Virginia.  The cast included Emily Duncan-Brown as Violetta, Won Whi Choi as Alfredo, and Jose Sacin as Germont; the conductor was Paul Nadler of the Metropolitan Opera; the directors were Carlos Conde and Mathieu Guertin, with producer Naama Zahavi-Ely.

The same cast, with Carlos Conde and Mathieu Guertin as directors and Jamison Livsey as pianist/music director, put on a flashmob event on May 15, 2013 at a reception honoring Vital Voices at Alice Kandell's penthouse in Manhattan.  The first few minutes of the event were recorded by professional cameramen under the direction of Jonathan Estabrooks, who edited the recording into a YouTube video, http://youtu.be/suT_bn-RWFA.

Supporters of Opera in Williamsburg may get the DVD of the full opera from the Williamsburg performance by contributing here to the cost of recording.  The DVD will not be available for sale. 

Opera in Williamsburg is dedicated to bringing to Williamsburg, Virginia fully-staged professional opera with outstanding cast and staff and minimal investment in sets, scenery, and costumes. Please see our web site at www.operainwilliamsburg.org

The expenses of bringing live fully-staged opera to the Kimball Theatre in Williamsburg, Virginia cannot be covered by ticket sales alone, even when the theater is sold out (as happened in this performance).  Please give generously.  Your support will be recognized on our web site and in future printed programs.

Any money left over after covering the cost of recording will go to cover performance expenses of Opera in Williamsburg.  Contributions are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

As of January 2013, Opera in Williamsburg is fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas, a national non-profit organization, and can receive tax-deductible contributions through them.  Opera in Williamsburg is currently in the process of creating a non-profit organization and a support board.  We welcome involvement.  Please get in touch with us at info@operainwilliamsburg.org

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Jeffrey Kelly, and I am the founder of Rökkur Production. As a long-time fan of various subgenres of industrial/EBM, gothic, and metal music I have often run into the problem that the bands I want to see rarely come to Seattle, or even the USA oftentimes. I plan to change this. By creating Edge Fest I hope to create a quarterly industrial music festival where all can come together to experience a show unlike any other, and even better, meet the bands in the process! 

In addition to being a kick-ass concert, all proceeds from the concert will be donated directly to KNHC, Seattle's own non-profit radio station to keep Seattle's hottest music and late-night industrial host Paul from On The Edge on the air COMMERCIAL FREE!

Edge Fest will take place on Friday, January 31st at Studio Seven in Seattle Washington.

Show Lineup

HANZEL UND GRETYL

STIFF VALENTINE

MORDACIOUS

PRODUCT

And more to be announced!


What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal--As awesome as shows are, they tend to be expensive to organize. Luckily, most of us can just enjoy the show without needing to worry about the financial aspect. I, however, do not get to enjoy that luxury. As this is the very first Edge Fest night, I need to raise between $750 and $1,000 in order to reach my fundraising goal to put on this show. All money I receive from these donations will go directly towards transportation and lodging for the bands (not all of them can sleep on my couch), promotions, props, and lights. Our headliner for this event is NYC-based HANZEL UND GRETYL. And as excited as I am to have them, I have to face the harsh reality that it will cost about $350 just to fly them into Washington. As you can see, all money donated to this cause will go towards a great benefit, and we would be forever grateful for your generosity. Any money that exceeds our goal will go towards future events for bringing in headliners from outside of the USA!

So, now that the boring aspect of us needing a little financial step-up to get this show started is over, how about the more interesting part--what you get in return for your donations!

There are various donation levels, and for pledging at different levels you can be entitled to win some awesome thank-you gifts ranging from signed posters, VIP tickets, season-passes, instruments and production gear, and even limited-edition and signed merchandise from all sorts of bands in the scene! 

The Impact

KNHC, otherwise known as C89.5 has been a long-operating dance radio station in Seattle Washington. They have been on the air for over 40 years 100% commercial free all thanks to listener support and donations. However, the pressure to raise enough money for the annual $800,000 budget can be stressful and chaotic for everyone. In order to help keep this public radio station alive I feel it is my duty to support them, and I need your help.

 I volunteered at C89.5 for nearly 3 years as an on-air host and production manager. I know how it feels to be in the hot spot being unsure of whether or not we would make our goal and if we would have to close down the station. I know they fear that every year. But I aim to lessen that fear. I want to support the radio station and all those who donate their time to keep it alive and playing all of Seattle's hottest music commercial free.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course not everybody can donate money--I totally understand. Money is tight these days, and people have to be careful with their spending. If it isn't within your financial ability to donate to the cause but would still like to get involved to help get this show on the road, then any form of promotion you could lend to the event would be spectacular. Simply sharing the event or this fundraiser on Facebook or Twitter is enough to show your support for making this event a reality. 

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to email me at rokkurproduction@gmail.com

story:
I'm Schuyler Neilson. I'm an aspiring musician and that's all I wanna do. I'm almost 18, and I'm finally breaking into the professional music world in a big way. I get to go on tour in Europe from December 4th through January 7th! In addition, most expenses are paid. Most. I still need help getting money for my plane ticket over there, and a portion of the living expenses. I've wanted to get my name to Europe as a musician practically my whole life, and this is my chance! Your help means the world to me.

We still need $1500 to get me over there. Once there, the people who arrange the tour are putting us up in musician housing which we have to help pay for. And we have prizes! If you donate $2 dollars or more, you'll get recordings that I played on. $5 gets you the same, plus stickers of the band. During the tour we'll be taking a bunch of photos and making a booklet at the end which could be yours for $10, or a poster from the tour for $15. $25 gets you a cd we're putting together of separate projects from all of the different musicians going on the tour. Lastly, if you go huge and donate $100 or more, you get an album of live recordings from the tour!

This has been a life long dream of mine, and is a GREAT chance to help me get out there to do what I've always wanted to do for a career… Music! This may also be my only chance (or at least for a long long time) to get across the pond which is a great place to make it as a musician, so this is super important to me.

Of course not everyone can contribute right now, as we are living in rough times. But that doesn't mean you can't help! We also need help spreading word of this fundraiser. Helping send this to your friends so as many people as possible get to see helps immensely!

Thanks so much!

story:
Short Summary

Well hello out there! I am so happy that you've decided to check out my campaign. 
Firstly, my name is Nick Gibbs. I like to think of myself as a musician, but you may think of me as a singer, composer, songwriter, teacher, father, husband, lover of life.
I'm an Australian living in Germany. I've studied the voice....continue to study the voice (and also teach singing) to around 40 wonderful students. 
I love writing music that transports you to another place. My place. My Life.

Recently, I released my first EP, "Comfortable Being", funded by Monkeymo Records, an independent record company in Munich. 

The "Comfortable Being" EP has certainly received wonderful support from many people all over this earth, but unfortunately I just don't have the funds to pay for the rest of the album to be  produced and recorded (this is, of course, where you come in!!)

 

Supporting this project means supporting an exciting, extremely creative artist with all the funds necessary to release my first album and hopefully, with your help. have a shot at the world stage! Or at least take the next HUGE step in my music career.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Quite simply, I need to raise something around the 15 000€ mark. I've made this calculation considering the amount of money the Comfortable Being EP cost, and the scope of the rest of the album (including everything from orchestration to studio time, session musicians to printing costs), this seems like a realistic number.

All of the material is written, and is just sitting there, patiently waiting to be awesomely arranged and produced like the three songs on the Comfortable Being EP were!

Of course I don't expect to get something for nothing, though. Nuh-uh. No way. Check out my perks and you may just want to get involved! 

Pledge 30€ and receive a physical copy of the finished CD plus a digital download. and thank you on my website!

Pledge 100€ and receive a signed copy of the finished CD, digital download, Nick Gibbs merchandise and a personal mention in the CD liner notes!

Pledge 1000€ and receive all of the above PLUS either an acoustic concert at your party/event OR a song written personally for YOU by ME! Imagine that!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, it DOESN'T MEAN YOU CAN'T HELP! You can go and download the Comfortable Being EP RIGHT NOW from iTunes, amazon, googleplay or CD Baby...or stream it with Spotify or Simfy. Also, don't forget to share the youtube video or just simply tell all your friends if you think the music is any good!

Thank you all so much! So so so so much!

Much love and good karma....

 

Nick G
story_txt:
Short Summary
Well hello out there! I am so happy that you've decided to check out my campaign. Firstly, my name is Nick Gibbs. I like to think of myself as a musician, but you may think of me as a singer, composer, songwriter, teacher, father, husband, lover of life.I'm an Australian living in Germany. I've studied the voice....continue to study the voice (and also teach singing) to around 40 wonderful students. I love writing music that transports you to another place. My place. My Life.Recently, I released my first EP, "Comfortable Being", funded by Monkeymo Records, an independent record company in Munich. 
The "Comfortable Being" EP has certainly received wonderful support from many people all over this earth, but unfortunately I just don't have the funds to pay for the rest of the album to be  produced and recorded (this is, of course, where you come in!!)
 
Supporting this project means supporting an exciting, extremely creative artist with all the funds necessary to release my first album and hopefully, with your help. have a shot at the world stage! Or at least take the next HUGE step in my music career.
 


What We Need & What You Get
Quite simply, I need to raise something around the 15 000€ mark. I've made this calculation considering the amount of money the Comfortable Being EP cost, and the scope of the rest of the album (including everything from orchestration to studio time, session musicians to printing costs), this seems like a realistic number.All of the material is written, and is just sitting there, patiently waiting to be awesomely arranged and produced like the three songs on the Comfortable Being EP were!
Of course I don't expect to get something for nothing, though. Nuh-uh. No way. Check out my perks and you may just want to get involved! 
Pledge 30€ and receive a physical copy of the finished CD plus a digital download. and thank you on my website!
Pledge 100€ and receive a signed copy of the finished CD, digital download, Nick Gibbs merchandise and a personal mention in the CD liner notes!
Pledge 1000€ and receive all of the above PLUS either an acoustic concert at your party/event OR a song written personally for YOU by ME! Imagine that!
 
Other Ways You Can Help


Even if you can't contribute, it DOESN'T MEAN YOU CAN'T HELP! You can go and download the Comfortable Being EP RIGHT NOW from iTunes, amazon, googleplay or CD Baby...or stream it with Spotify or Simfy. Also, don't forget to share the youtube video or just simply tell all your friends if you think the music is any good!Thank you all so much! So so so so much!Much love and good karma....
 
Nick G

story:
My Name is Kimberly Federoff...

I'm 25 years old and I have been studying musical theater for the last year at the American Musical and Dramatic Academy College and Conservatory of the Performing Arts (AMDA) in Hollywood. 

For my 3rd semester the school makes it available for students to take a semester in New York City, if they are in good academic standing and maintain a 3.0 GPA. Not every student eligible gets to go, but I have been selected to attend beginning the fall semester 2013. 

I am very excited about this. Unfortunately I don't have all the funds I need to attend... THAT'S WHERE YOU COME IN!


I HAVE A DREAM...

AMDA is very prestigious musical academy in the performing arts world. By your generous donation I will be continuing this amazing education and be that much closer to receiving my bachelor’s degree in musical theater, and one day achieving my ultimate dream of performing on Broadway.  

This is a once in a life time opportunity for me to study under some of the best singing, musical theater, and acting coaches in the business, and also get the chance to be in the city I will eventually live in once I finish my education at AMDA.



What I Need & What You Get

FINANCIAL BREAK DOWN

SO... the amount I am going to raise is $7,500. That will cover my tuition & housing payments, my air fare to and from New York, books I will need to purchase for my classes, student fees, and living expenses.


YOUR PERKS 

Some of the perks you can get if you donate include; a digital copy of the song from this video, a shout out on Facebook and Twitter, 
  • Enjoy an EVENING FOR TWO at Opening Night of MY First Show on Broadway! 
  • A personal concert at your house for you and your friends 
  • Two FREE tickets to any show I'm performing in for 2014
  • A call on your birthday  
  • A "thank you" video of me singing a song 
  • An Autographed 8x10 Glossy  
  • A digital copy of my Christmas CD 
  • A digital recording of the song from this video
  • A shout out on Facebook and Twitter 
  • And the chance to say you knew me when (ha-ha, just kidding) :)


Claim Your Perks!

If you would like to claim your perks, please email me at:

kimberlyannfed@gmail.com

so i can get them to you asap! thank you


WHY I AM REACHING OUT 

If I do not raise all the money I need, unfortunately I will not be able to go to New York. My family does not have the funds to help me at the moment, which is why I’m reaching out to you. The impact your donation will have is tremendous


    The Impact

    It has been my dream for as long as I can remember to perform and eventually go to Broadway. I strongly believe that when you find something you are passionate about in life, you go for it! Well it may be a struggle at times, but I'm definitely going for it. 

    My family has always supported me in everything I do so it's a bit hard for them to not be able to help out as much as they would like to. They all believe that I have the talent and the drive to really go far and I'd really like to be able to prove them right. 

    By you contributing, you are helping me continue my education in the art of musical theater and helping me get my Bachelors of Fine Arts degree, which I will use to teach kids about music and self expression through the arts while pursuing my musical theatre career. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    I know times are tough right now and not everyone can contribute but there are other ways you can help:

    • SPREAD THE WORD! I can’t do this solely by my own word of mouth; I need the help of everyone to get the word out there. If you could please post the link on Facebook or Twitter or any other Social Networking site that would be amazing! 
    • Also tell your friends who may not have Social Media who might be interested in donating a dollar or two towards someone’s future.


    My Resume 

    • The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee                                                                         Rona Lisa Peretti - Centre Stage Inc. 

    • Sweeney Todd                                                                                                                              Johanna - Haugh Performing Arts Center                                                                                                   
    • Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dream Coat                                                                 Narrator - Candlelight Pavilion, Claremont CA

    • Oklahoma                                                                                                                                      Laurie - Duarte Performing Arts Center 
    • Phantom of the Opera                                                                                                                Featured - Haugh Performing Arts Center
    • The Rocky Horror Show                                                                                                             Featured Soloist - Citrus Little Theater
    • Seussical                                                                                                                                      Bird Girl - Candlelight Pavilion, Claremont CA
    • Beauty and the Beast                                                                                                                 Towns person (soloist) - Haugh Performing Arts Center
    • The Will Rodgers Follies                                                                                                             Follies Girl - Centre Stage Inc.
    • Into the Woods                                                                                                                             The Witch - Monrovia Center Theater 
    • Into the Woods                                                                                                                             Rapunzel - Centre Stage Inc. 
    • The Sound of Music                                                                                                                    Louisa - Candlelight Pavilion, Claremont CA
    • Honk                                                                                                                                              Penny - Candlelight Pavilion, Claremont CA
    • The Sound of Music                                                                                                                    Leisl - Monrovia Centre Theater
    • Pirates of Penzance                                                                                                                   Constance (daughter) - Haugh Performing Arts Center
    • Tom Sawyer                                                                                                                                 Mrs. Harper - Baldwin Park Performing Arts Center


    Ways to Connect 

    • https://www.facebook.com/thepixieproject13
    • http://www.youtube.com/kimberlyannfed2
    • https://twitter.com/Kimberlyann_fed

story: I’ve been singing, songwriting and recording music now for the last 13yrs. I’ve also, for the last 13yrs, made my living as a Psychiatric Nurse. These two paths have at times had me engaged in the deepest of tug-of-wars to say the least. But never the less, while working in and out of different treatment facilities, mental institutions and most recently jail, I have quietly and methodically worked at my craft, visualizing the day when I could live fully in my artistry. Working at the jail, when an inmate would get released they went “ATW”. I used to joke with my co-workers sometimes about how I was waiting for my “ATW”. Be careful what you pray for….right? About 2 months ago, this past June, I was fired from my job. After a conversation with a good friend about what to do next, I was inspired to start “The ATW Series”. Basically it’s a series of performances once a month for six months that speak to the idea of getting free in every possible way. My intention is that by documenting and sharing my process of getting free, that it may inspire or encourage someone else in their own process.

story:
Greetings brothers,

We have some unfortunate news, Bro. Mike Yancey lost his mom on Friday, July 13. She passed away in St. Louis.

Bro. Yancey has always been there for all of us, and now we need to come together and be there for him during this difficult time.

We'd like to extend our condolences to Bro. Yancey and his family, and we're asking everyone to donate what you can so we can send a card, flowers, money, etc. on behalf of the brothers that he has always been there for.

Please spread the word, and let's come together and show Bro. Yancey that we're here for him.

Please note: The goal is set at $500 - but we know we can raise much more than that to help the Yancey family - and please list your name on your donation so Bro. Yancey knows where the support is coming from.

All proceeds will go to Bro. Yancey.

For any questions/concerns, contact me at MFeeney001@gmail.com.

06!

Bro. Michael J. Feeney

GS FA 03

story:
Everything We Do, We Do It For YOU

We are The Vespertines, a different kind of rock band from Long Beach, CA.  Check us out at theVespertines.com.

 

We are recording our first full-length album in July!  We want to give life to the songs we've been playing for the last year, and we're asking for your help to do it.  We'll be recording in Long Beach at The Compound Studio (The Mars Volta, Crystal Antlers, Dusty Rhodes & The River Band) for 7 days and will release our new work in August.

 

Our budget for recording, mixing, mastering & duplication is $5,000, and we need your generous donations to make this whole thing happen.  This album will be our first release since 2009's Gravity Optional EP. We can't wait to put out some new Vespertines music for you!

 

Please get the word out on Facebook, Twitter, Myspace, and by using your hands, feet, and face.  Check out our video & the perks packages for extra-generous donors.

 

Stay tuned for new content, including a music video featuring a song from our new album.


Regards,


Vanessa, Kyle, Alex & Chris

story:
hexaCollective is a group of singers that works to fill the niche between choral ensemble and soloists, creating an opportunity to explore solo options while growing as a vocal ensemble.


The origin of the name hexaCollective draws from the six voice categories (soprano, mezzo-soprano, alto, tenor, baritone, bass). The collective also includes instrumentalists, composers and other collaborators.

This Baltimore/DC based group's foundation is centered on the desire to explore possibilities in new works, some commissioned specifically for the ensemble or rarely performed pieces, with the intent of premiering several such works.


Our inaugural hexaSeason 2011/12 relies heavily on the funding that we are able to raise from strangers, friends, family, colleagues, fans, our heroes and superheroes. The projected season launches with:


hexaFAMILY - JULY 17th, THEATER PROJECT BALTIMORE When people ask what we do for a living and we say "I'm a classical singer" the response is often "Oh, you mean opera?" This event will show the audience that there is more to classical singing than opera.  An interactive family concert/workshop introducing people of all ages to the classical voice featuring the East Coast premiere of Libby Larsen's STONE SOUP!



Future plans include Marathon, Media and Salon concerts and that's to start...


Donations will allow us to book appropriate venues, pay our performers, commission composers and build our outreach program.

Thank you for your support and interest in hexaCollective! We're excited about this new collaboration and hope that you are too. :-)

story:
Who we are

We're Cryin' Cole Wilson & Those Miserable Cowboys! A country band that plays country. Plain and simple. Mostly originals with a Magnetic Fields cover here and there. We cry ALOT and listin to Hank Williams and Wilco while we do it. Boo hoo

 

What we're out to do


We are planning to spend 3 days recording at Premium Studios here in Austin http://www.premiumrecording.com/home.html

The money donated will help us to afford such a high quality space, allowing us to make a truly GREAT sounding record. So, so purty.

 

Why should you donate?

Well, good question... how about Please? Cause we've always wanted to make a Bon-a-fide record? Seriously though, it would help imensely. If we could shell out to make it we certainly would, but times are tough and groceries come first, so any help at all would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Our Story

Café Teatro Batey Urbano, a project of the Puerto Rican Cultural Center is a 9 year cultural space/youth center for action and reflection for Puerto Rican/Latino youth. We seek to create meaningful linkages between universities and the community, based on grassroots activism. Premised on the notion that our memories (our history) are the source of our imagination, Batey Urbano is a space for critical expression through spoken word, poetry, dancing, music, painting, and writing. We achieve this by fusing cultural expression and technology as means of organizing in creative ways, our work builds on the human and social capital of our community to develop youth leadership in our many programs and projects. We seek to develop holistic multi- dimensional programming that includes multi-media technology, asset mapping and community involvement. The mission of the Batey Urbano is provide alternatives that are youth-led and youth-driven. We strive for a participatory process that is transformative not only using traditional means of expression but also non traditional forms and variations, thus creating hybrids of multi-media and multi-artistic projects to address youth issues in a creative manner. Simultaneously we actively engage youth in discussing broader community issues and defining solutions. The result of this work, which is both ongoing and continually reflective, has seen a growing number of youth community builders between the ages of 13 and 25 involved in the Batey’s many projects. These organizing experiences have proven to us the importance of culture, identity and youth participation as a base for positive youth development.

The Impact

Our youth in the greater Humboldt Park Community face some of the most difficult things everyday; unstable homes. drug abuse, gang violence, peer pressure, and gentrification. Our space provides them with alternatives through the arts. Our youth are able to tell their stories through poetry, music, dancing, and a cultural expression. We give our youth a space to be heard, we allow them to tell the stories our society like to ignore. We change and save lives, we give our youth alternatives and create agents of change. Our youth are the future and its about time we treat them as if they are so.


What We Need & What You Get

We need money to be able to keep our space up and running, with every good project comes obstacles, and ours has been raising the money neccesary to keep our space. With out our space our youth hae no where to go.

When you donate:

  • You get to enter a night of expression for free.
  • Get a Batey Urbano Mixtape Volume 1
  • Get to save a youths life

Other Ways You Can Help

Check out our nights of expression! And attend, hear our youth out, come support their work and our space!!

Thank You!!

http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1177618097149.19800.1729028073#!/bateyurbano

story:
About Us

     My good friend Danny and I are both saxophone players from NY and we need YOUR HELP to get our new project under way!  Danny and I have always had a passion for performing with jazz big bands and other large ensembles.  We love writing the music as well as the thrill of playing our music with others.  Along with an incredible roster of fellow musicians and friends, Danny and I think we can contribute to and expand upon the tradition of a beautiful and incredible art form!  

     The #DRMCGRoove is about moving people who enjoy all styles of music, like we do.  Whether it is covering one of the greatest R&B tunes, with our own twist, or expressing our own original compositions, the hope is to always reach out to people and share the wonderful experience of live music!  

     Our large ensemble, a Big Band, will consist of:

5 Saxophones

4 Trumpets

4 Trombones

Piano, Bass, Drums

     This group will be playing mostly originals by Danny and myself; but certainly some of our favorites from this extensive genre, old and new, will make their way into the sets.  With our combined catalogues, Danny and I have already managed to put a book together of over 50 charts!

     The second group we will be recording with will be a smaller (but still large!) ensemble with 8 horns:

4 Saxophones

2 Trumpets

2 Trombones

Piano/Keyboards, Bass, Drums, Guitar, and 2 Vocals

     This group will be playing our versions of some of our favorite covers in the attempt to make anyone and everyone move to the music!  We will be covering everything from 30's swing to R&B and Rhianna!  This band will host swing dances, play dance clubs, and book parties of all kinds, so give us a call!  Our book for this band grows daily as we think of new songs! 

     We will also be filming the whole session, so keep reading to the "Perks" to find out how to get a behind the scenes look!  

                                           The Process

     Undertaking a project like this is never easy.  The monetary difficulties aside, it is hard simply to find all the right musicians and book a space to rehearse with a band with 13 horns!  But in the attempt to bring everyone into the process, we've broken down our expenses so that everyone knows where their money will be spent!

Recording Studio = $1500.00

Film Equipment = $600.00 

Film Editing = $350

Demo CD Pressed = $1300

DVD = 500

Band Pay = $1000.00 (But all our players are at the top of their fields and deserve

                             more! Many of our musicians believe in our music and for that we

                             thank them, but they have earned every penny we can offer!)

     There's always more expenses with a project such as this, and if we were to go over our goal, money would then be allocated towards a PA System, microphones, stand fronts, band folders, etc!  We have set a goal for this drive that could cover most of our recording expenses, but whether we reach it or not, anything helps!    

                                         Conclusion

     The ultimate goal once we finish recording is to have a great demo CD with accompanying DVD.  Videos will be up our websites etc, but we will have a special copy of the DVD with extra footage of the session for those who contribute generously!  We really can't thank you enough for taking the time to check out our project!  Your help will go not only towards promoting our professional career, but towards spreading the awe-inspiring beauty of large ensemble music!  So again, from the bottom of our hearts, Danny and I want to thank everyone for their contributions!

                              Other Ways You Can Help

     If you can't contribute, we understand, but you can still help us by promoting our presence on the internet and spreading the word amongst your friends!  You can follow Danny and I on Twitter at @dannyriveranyc and @chiassonworks or find us both on Facebook and Soundcloud!
