story:
Short Summary

We're Back! Thank you for visiting our new Indiegogo campaign page. We're onto the next exciting stage of our musical journey and glad to have you on board with us!

If you are new to Little Spear – Welcome to the tribe! If you'd like to read up on our initial campaign, you can find it HERE

Get a Taste! enjoy a sample demo of two of our songs which were further developed in the forthcoming studio album (Many thanks to James Metcalf @ San Jacinto College for his work engineering these demos):

Catch A Wave 

Rubicon 

FAST FORWARD To The PRESENT:Little Spear has returned from the Austin area and the frenetic pace of the studio. Having had a week to rest our fingers/voices, ears and minds, we are ready to kick off again!

We know many of you have been waiting patiently for the new launch to donate, so we thank you! Yes, we know who you are and we’d still love your help, even if it’s just time and energy! Read ahead at "OTHER WAYS TO HELP" to find out more about how you can continue to support Little Spear without sending us money.

                      Who We Are

pictured above: Producer "Frenchie", Spearhead Sherita, Spearhead Rhonda, Co-Producer & Spearhead Pauly.

Little Spear is a robust and dynamic female folk pop and indie rock songwriting duo from the USA Gulf Coast region. Despite humble means and origins we have diverse and imaginative influences ranging overs several generations of popular musical genres both native to the USA and abroad. Rhonda Roberts and Sherita Perez came together in a bizarre twist of fate leading to their first unassuming show playing some original works and a mini -Talking Heads tribute set together at a ukulele showcase in Austin this past Fall 2013. Joining them on drums for the show, Pauly "Deathwish" Etheredge has since become an integral part of the Little Spear team, assisting in both management/direction and production as Rhonda and Sherita continue to combine their individual talents and fuse their independent musical trajectories. Pauly's friend and colleague, Chris "Frenchie" Smith  is a prominent producer in the Austin area whose professional services were enlisted in the making of Little Spear's forthcoming debut album. Together, the collaboration has helped pave the way for fresh new takes on beloved solo repertory compositions of both Rhonda and Sherita and fostered an ambition to create new magical musical concoctions as a songwriting team. 

Find out more and follow LittleSpear on the Web:

FACEBOOK     TWITTER     TUMBLR     YOUTUBE     SOUNDCLOUD     VIMEO

What We Need & What You Get

Although we aimed high and fell short our first campaign, we accomplished much and we’re staying positive! Plus, we have a lot more creative perks to offer! We feel blessed knowing you helped us raise nearly $3,000 with just 44 contributions in just under 3 weeks! That’s quite a testimonial! GO TEAM!

We want to raise another $3,000+ in the next 3 weeks.

That’s the goal for this funder. Here’s how it roughly breaks down :

  1. Pay off our outstanding debt on film production
  2. Pay to have our final mix professionally mastered
  3. Pay to have CD and artwork printed, and 1000 units duplicated and shipped to Little Spear HQ for initial promo release and pledge fulfilment.
  4. Pay our campaign fees to Indiegogo and PayPal.

WE CHOOSE PAYPAL: Time is of the essence and every penny counts! By meeting this $3,000 goal post through PayPal-driven contributions, we will be able to immediately draw upon the funds as they come in instead of waiting on a 15-day bank transfer after the campaign deadline to start using funds. This will shorten our projected timeline to pledge fulfilment. Remember, you can pay using a credit card through PayPal as well as a linked bank account and this service is free to sign up for -- PLUS, purchase fees are on us, not you. 

What's more - We think you'll like us and what we're prepared to give you:

1. Limited edition autographed *alluring* pin-up poster! Get Speared by our Brains, Brass AND Beauty - Little Spear has it all and we're proud of it! We love the old classy vintage pinup pic for being both provocative and tasteful. We are preparing a limited run of 100 professionally photographed 11x17 autographed band pinup posters, although you won't find it pictured here, silly... wait for the reveal! ;) SEE PERK "Alluring Pin-Up Poster +CDpack"

2. Let us write a song for you! Sherita and I know how to craft catchy memorable songs - we want to put that power in your hands. Have us write a song for you about a topic you choose that will have special meaning to you and for you alone. Share a Little Spear personalized youtube video performance of your song with friends and family and keep the commemorative composition as a digital download. SEE PERK "Whole Shebang+ Yr Own Song!"

3. Get a signed commemorative Little Spear ukulele or guitar and lesson/jam! We're adopting and modifying an old adage here, but "Play a man a song, please him for a day; Give a man an instrument and teach him how to play, please him all his life!" Let us give you the gift that truly keeps giving, hell we'll even bake you a cake and make it a party. Invite your friends and we'll all have a jam! SEE PERK "Punch & Pie Guitar O’ My!"

4. Be part of the creative process, get your Little Spear endorsement!-  In addition to any number of tangible goods, help direct our next video, photoshoot, recording, wardrobe purchase... you name it! If you want to help get us there, we'll honor (within reason, of course) your creative input! If you don't have any direction but would still like to be recognized for your contribution, we can acknowledge you in the format of your choice. We'll be making recorded dedications, posting to our forthcoming website at littlespear.com and of course printing thank yous in our album liner notes. If you're a business, have us endorse your name and/or product! SEE PERK "The Producer"

AND SO MUCH MORE.... Little Spear has many reasonably priced pledge offerings, but even if you only contribute $1.00, you're entitled to the exclusive goodies of being an official Indiegogo pledge backer. We are diligently keeping track of all campaign pledges so far and stockpiling our inventory of virtual treats. Soon we will be publishing our Little Spear newsletter and will have special editions with content shared only with contributors - to let you know you matter and we care!

After this campaign ends, we will take stock of where we are and, if necessary, continue to raise funds towards production, printing, and shipping costs on all our offered perks across multiple campaigns. We are prepared to see this project through, no matter what -- even at our own expense (we have already resorted to this in order to meet previous deadlines). This isn't easy for us and we'll be paying our debts for some time, but that's how much we believe in ourselves and our music. We're glad we don't have to go it alone and thank you for all your help along the way!

The Impact

Altogether, we estimate an essential need for ~$10,000 net profit to back and/or recover from this project venture. That's in addition to what we've already raised and includes our current funding target of $3,000. While the number seems high to us two little ladies in Seabrook,Texas, we have carefully added everything up that is going into this and have been assured the figure is a modest request.

Raising that amount as quickly as possible will mean a great deal to us -- and for all those touched by Little Spear's vision-- for all the following reasons: 

1. We want to make good on our projected May 31, 2014 delivery deadline. As established in our first campaign, we want to honor our commitments and present our fans and supporters with quality product worthy of your time and money contributions.

2. It takes money to make money. Paying for quality product means we can rep ourselves with pride. It arms us for greater future opportunities providing an avenue forward to financial independence and career success.This is huge because it means less reliance on continued crowd funding, the caprice of others' good will and favors. and soul-destroying day jobs or multiple-income stream management which removes us from our practiced trade and passion. 

3. We are "starving" to feed the world.   We are passionate about ART. Artists constantly inspire innovation, invention and new philosophies and provide succor, happiness and relief to people of all backgrounds and professions. The value of such art is priceless in the course of human history, yet the vast majority of professional artists in our modern age struggle to keep a roof over their heads and food on the table --ain't it a shame? Well, we don't want a handout, though we often need it. Rhonda and Sherita are not musicians solely for monetary gain - If that were so, we'd have chosen another line of work, believe me! Few make it big in this industry anymore and we know it. We make music because we are compelled to, driven to - if we don't make music, we grow despondent. Fortunately for you, we also happen to be pretty good at it and believe the value of our art will increase over time --hopefully in our own lifetimes! But you don't have to take our word for it. As the saying goes, "The proof of the pudding is in the eating!" 

We know you can help us make an impact. 

We believe in paying it forward! Help us raise enough money to kickstart our goals so that we can follow our dream of getting out on the road, living sustainably off our work as artists, and engaging with new fans --spreading the love and endorsing the arts and our cultural history and heritage wherever we go! In return, we pledge our commitment to nurture and mentor future generations who value art as we do. We don't want to compete for favor to others' detriment or our own self-aggrandisement. We want ART to mean something nobler.

Other Ways You Can Help

We’re taking a new tack with this campaign, one we feel will be more effective at our necessary grassroots level. It means funding in stages during short bursts for smaller dollar amounts and also calling upon the power of the people - YOU, our fans and supporters. 

We want you on Team Little Spear. Already contributed? Can't afford a money donation? No problem! You can donate your time and skills! We would love to delegate some administrative responsibilities and spend less time worrying about raising our target goal all at once and more time providing you engaging video updates and perks. Please consider the following helpful options:

-- SAY IT LOUD AND PROUD --" I support Little Spear!" Post our campaign on your Twitter feeds and Facebook walls and spread the word far and wide! Contact us and become part of our "street team" and/or our "e-team".

-- DO IT IN PERSON! Follow our social media feeds and come to one of our advertised FREE shows, bring your friends! Encourage others to bring cash or credit. We are going mobile with our business soon so you can always make a donation or just talk with us in person!

--DONATE YOUR OWN TALENT! Are you a photographer? Publicist?  Graphic artist? Accountant? Business manager? Lawyer? Producer? Make-up artist? Nail technician? Hair stylist? Fashion designer? ... Taxidermist? WHATEVER YOU DO, we'll find a vital use for your skill and endorse your business in the process. We believe in helping one another out.

This isn't easy for us and we'll be paying our debts for some time, but that's how much we believe in ourselves and our music. We're glad we don't have to go it alone and thank you for all your help along the way!The ImpactAltogether, we estimate an essential need for ~$10,000 net profit to back and/or recover from this project venture. That's in addition to what we've already raised and includes our current funding target of $3,000. While the number seems high to us two little ladies in Seabrook,Texas, we have carefully added everything up that is going into this and have been assured the figure is a modest request.Raising that amount as quickly as possible will mean a great deal to us -- and for all those touched by Little Spear's vision-- for all the following reasons: 1. We want to make good on our projected May 31, 2014 delivery deadline. As established in our first campaign, we want to honor our commitments and present our fans and supporters with quality product worthy of your time and money contributions.2. It takes money to make money. Paying for quality product means we can rep ourselves with pride. It arms us for greater future opportunities providing an avenue forward to financial independence and career success.This is huge because it means less reliance on continued crowd funding, the caprice of others' good will and favors. and soul-destroying day jobs or multiple-income stream management which removes us from our practiced trade and passion. 3. We are "starving" to feed the world.   We are passionate about ART. Artists constantly inspire innovation, invention and new philosophies and provide succor, happiness and relief to people of all backgrounds and professions. The value of such art is priceless in the course of human history, yet the vast majority of professional artists in our modern age struggle to keep a roof over their heads and food on the table --ain't it a shame? Well, we don't want a handout, though we often need it. Rhonda and Sherita are not musicians solely for monetary gain - If that were so, we'd have chosen another line of work, believe me! Few make it big in this industry anymore and we know it. We make music because we are compelled to, driven to - if we don't make music, we grow despondent. Fortunately for you, we also happen to be pretty good at it and believe the value of our art will increase over time --hopefully in our own lifetimes! But you don't have to take our word for it. As the saying goes, "The proof of the pudding is in the eating!" We know you can help us make an impact. We believe in paying it forward! Help us raise enough money to kickstart our goals so that we can follow our dream of getting out on the road, living sustainably off our work as artists, and engaging with new fans --spreading the love and endorsing the arts and our cultural history and heritage wherever we go! In return, we pledge our commitment to nurture and mentor future generations who value art as we do. We don't want to compete for favor to others' detriment or our own self-aggrandisement. We want ART to mean something nobler.Other Ways You Can HelpWe’re taking a new tack with this campaign, one we feel will be more effective at our necessary grassroots level. It means funding in stages during short bursts for smaller dollar amounts and also calling upon the power of the people - YOU, our fans and supporters. We want you on Team Little Spear. Already contributed? Can't afford a money donation? No problem! You can donate your time and skills! We would love to delegate some administrative responsibilities and spend less time worrying about raising our target goal all at once and more time providing you engaging video updates and perks. Please consider the following helpful options:-- SAY IT LOUD AND PROUD --" I support Little Spear!" Post our campaign on your Twitter feeds and Facebook walls and spread the word far and wide! Contact us and become part of our "street team" and/or our "e-team".-- DO IT IN PERSON! Follow our social media feeds and come to one of our advertised FREE shows, bring your friends! Encourage others to bring cash or credit. We are going mobile with our business soon so you can always make a donation or just talk with us in person!--DONATE YOUR OWN TALENT! Are you a photographer? Publicist?  Graphic artist? Accountant? Business manager? Lawyer? Producer? Make-up artist? Nail technician? Hair stylist? Fashion designer? ... Taxidermist? WHATEVER YOU DO, we'll find a vital use for your skill and endorse your business in the process. We believe in helping one another out.

story:
Hello,

My name is Stacy White and I am currently a junior in college enrolled at The Academy of Contemporary Music at The University of Central Oklahoma. About three weeks ago my university finalized a study abroad program with our sister school in Guildford, U.K. The spring of 2014 will be the first semester that this unique opportunity has become available to students. Being that next fall will be my last semester in school before I graduate (a semester earlier than I'm supposed too) I would love to take this chance to study abroad in the spring. This is a unique opportunity being that the university in the U.K. was one of the first music schools to ever become a certified music university offering their students not only an education about the music industry but real life experience in class, internships, and real job opportunities. I am currently receiving financial aid but not nearly enough to cover my school expenses here let alone studying abroad. Although my family and myself are working the best that we can to come up with enough funds to support me in this once in a lifetime opportunity, we severely need the support and help from others to make this dream come true for me.The opportunity would provide me with a whole new level of networking and connections to better my future career and offer possible internships as well as jobs for when I graduate in the fall of 2014. By contributing to my campaign and supporting me you will be helping me experience a truly eye opening experience and an amazing education pertaining to  the music industry. I have set my funds at a maximum of $8,000 which will be used to cover the cost of my living expenses for three months, my meals, my airfare, my tuition, and my medical insurance. Any contribution will help and I would appreciate it so much as for I am so excited to be able to have a chance to pursue this opportunity and I would love to have everyone's help. If you could please share this with your friends and family to help gain more support for me, I will also be covering the entire trip on my blog on tumblr, if you want to further your support and follow me on this adventure. http://staacywacyy.tumblr.com/

story:
VIDEO COMING SOON...


What This is All About

"The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand." - Vince Lombardi

My name is William Dodge Moody and I am a singer/songwriter living in South Boston, Massachusetts. Seeing as we're still at the mercy of a shaky economy, the last thing I want to do during this time is ask for financial support. And believe me, I'm not a person that would ask for something so substantial unless it was something I truly believed in. This album is something I truly believe in and have 100% confidence in and that faith carries over to your enjoyment. What will you be helping with is not my quest to be profitable, but to be heard. This album is about determination and the will to give all you have despite the consequences. It's about going for broke for something that you believe you were meant for and that's what I have done with this record that has yet to be recorded...and that's where you come in.

What I Need & What You Get

I am putting in all of my savings into this record and all I'm asking from you is for to pitch in what you can. And at the very least, you will be receiving a copy of this album for your generosity as soon as it is released  The funds will not be going to me, but to studio for all production costs. Check out the perks panel for other awesome...perks.

story:
What is Girls Rock Camp Saskatoon? 

Girls Rock Camp Saskatoon (GRCS) is a week-long rock n’ roll day camp for girls 7-13. 

GRCS, taking place August 18-22nd 2014, joins an international network of Girls Rock Camps whose shared vision is to empower girls and women through music. Our camp aims to foster self-esteem, creative expression, and confidence using music education.

Campers will take lessons on electric guitar, vocals, bass, drums, or keys. They will form bands, write original songs, and participate in creative and fun workshops, 

GRCS is asking for your financial support to help us run our first camp this summer. Your donations will be used to:

  • Buy supplies like earplugs, drumsticks, cords, and cables
  • Rent guitars, keyboards, and amps
  • Buy supplies for crafts and activities
  • Supply healthy snacks for our campers.

Other Ways You Can Help GRCS

  • Share this campaign with your friends!
  • We are looking for donations! We need craft supplies (i.e. construction paper, craft scissors, crayons, glue, fabric paint, markers, etc.), lanyards for name-tags, guitar strings, bass strings, guitar stands, music stands, and gift cards and/or raffle prizes.
  • If you have any of the above and would like to donate to the camp, please contact us at saskatoon.girlsrockcamp at gmail.com to discuss further.

Thank you!

story:
Hey everyone,

I'm almost done tracking everything. I go back into the studio next week to record vocals. The rough mixes sound soooo good, and the guys who played on the record are top notch. I appreciate everyone's contributions so far, I just need a little bit more to be able to finish it up. The first round of funding covered pre-production and recording, and this final round will cover mixing, mastering, duplication, and promotion.

I look forward to finally being able to share this record with you and hope that you'll contribute to making it happen. Take care and God bless!

Tim

story:
Short Summary



Hey, I'm Holly, I write music reviews for Get Your Rock Out and have my own radio show on Hive Radio called Locked and Loaded which I also write reviews for. I have been attending and promoting gigs for around 11 years now and thought it was about time I stepped up my game and put on a little one day festival! I like to blog and review bands that are local or unsigned and this festival is very much aimed at those acts. 

I understand the fight and the struggle for bands today, those who shout the loudest get somewhere regardless of their talent so I want to give quality bands an opportunity. I have been to the gigs of most of the bands I have confirmed and they do pull in crowds and regulars so I know that they are of quality. Not only are there bands performing but also dancers; I have confirmed a metal pole dancing team as well as two burlesque acts, one established and one who has just started all performing in the evening. I am also opening up the festival to traders to sell their wares or to advertise with the festival if they cannot attend, particularly local businesses and those who hand make their items. 

The festival is important to me because there are so many bands out there that deserve every opportunity to shine. It is also the next step up in gaining experience and I have a great team assisting me and helping me out along with the staff of the venue. As a contributor you will be able to help me, the festival and the acts in a way no other source will. The tickets will be priced between 20 and 35 pounds and are available through Eventbrite already and the venue will be starting to promote it soon.

What We Need & What You Get

The venue is secure by deposit but the funds will go towards paying off the venue and paying for festival programmes which will be an amazing keepsake and have spaces for bands to sign, the alternative crowd of Manchester are completely dedicated to the bands they love no matter how big they are. The booklets cost around £300 for 500 of 20 pages, this may alter slightly depending on how many pages we need! The funds will also go towards upgrading the website to its own domain and advertising, I have set aside around £2500 for this which includes online advertising, magazines etc. We also need to purchase wristbands for admission and also merchandise. Merchandise makes up for a lot of the perks and the younger audience love to purchase merchandise from great events.The remainder of the funds will go towards paying for a headline act!  

If I don't reach the goal then the money will go towards whatever is highest in priority which will be paying off the venue. If this is accomplished then the money will go towards a headline act then the money raised from ticket sales will need to go towards advertising and the programmes. 

I have included a mixture of perks because I understand that not everyone reading this will be a fan of any of the bands, heard of them or are even from Manchester! So I have tried to be inclusive for everyone. However if you're a lover of festivals, rock music and unsigned bands then the perks will not disappoint!

The Impact

Myself and the other organiser Nick are both students and we have time the festival so it doesn't clash with others and for when freshers celebrations are in full swing for the beginning of term. This is a great opportunity to get freshers checking out all of the local music and bands that play local venues regularly even if they are not local. I hope that I have been able to outline how important this project is to myself and the acts involved. The music scene in Manchester is very tight knit and it would be amazing to be able to get everyone together on the same day. As there are a few bands with managers and representation the festival could open up great opportunities for other bands on the bill too. 

I have been going to gigs local to Manchester for around three years now, I am originally from the south where I would attend many local punk and rock gigs as well as mini festivals. Music, writing and discovering are my passions alongside dance and art as hobbies so this project brings a lot together for me. I would love for this to be a success for myself as well as the bands so I can run it again next year and maybe expand to a larger venue or over multiple days. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to part with any funds then please check out the blogs and social media on the matter! Twitter is already up and going, the website is in production and ready to go in the next week as well as Facebook! We will be carefully documenting everything that goes on for a bit of fun and interactivity for those interested and those wanting to attend. If there is any way I can improve my pitch then please leave a message. If you think it is a great idea then please share the love! It is real too, there are tickets and everything and early bird tickets are available https://medrockfestival.bigcartel.com

story:
Why Podunk?

I have a very strong psychological connection to my childhood home, both the property I grew up on and the larger region of the Finger Lakes in central New York. My family’s home was on Podunk Road and the name of the property became Podunk by association. Over the last 4-5 years (living now in the Northwest) I have written songs that I feel draw heavily from my life in that region. These story-songs contain subtle humor as well as darker shades of tragedy and lonesomeness and address the everyday trials, struggles, and joys of rural living. Having welled up from the depths of everyday experiences, these songs resonate with commonality and familiarity and draw the listener in to a contemporary, rural-gothic psychological landscape.

Who is Daniel Boone’s Fault?

Take a listen on my Bandcamp page. Well, the short answer is anyone living west of the Cumberland Gap. Daniel Boone opened up passage to the western territories of the US by exploring and breaking trail through the Cumberland Gap. I am a Northeasterner living in the Northwest and by default I am Daniel Boone’s Fault. This is the concept behind and name of the band I periodically assemble to flesh out my songs.

For this project Jared Burrows will be producing with Lyle Hopkins, bass, Stefan Thordarson, violin, Josh Wright, drums and Lawrence Wu, engineer and videographer (please take a look at their team member profiles). This is truly a stellar arrangement of talent. I played a gig at Presentation House concert series in North Vancouver, BC in February with these men and the experience was fulfilling to say the least.

Help us bring PODUNK into your life.

The fees for the players, engineer, producer and rental space have been covered by previous fundraising. Thank you! (You know who you are.) And now I am looking to cover the following costs:

  •   Mastering $315 ($7/min x 45 min) – this is the process of mixing recorded tracks and applying any necessary sonic adjustments (sweetening) to optimize the quality of the audio. This is the final stage before files are sent to the CD production facility.
  •   CD production $775– CD design, printing, duplication. I hope to fund 300 copies. The CDs will be available for sale (as well as digital download) at my BandCamp page (as well as other sites to be listed here at a later date). CDs are available as perks for specific donation levels.
  •   T-shirt Printing $480 – Merchandise like t-shirts are a key element of the independent music economy. They provide cash flow that allows musicians to fund gigs, touring, and recording as well as give fans an opportunity to represent and spread the word about their favorite bands/artists. I would like to print up 100 shirts with my exclusive logo (to be revealed soon). T-shirts are available as perks for specific donation levels.

I have chosen flexible funding so that, in the event that the funding goal is not met, I can still apply the amount raised to project expenses. I will fund the mastering and CD production first and then the t-shirt according to the amount left over. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help out financially, you can still get the word out to your friends, family and social networks. Please use the share tools located beneath the welcome video toward the top of the site to do this.

Thank you in advance! I appreciate your time and attention, and support in helping me bring PODUNK into your life. Take Care!

story:
What happened?

A week before Christmas, my apartment in East Oakland was burglarized and my two cellos were stolen. This violent act, which was unexpected and without any notice, left me completely devastated and inconsolable. I am a professional musician, and these cellos were my livelihood.

It took me several more days to notice I also lost a bike, and two more weeks to figure out I lost a laptop and an older cell phone. I couldn’t have cared less if the thieves took my whole apartment - it was my Signature Cello that I really despaired about.

I’ve done everything we can think of to find the two cellos, but have had no luck.

  • Filed a police report and worked with a police detective specialist in theft crime
  • Had the story aired on two local nightly news shows: 
    KTVU : http://www.ktvu.com/news/news/crime-law/custom-made-cellos-stolen-oakland-musician/ncSy8/
    KRON4:  http://news.kron4.com/news/rare-cello-stolen-from-oakland-home/
  • Searched pawn shops, flea markets
  • Continuing searches on craigslist and eBay
  • Hung many ‘Reward’ posters and have chased heartbreaking false leads

Who am I?

My name is Pawel, and I am a professional musician desperately following my dream, while continuing to try to make ends meet.

I have been a musician my entire life and my entire professional career has involved music. Today, I teach piano and cello to students at the ViBO Music Center in San Bruno, Sleepy Hollow Elementary School in Orinda, and The Saklan School in Moraga.  I also teach many private lessons ranging from children as young as 4, to entire families, to retirees.  I play for three Catholic churches, serving as a piano accompanist at one, playing cello at the second, and serving as a music director at the third. 

For the past year I mostly played cello in church, where I embellished the hymns with cello lines. It touched many people.

In addition to playing in churches, I play regularly in my world music ensemble, ViBO Simfani.  ViBO Simfani is a quartet of violin, cello, guitar, and drums.  We play a variety of songs from arrangements of classical to Brazilian choro to Latin jazz to European folk.  We have recorded one cd so far, and are planning to record a second one soon - assuming I can replace my cello.

How did I get my dream cello?

It took me many years to finally get the cello I wanted.  I started with a rental at age six, and eventually my mom bought me an older, student quality cello. This cello accompanied me throughout my childhood from then on.

I saved all the money I made after being selected as a first cellist for Andrew Lloyd Webber orchestra, touring Europe with his musicals. Finally I was able to sell the old one, and get a new cello. It was much better, but it was still not my dream cello.

After I came on a scholarship to study at the University of Arizona, I had another chance to save some more money; I was able to sell that cello and went back to Poland to get my dream instrument. I could finally afford it!

It was made in Zakopane, by Stanislaw Mardula, who is a great Polish violin maker and artist.  He designed a special, unique, one of a kind model. I loved this instrument: it was easy to play and had a good response and projection. And it looked slick. It was perfect for what I wanted to do at that moment - get into improvisation, learn some jazz, and play in non-classical ensembles. 

After moving to the bay area, I enjoyed being versatile and performing different genres. The cello served me well in both classical settings, whether chamber or orchestral, or non-classical, playing popular music like Latin jazz or Brazilian choro.

I had another cello, of lesser value, which was a gift. I used it for teaching, and playing outdoor gigs to protect my signature cello from the elements. This cello was also stolen in the burglary.

What I need help with!

Now, as I realize it is finally time to move on…first, MOVE OUT of a place I feel VERY unsafe living in, and secondly, getting myself together to figure out what I can do to raise funds to buy a new cello.

Along with a fine instrument, I need a good bow, hard case, and insurance.  The costs are staggering.

New Cello: at least  $15,000
Good Bow: $3,000 - 5,000
Spare Bow: $1,500
Hard case: $1,000
----------------------------------------
Total Needed:  at least $20,500

I am hoping to raise at least $12,000 through this website.  My dream would be to raise all $20,500 here.  Any funds raised past $20,500 will be put to good use:  I will first use the funds to buy the best cello I can, get insurance for the new instrument, then consider breaking my current lease ($2,000) in order to find a safer place to live.  

Any donations are appreciated.  A single dollar – anything you can spare – to help me get my tools back, so that I can return to my many jobs and gigs, restoring my own ability to make ends meet.  Thank you so much for listening, both to my plea, and my music.

Other ways to help

I am also holding benefit concerts where I will be performing along with friends. These are alternate ways to contribute to my cause.

Sunday, February 9th at 2pm
St Mary's Church
2039 Mt Diablo Blvd
Walnut Creek , CA

Saturday, March 1st Sat 7pm
St Bonaventure Church
5562 Clayton Rd,
Concord, CA
story_txt:
What happened?

A week before Christmas, my
apartment in East Oakland was burglarized and my two cellos were stolen. This
violent act, which was unexpected and without any notice, left me completely
devastated and inconsolable. I am a professional musician, and these cellos
were my livelihood.
It took me several more days
to notice I also lost a bike, and two more weeks to figure out I lost a laptop
and an older cell phone. I couldn’t have cared less if the thieves took my
whole apartment - it was my Signature Cello that I really despaired about. I’ve done everything we can think of to find the two cellos, but have had no luck.
Filed a police report and worked with a police detective specialist in theft crime
Had the story aired on two local nightly news shows: KTVU : http://www.ktvu.com/news/news/crime-law/custom-made-cellos-stolen-oakland-musician/ncSy8/KRON4:  http://news.kron4.com/news/rare-cello-stolen-from-oakland-home/

Searched pawn shops, flea markets
Continuing searches on craigslist and eBay
Hung many ‘Reward’ posters and have chased heartbreaking false leads

professional musician desperately following my dream, while continuing to try
to make ends meet.

story:
Hi I am Jay Regan singer songwriter form Philadelphia. I have been playing and performing in bands and solo for over 20 yerars. One of the goals of my life is to finish a CD project I have been working on for 10 years.

My CD will contain about 14 original songs and I will be getting it professionally duplicated with full packaging.

This project has been put on the back burner for many years because of a number of reasons, but I feel I need to get it completed now, while I'm still sort of young.

I have recorded most of the tracks at home to save money and have recently been in the studio doing retakes of vocals and getting the songs professionally mixed and mastered.

Your donation will help me finish the recording process and help with the expense of disk duplication.

Everyone who donates at least $10.00 will receive a professionally duplicated copy of the CD when it is completed. So you can think of your donation as a pre-release price of the CD.


Thank you,

Jay

story:
Short Summary

"Am I Wrong, WAN, and Cat Tatt are doing a summer of 2014 tour across America and WAN is making a feature length documentary about the entire tour. Starting in NY, we will move west in a swarm of house parties and dive bar stages until we arrive triumphant on the west coast.

We can get the tour going but every dollar gets the tour farther, expands the scale, gets Am I Wrong, WAN, and Cat Tatt in another venue or home meeting more people.

Funding the tour means we will try and get to where you are to meet you in person and put on a show in that area. Talk to us about it! If you are interested in getting the tour to your area contact the tour manager Cory Rohr (coryrohr@gmail.com) about potential house parties/other shows.

We will be adding more and more perks as we think of them, but expect lots of art packages and bundles and eternal gratitude.

Every dollar and cent helps get revolutionary music on the road.

Thank you for your time and support!"

- Elijah Wender


This is the first time I have ever asked for help to fund a project, mostly because of it's size. This campaign is very important to me because of the type of music made by AM I WRONG, WAN, and Cat Tatt. This would be music not a lot of people have been exposed to. We would be sharing with the nation our lifestyles of counterculture ideals and passion for community. The feature film made on the trip is meant to inspire other like-minded artists to get together and start touring. The film would be distributed free online for the most exposure to encourage other artists to utilize the internet to meet other artists, which is how WAN, Cat Tatt, and AM I WRONG met.

I will be live blogging the entire tour through social media websites such as facebook, spreecast, etc using multimedia techniques like photography, short videos, promotional macros, etc. The effect that this could have on social media communities is to be guessed. The main idea of this tour is to get up and make something happen yourself and to bring people together to experience challenging art.

Every dollar we get gets us one more mile on the road. We are going to start in NYC then head west in a 12 person van.

Here is a feature doc on WAN made by WAN on their first year as a band to give an idea of what this road film will be like:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aTPswFvsFnk

Music of AM I WRONG:
https://soundcloud.com/am-i-wrong/sets/lixx-session

Music of WAN:
http://wanwanwan.bandcamp.com/

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sEb9jfDrpSI

Thanks guys, I'm Nate!

Music of Cat Tatt coming soon! -Cory

What We Need & What You Get

  • $6000 is the main goal. This money is mostly going to gas and food/shelter while on the road. We already have our own equipment.
  • If you fund us, you get to see us on tour! We will also mail you some one of a kind art/poetry as a token of gratitude after the tour.
  • We are determined to do this tour, so even if we do not reach the $6000 goal, every dollar goes to the van/gas/food/shelter.
  • Choosing an art based perk also ensures that we will pack the thing full of as much other art as we can, including: One of a kind WAN business cards with a completely unique addition on each one, one of a kind "modular" zen sharpie calligraphy scrolls on varying amounts of 8" x 10" pieces of paper, handwritten notes, Handmade Band T-shirts, unique 1" x 1" canvas pieces, and a ONE OF ONE WAN CASSETTE TAPE WITH COMPLETELY ORIGINAL MATERIAL ON EACH TAPE TO APPEAR IN NO OTHER MEDIUM UNLESS YOU RELEASE PIRATED COPIES YOURSELF WHICH WE ARE FINE WITH.

The Impact

This campaign could open up new possibilities for artistic expression depending on who hears the bands as each band is highly unique. The networking between these bands that will occur during the tour should lead to interesting collaboration for all parties. The film will stand as a testament to an incredibly active and transformative period in music and art history.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about this upcoming tour!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share the music of WAN, Cat Tatt and AM I WRONG.

story:
The Big Bad, West Virginia's horror punk phenomonon! Busting out of their coffins, the five undead sons of Appalachia have awakened and they’re carving up that eerie melody only the night has to offer! Fangs and claws out with bloody microphone in hand, The Big Bad has kept rock n' roll undead since 2004!


The Big Bad Needs Your Help!

We have always been a band that did it on our own! Now we are humbly calling on you, our fans, to help us out. The sole reason for this is so we can bring The Big Bad's live show to each and every one of you!

 

 

Here is the good part...PERKS!

We have a lot of limited edition items that will be available only here and we want you to have exclusive access to it, you, the people who make this dream a reality.  If we meet this goal then we will load the van down and come to your town!

 

Why we do it.

 The first time I ever recorded, which was into my boom-box, I was like, 'Wow, check that out.' It sounded great. The narcotic of it was so intense - it was pleasurable. I was like, 'You sound like a band.' Then I ended up spending the rest of my life trying to chase that initial high again.

Ian MacKaye

 We feel this way about punk rock in general. We have all had our struggles before we got to where we are and it has always been the fans pushing us forward. We need your support!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

We understand that some of you can't donate. We are also members of the blue collar rat race. You can still help us out by spreading the word. Help us get it out there!

story:
Hello friends!

We are Next Stop: Horizon.

We truly believe that music is a gift. A gift that we want to share.

For those of you who don't know us yet - this is the short story.

We have been recording and touring as next stop: horizon since 2009. Mainly in Europe. Always with a rental bus. 

We have this idea: we want to try and see if we can raise money together with
YOU - our friends and our fans - to get a bus of our own. That would be so much better in the long run.

With a bus of our own we would be much more free to go on tour more often and, when we feel the timing is right. We wouldn't necessary have to wait for promotors to be able pay expensive travel costs (BUS RENTAL!!!).

We also have this dream about starting a tour that more or less keeps going nonstop and never has to end. It's something we have been talking about for a long long time now. Therefor it would be absolutely fantastic to have a bus where we also could sleep. Like actually living on the road in periods.

We ask different musicians to join us for different tours and projects, and that's the way we want to work. It's a flexible way, and it makes a lot of fun to try out many different ways of arranging and performing our music live. 

We love to travel and we love to meet new people. We actually believe that travelling and playing our music is somewhat the purpose of our life. Now we'd like to really try to do that without compromising. 

...now that you know a little bit more about us, we'd like to ask if you want to take part in this project?! As you can see there are some gifts that we offer. Look at them as symbolic gifts of gratitude and appreciation!

Listen to our music, watch our videos and make up your mind about
NEXT STOP: HORIZON!

We really hope you wanna take part!

If you have any questions, suggestions or ideas please email us: par@nextstophorizon.org

Love
Pär & Jenny NEXT STOP: HORIZON


some links:

stream our music: http://www.nextstophorizon.org/music

our record company: http://www.tapeterecords.de/next-stop-horizon

ps. The actual type of bus we have in mind is probably at least 30 years younger than the one pictured below. We think that a VW Multivan T5/T4 with a foldable high top roof and a hook (to pull our back line), would be the best option for us. We could get a used one from around 2007 for approx 15.000€.

Just if you're curious!

story:
Short Summary

Omaha Street Percussion is a collection of drummers coming together to create a visually appealing, highly energetic form of drumming, using only unorthodox forms of percussion.

We started as a group of friends that got together to drum in the Old Market district of Omaha, NE in an effort to raise money for one of our members (Jeff Babcock) to adopt a child from Korea. The night was a success. We decided to continue playing together as a group. From there, we named the group and started playing shows around Omaha. Today we are proudly teaching "Street Drumming" Classes in 6 Omaha schools, reaching over 80 students per week. In 2013, we played an astonishing 56 live performances in the CIty of Omaha. 

What We Need

Our campaign is to raise money to purchase a large enough vehicle to transport all of our gear to various performances, workshops, and classes that we host. Currently, we do not have a company vehicle, and use our own cars to transport gear. We anticipate working with 8 schools next year, while continuing to host guest school performances and other performances around Omaha. Your contribution would Help OSP reach more kids in the city of Omaha by sharing the art of music through education and performance. The vehicle we are looking to purchase is 14-16 foot Cube Van (Similar to a Uhaul or Penske) by either GMC, Chevy, or Ford. We are hoping that by raising $5000.00, that would enable us to buy a slightly used but reliable vehicle. This vehicle would be used multiple times each week, all year around. 

What You Get

We have a variety of cool "Perks" for everyone that donates. Please take a look at them. Notice, we are releasing our first recoded album! That's something we are very excited about and hope that you take advantage of the perk that gets you the album!

The Impact

Getting this new vehicle will impact OSP and the community by:

1. More local performances 

2. More opportunities to share the art of percussion at area schools through workshops, classes, and school assemblies. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on Facebook, or any other forms of Social Media. Tell Friends, co-workers, and family. Thank you for your support!!

story:
Upcoming shows for the #iGIVEafunk Tour:

Nov. 15 Ziggy's Winston Salen, NC

Nov. 16   Bear Creek Festival


_______________________________________________________________________

**STRAIGHT TO THE POINT SUMMARY**

We are launching a Creative Arts movement called #iGIVEafunk to inspire everyone to STOP and take a moment to LISTEN to the world around them and STAND UP for what they believe in.

For example: 

Tell the world "iGIVEafunk about breast cancer awareness, and I'm taking part in a walk to raise funds and bring awareness to the cure!"  

OR  

"iGIVEafunk about musical education, so I'm donating my time to teach the youth in my neighborhood"  

OR 

"iGIVEafunk about the cure for Diabetes, so I'm starting with my family and teaching them the importance of balanced and healthy eating" 

To do our part, we are going on tour, using the power of music to bring awareness to the needs of different community focused organizations in the cities we stop in. We will turn this experience into a Documentary and as part of it record a brand new Bootsy Collins Live DVD and Album!

After the tour is over, we will continue to spread our beliefs that the world is only lacking all of us Give'n A Funk about and taking action for what we hold as important in our individual lives. 

#iGIVEafunk is our chance to come together with a unified voice! 

_______________________________________________________________________


Our Story

#iGIVEafunk is Creative Arts movement led by Bootsy Collins, meant to inspire everyone to STOP, LISTEN, AND STAND UP for each other. It will launch as part of a World Tour and spur a brand new Bootsy Collins Album and Documentary/Live DVD all inspired by the journey. 

In case you're unfamiliar with Bootsy, he has been inducted in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, Won Grammies, awarded multiple Gold and Platinum records...but most importantly, we have spent the years working on two initiatives: 

The Bootsy Collins Foundation - "Say it Loud, a Music Instrument for Every Child"  

The Bootsy Girls - "To lift the self esteem of young girls & women around the world through music & the arts.". 

Both initiatives have helped us change the lives of thousands of people around the globe, and now we would like to take our outreach to a grander scale. We are passionate about the arts, it is our belief that if we encourage creative activities in young people, they will bloom into much better adults.  

With the help of a few partners we were able to make a small impact on these lives, but we know that by reaching out and connecting to each of you, we have a chance of touching and reaching places that we couldn't using the traditional methods.

We are welcoming you aboard The Funk-Ship, no middlemen saying we can't get down and Funk in your town, no labels telling us how you want your funk..no nothing but you and us, working together to make a difference one person at a time.

What We Need & What You Get

We're out to have the most honest and open campaign in the history of CrowdFunding, everyone who backs us will be included in our regular updates of how we are doing along our journey, and we will be as clear as possible about how the funds are being used.

We have set our goal as low as possible to complete a decent project that showcases the amazing journey we will be embarking on. Our #iGIVEafunk tour starts Oct 23, and continues for over a year...rehearsals have been going on for over a month now and we're ready to put on a show that's like no other! 

We have attached an accounting of how we will be using the raised funds. Fortunately we have chosen the Flex Funding, which means, we get to keep and use the funds even if we don't reach our goal. So, if we don't, we will still press on with our mission and deliver what we have promised.



The Perks


$1: Digital Download of #iGIVEafunk Album.

$10: #iGIVEafunk Bracelet, Sticker, and Digital version of Album

$15: Twitter shout out, your name on a special part of our site, and Digital download of album

$25: Get one of the limited autographed physical copies of the album

$25: 1 hour digital music lesson (Guitar, Vocals, or Bass)

$30: Limited Edition Space Bass Pin

$35: #iGIVEafunk shirt

$50: CD/DVD Combo Pack, Sticker, and Bracelet

$55: Autographed #iGIVEafunk T-Shirt

$75: Shirt, Autographed CD/DVD combo, bracelet, your name in the credits, and 1/2 hour chat with the Funk Unity Band

$100: Custom Voicemail or Ringer

$100: Autographed Vinyl

$100: VIP Tour Tickets

$250: Video Shout out

$500: Meet & Greet + More!

$1,000: Associate Producer credits and 10 copies of the combo pack

$1,250: Bootsy's one of a kind Space Boots used in video shoot

$2,500: Perform guest vocals (or other guest instrumentation) on the album! 

$7,000: Blindged out Fender Bass

$10,000: Bootsy's iconic Space Bass




The Impact

By joining in on this Groovement you are taking part in making music, film, and social history. You are showing the world that you believe that we can band together and make a difference, and that you believe that we will over deliver like you know we can! Bootsy himself has kept a bond so tight with his fans over the years that we consider each and everyone of you our family members. And you know you can't Funk with family :).

With all that on the table, we promise the Funk, the Whole Funk and nothing but that Funk-Uncut-Funk-Da-Bomb!

Let's Funk up this Groovement!


Other Ways You Can Help

We've discovered that the best way to support these campaigns is Social Media (especially Facebook and Blogs):

  • Please share the link to the campaign on your Facebook account and share our Facebook videos/posts/images with your friends.
  • Indiegogo has offered up some great tools to share the campaign, make sure you click them to make it easier on yourself!
  • Like us on Facebook > http://facebook.com/iGIVEafunk 

Budget

Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how the funds will be used. (This is based off of reaching the proposed goal, the higher we goal, the Funkier this production will be). 

#iGIVEafunk Budget

Tour Expenses
Tour Bus Deposit (for Transportation)                               $7,500.00
Marketing  $3,500.00

Documentary Expenses
Videographer Fees $2,500.00
Production Fees $2,500.00
Post-Production Fees $3,000.00

Album Expenses
Production $7,500.00
Post-Production $3,500.00
Grand Total
 $30,000.00

Fundraising Total
$40,000.00
Indie GoGo Fees (4%) -$1,600.00
Credit Card fees (3%) -$1,250.00
Adjust Gross $37,150.00
Cost of Goods for Perks (15%) -$6,000.00

Project Money
$31,150.00

Nov. 16   Bear Creek Festival

story:
“Amorisms”: For clarinet, string quartet, and SSATB voices
A Collaborative Commission and a World Premiere

It’s not every day you get to help create a new CD commission, especially the recording of a World Premiere by a Pulitzer Prize-winning composer. But today we invite you to join ALIAS Chamber Ensemble and Nashville's Portara Chamber Ensemble in recording "Amorisms", by Pulitzer Prize-winning composer Paul Moravec. Commissioned by ALIAS, Portara and Nashville Ballet, this mesmerizing new work for clarinet, string quartet and SSATB voices will premiere at our Spring Concert on May 7, 2014, at Vanderbilt University’s Blair School of Music. ALIAS will contribute 100% of the proceeds from this concert to our “spotlight” nonprofit partner, STARS (Students Taking a Right Stand).

You Can Help Bring this New Work to Life

Wherever you live, and however much you can afford to contribute, ALIAS welcomes you to share in bringing this World Premiere to life. In addition to the Spring Concert, “Amorisms” will be performed by the Nashville Ballet during their “Emergence” performance series May 29-31. This unique, visceral musical experience is typical of the artistic collaboration that is an important part of our ALIAS mission. It’s an investment that ALIAS shares passionately with supporters like you.

By taking part in this creative collaboration, you will have the satisfaction of contributing to something that will last well beyond the World Premiere.

Funds will support the recording & copying costs, the commission fee, and composer Paul Moravec’s travel and expenses during the recording. Every penny raised from our IndieGoGo campaign will be spent on recording, commissioning, and program-related costs. 

Your Generous Gift

Why not make a contribution as a unique gift to honor someone special? Gifts at $250 and above will include your name on the “Amorisms” CD cover jacket. Please email us at jim@aliasmusic.org if you would like to designate someone else’s name.

Your contribution is tax-deductible.

Creative Collaborators

You!
This creative collaboration would not be possible without supporters like you. We hope you will join us in bringing “Amorisms” to life. Learn about our other creative collaborators below.

ALIAS Chamber Ensemble


Well, ALIAS doesn't like to brag, but our first CD, Hilos, was nominated for a Grammy. But our mission goes beyond winning awards. ALIAS is dedicated to innovative repertoire, artistic excellence, and a desire to give back to the community. Part of our mission is to bring audiences a mix of chamber music that cannot be heard anywhere else. We adopt three nonprofit partners each season, and we share the spotlight with one nonprofit at every series performance. This “spotlight” nonprofit partner has the opportunity to share its message with the audience, and receives 100% of the proceeds from that concert…no strings attached.

Paul Moravec


Paul Moravec, winner of the 2004 Pulitzer Prize in Music, has composed over 100 orchestral, chamber, choral, lyric, film, and electro-acoustic compositions. His music has been described as “tuneful, ebullient and wonderfully energetic” (San Francisco Chronicle), “riveting and fascinating” (NPR), and “assured, virtuosic” (Wall Street Journal). His music has earned many distinctions, including the Rome Prize Fellowship, a Guggenheim Fellowship, three awards from the American Academy of Arts and Letters, and fellowships from the National Endowment for the Arts and the Rockefeller Foundation. A graduate of Harvard College and Columbia University, he has taught at Columbia, Dartmouth, and Hunter College and currently holds the unique position of University Professor at Adelphi University.

Portara Choral Ensemble

Portara Choral Ensemble has quickly become a creative force in the music scene of Middle Tennessee. Their innovative programing and artist collaborations have crossed the boundaries of visual and performing arts, and brought exciting new music to their audiences.  Led by founder-director Shreyas Patel, Portara Ensemble’s thought-provoking thematic choral programs explore a wide variety of music from around the globe sung by professional, semi-professional, and amateur volunteer singers. Since its inception in 2010, Portara Ensemble’s mission has been to bring new and important choral works to the audiences of Middle Tennessee while integrating additional forms of performing and visual art into each concert series.

Nashville Ballet


Since its founding in 1986, the Nashville Ballet has grown to become the largest professional ballet company in Tennessee, presenting a varied repertoire of classical ballet and contemporary works by noted choreographers, including original works by Artistic Director & CEO Paul Vasterling. Nashville Ballet’s history of consistent growth and steady expansion is a credit to the dedicated artists and philanthropists who worked tirelessly to bring the art of ballet to Nashville. Those visionaries worked diligently to bring this classical art form to a city that was already well on its way to becoming a cultural hub.

Perks

Please take a look at the various ways you can help us bring “Amorisms” to life. We welcome contributions at all levels, and you can get involved for just $15. For $50, you will receive your own “Amorisms” CD, with the cover jacket signed by the composer, Portara, and the ALIAS musicians. For $250, your name will be displayed on the jacket on the new CD. What a great opportunity to honor someone special!

All contributions will receive a tax receipt.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute at this time, that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  Please become a part of this project by:

  • Spread the word about the “Amorisms” commissioning campaign.

  • Use the links at the bottom of this page to visit our website and Facebook page. The more “likes” and “shares” we can get on Facebook, the further we will be able to spread the word about our new commission with Pulitzer-Prize winning composer Paul Moravec.

  • Sign up for our email list - the link is on our website, http://www.aliasmusic.org/contact/subscribe/. We send out periodic emails with information about upcoming concerts and events.

THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

  • We're all recently graduated high school students out of Chilliwack BC, some who now go to the University of Victoria as well as the University of the Fraser Valley.
  • The money we raise will help us towards getting drum line equipment to play together as a group at important gigs and shows around the GVA. 
  • Helping our group will help give Chilliwack a great name and put us on the map.

Community support will be an enormous help to us, and by donating you can be a part of our success!

What We Need

To break things down into more detail:

  • The money we raise will likely not even cover everything we need, as everything total will cost around $5,000 in the long run.
  • However, the down payments will be approximately what we're asking for here. Every penny will help!
  • If we do not reach our intended goal, all money will still go towards what we need, but we will have to cover some of the costs ourselves by busking on the streets of Vancouver with the instruments we purchase with the money we do receive.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread around the word that we are looking for gigs in the months of June and July!
  • We do charge a fee for our performances, but you can contact us for details by emailing us at xcorpsdrumline@gmail.com
  • Check us out on Facebook: facebook.com/xcorpsdrumline
  • Twitter: @x_corps
  • Instagram: xcorpsdrumline

Thanks for helping out everybody, you're all the best!

story:
Billy Danze's "We Build Hits"

As a team we believe a fully functioning machine is the best way to move forward, the passion of one is shared by all, the ambition of all will guide one.. The limitless effort to create shine from more angles than one could imagine is the WeBuildHits way!!!
"We promise to supply listeners with what's needed" (It's The WeBuildHits show)

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $100,000 To assist us in the Recording of the Companies 8 Artist Roster compilation Album, Promo Touring, and videos.

MoneyMark- Queens,NY

Lucci Loner- Philadelphia,PA

Demorne Warren (D-Dub)- Brooklyn/Queens,NY

ReignMajor- Los Angeles,CA

Caktuz- High Point-NC

Eyeznpowa- Tampa/Valrico,FL

Ronve- Marietta,GA

Tona Tencreddi- Toronto,Canada




  WeBuildHits: As a unit the journey to our destination seems much easier.. The drive to the top is more like a road trip with great memories and adventures along the way, Thanks to everyone board for supporting our team of talented artist.. WeBuildHits as a company will continue to stick to the company's motto "One team, One Plan, One win" ( Its the WeBuildHits show )

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Please tell a friend to tell a friend. Share in everyway possible VIA: Social Media,Email,Word of Mouth help us spread the word...


And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Palestine Youth Orchestra (PYO) was established by the Edward Said National Conservatory of Music (ESNCM) in 2004, with the vision of bringing together young Palestinian musicians from around the world, to form a quality ensemble on a par with similar groups internationally. To date, the PYO has performed in , , , , , and , and meets for an annual workshop and tour each summer, guided by word-class classical musicians and an international guest conductor.


The PYO will hold it’s 2011 workshop and tour in Palestine. Young musicians living within Palestine and the Palestinian Diaspora, will join a small umber of talented young musicians from neighboring Arab countries – including Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon and Syria, under the baton of Spanish conductor Hilari Garcia, and a team of international expert staff. The orchestra of 75 musicians will perform music, including the much-loved opera overture ‘The Thieving Magpie’ by Rossini, a new work especially written for oud and symphony orchestra, by the Swedish pianist and composer Roger Johansson for his close friend, the Palestinian oud maestro Ahmad al Khattib, some orchestral songs by Lebanese composer Marcel Khalife, and Tchaikovsky’s piano concerto No. 1, one of the most famous of all piano concertos, performed by Palestinian pianist Fadi Deeb.


MEMBERS OF THE PYO

The musicians of the PYO have a diverse make-up. There are approximately 75 members, between the ages of 13 – 26 years of age, with roughly equal numbers of female and male participants. The participants range from young music students studying at the principal music schools of Palestine, advanced students studying at music conservatories in Europe, the Middle East and the Americas, students and young professionals specializing in other disciplines who have continued to play and study music as a hobby, along with young professional musicians who have continued to benefit from participating in the PYO in the early years of the professional careers. Students living inside are joined by students from the Palestinian refugee diaspora, including those living in , , the , , and . Every year a small number of guest students, primarily from neighboring Arabic and countries, join the orchestra as guest musicians – a unique cultural and musical experience where they gain a special insight into the lives of young Palestinians on top of the musical rewards of being a PYO member. Last year these students came from , , , and .


UNIQUE PROGRAMMING

Still only in its first decade, the PYO has gained a reputation as a leading promoter of Palestinian and Arabic orchestral music – commissioning new music by leading Arabic composers and delivering acclaimed performances of music already familiar to Arabic audiences, widening the popularity of music from their home region. Guided by expert coaching staff - every year, the PYO tackles some of the greatest Western classical repertoire alongside the best of new Palestinian and Arabic orchestral music, having recently worked with composers such as Marcel Khalife, Issa Boulos, Ahmad al-Khattib and John Bisharat, alongside revivals of music by the Rahbani brothers, Salvador Arnita and Samir Shkeir, often in specially commissioned arrangements for symphony orchestra or Arabic ensemble


EXPERT COACHING

Each section of the orchestra spends time away from full rehearsals (tutti rehearsals), being guided by expert coaches from some of the world’s best international symphony orchestras and conservatoires. Coaches from the last season included musicians who play regularly with the Symphony Orchestra, English National Opera, the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra, Gothenberg Symphony Orchestra and Amman Symphony Orchestra and professors from the Paris Conservatoire and ESNCM. The PYO musicians and the team of experts, were directed in the past two seasons by the well known English conductor Sian Edwards, a former music director of English National Opera, who regularly conducts at many of ’s leading orchestras and opera houses.

 

Unusually for a youth orchestra, rehearsals during the annual workshop are scheduled in the manner of a professional orchestra, and musical material is prepared to the standard expected by professional musicians before the workshops begin.

story:
Our Story

We are East from West and we are a Christian rock band out of Aiken, SC. We working on finishing our debut album entitled "The Process". We have a little more recording to do then we have production costs. We need your help in order to finish what we have started.


The Impact

We bring a message of hope for those who are stuck at rock bottom or those fighting with something. We have individually overcame depression, drugs, alcohol, and so many other things through the rescuing power of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. God has given a burden for the hearts of those going through what we have, and music is our mission field. Help us further get our mission and calling out to more people.

What We Need & What You Get

We need around $700 to finish up recording and production. We are currently recording at JP Studios in Inman, SC. All money donated goes toward these expenses.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not help us financially, PLEASE PRAY. God is so powerful and so is prayer. "The prayer of the righteous is powerful and effective" -James 5:16. Your prayers of guidance and safety are what keeps us on track.

story:
"He's as slick as a road in a hailstorm and just as determined... Mark him down as someone to watch and listen to closely."
          -David Finkle, Village Voice

"He's smart with heart."
          -Rob Lester, NiteLifeExchange.com

"Mr. Matthews is one of those young men who is unequivocally born to entertain."
          -Peter Filichia, The Star Ledger

"You're as cute as Helen Morgan!"
          -Queen of Cabaret, Julie Wilson

 

www.StearnsMatthews.com

Facebook

YouTube

 

The awesome video up there was made by my awesome friend, Stephen Candio.

My incredibly talented friend Steven Ray Watkins accompanied me.

The song is "Sing" by Joe Raposo, originally written for Sesame Street.

story:
About Blasphemour Records

Blasphemour Records was formed in Connecticut in 1999.  We quickly released 2 great CDs, but due to issues beyond our control we needed to close up and relocate to North Carolina.  We decided to put the label on hold and one day lead to 13 years.

Now in 2012 we are back and releasing music again.  Our first release is from PA's Frost Giant, and we couldn't be any more excited to be working with them.

What We Need & What You Get

We aren't looking for hand outs.  We would love to compensate you for your contribution.  We have set up some items you can get for amounts from $5-$20.  However, if you think the items are worth more, than we would love the additional support.

If you do not see something you want, you are welcome to contact us and tell us about what you would like to see as a perk, and we will try and accomodate.

If you are just a giving person and want to help us get off the ground.  We wouldn't say no to your donation.

With the money we earn from this, we will be putting it all back into the label.  All money will go towards future releases, tshirts, stickets, web design, etc.
 
Hopefully with your help we can continue to help lesser known bands get the publicity they deserve.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not see anything you want, and/or you just don't have the money to help out right now, there are still ways you can help.

  • Spread the word about this campaign.
  • Spread the word about Blasphemour Records and their artists.
  • Support local music

story:
THE MAN:

Hi! Thanks for stopping by, my name is Josh Menden! I am a pianist and a song writer. I write songs that tell stories, songs that inspire, and songs that have messages. I am inspired by my faith, by my values and by my surroundings. 

I am a classically trained pianist. I spent 3 years learning from one of South America's finest pianists Marco Alcantara, and another 4 years under the tutorage of David Marcum, one of the Valley's leading names in piano studies and arrangements. I have also had the opportunity to associate with and be taught by many notable names in Music such as Jon Schmidt, William Joseph, Jenny Jarnagin, Firefly, Richard Talbot and many more.

After years of writing music and recording the songs, I am finally finished. Finally! I was priveleged to work with Grammy winning producer Otto D'Agnolo in recording and mixing my album. It was truly an experience and the outcome is phenomonal!! It is a CD I am proud of and can't wait to share with the world! Unfortunately, the last and arguably most important step of the process still remains undone: the physical production of the CDs.

This is where YOU come in! By pre-ordering an album, or pledging money for all sorts of perks in return, you can help fund the production costs! It's a win-win! You get first dibs on the CD when it first comes out, and I have the opportunity to produce the CD!

This is a dream of mine, and I am so close to it becoming a reality. It's music I know you are going to love and hope you can find a buck or two (or 2,000) to pledge in return for the CD!

THE GOODS:

By pledging money you will be contributing to the neccessary $2,000 it's going to require to produce the CDs. I will be producing 1,000 6-panel Digipaks with a 4 page insert, and they look absolutely stunning! I need your help so please check out some of the exciting perks and help the campaign!

THE HELP:

Even if you can't contribute with money, you can contribute with your time! Share this campaign with all of your friends and family and help to raise money that way!!

story:
Todd Kessler and The New Folk need your help!  We've recorded an album that we're super proud of and we're going on tour to support it, but we have no way to leave Chicago.  We are asking for your help in raising funds to help us buy a van so we can come and play in a city near you.  

The van we're looking at isn't new and it isn’t pretty but it runs and will get us to you.  The $3000 we're trying to raise will go directly to buying the van and getting it insured and registered. 

For helping us achieve our goal there are some perks we're excited to share with you.

For donating $25 you will get a signed copy of our album Sea Fever and a T-shirt, though sadly we cannot guarantee size availability.

For donating $100 you will get 2 free concert tickets to all of The New Folk concerts for a year.  We cannot guarantee getting to locations outside of the Midwest right away. (Includes previous perks)

For donating $500 you will get a private concert in your home by The New Folk (includes previous perks).

 

 

In addition to donating you can also help us out by spreading the word to your friends and family via Facebook, Twitter and just word of mouth.  We're excited to come meet our fans from all over the country and are so thankful for all your help!

 

Todd Kessler + The New Folk

story:
Adult Care Services (ACS) is a non-profit 501(c)3 organization founded in 1982 by the late Susan J. Rheem to provide quality care programs and transportation services to the elderly and adults with dementia, mental illness and physical impairments. Today, we are the parent company of four programs consisting of:

  • My Care Partner ~ In-Home Care
  • The Sussn J Rheem Centers for Adult Day Service
  • The Margaret T. Morris Center
  • Online Training and Education

The Susan J. Rheem Centers for Adult Day Services welcome adults who are dealing with health issues including, but not limited to, strokes, Alzheimer’s Disease, Parkinson’s Disease, memory loss, various developmental disabilities, Multiple Sclerosis, spinal cord or head injuries as well as those who are simply in need of socialization and stimulating activities. Our participants benefit from medical monitoring, social interaction, nutritious meals and therapeutic recreational activities, counseling and support.

The Margaret T Morris Center is the only residential/assisted living community in Northern Arizona dedicated solely to people with Alzheimer’s Disease and other related dementias.  MTM provides a unique, safe environment with care and services overseen by a medical director, RN’s and highly trained professional care partners.  We are honored with CARF accreditation and take pride in our customized programs.  Families, friends and community are encouraged to join residents in these activities.  Each resident is supported through end-of-life by the MTM care partners and outside support, if needed from Hospice and Home Health.

Specifically, we need funding assistance for our Music Therapy program. Research indicates that music therapy is extremely important for Alzheimer's and dementia patients to improve their cognitive abilities and mental status. Dr. Oliver Sacks, a neurologist, states in his interview with the New York Daily News: October 29, 2007, Music can Heal the Brain; "In the elder population, music can help recall lost memories: in the speech impaired, it can bring back words, and inactive patients may get up and dance.

Our Music Therapy program provides creative arts therapies to people in the community who suffer from, or are at risk for psychiatric problems, such as depression, anxiety, or severe mental illnesses. Licensed music therapist David Sorenson conducts group music therapy sessions once per month at The Centers Adult Day Services and at The Margaret T. Morris Center. We serve elderly, frail clients with Alzheimer's, dementia and other brain disorders. During these group therapy sessions, David leads clients and residents through a series of musical exercises that offer mental and physical stimulation, enjoyment and socialization. Some common activities include group drumming and "sing-alongs."

Brain imaging technology gives credence to music therapy and is used in brain disorders ranging from Alzheimer's disease to Parkinson's to autism.", The Adult Care Services (ACS) activities program would like to continue to engage David’s services to visit once per month at a rate of $70 per visit at each of the three sites,(for a total of $210 per month or $2,520 per year).

Our Music Therapy Program helps us to accomplish our mission, "In the belief that each life has continuing value and in the spirit of love and respect, we will enhance the quality of life for older adults and others by provided needed comprehensive care services in appropriate settings, education, and community outreach." With results the staff can visibly see by the smiles on our clients' faces and the increased mobility we observe, we ask that you help us to provide more of this incredible music therapy every month!
