story:
Short Summary

Precise Science was conceived originally as a duo Ruffmic & Freedomwriter- emceeing, spoken word, old school/new school simultaneously. As we began on this journey that we were called to take, we didn't know what was ahead. We noticed the boost of self-steem in the youth as we performed around the country. We knew we had the sound to counter-balance out that negative "slop hop" being given to children. We have performed at Elementary schools on up to college campuses and your donation helps sustain and advance these efforts globally.

What We Need & What You Get

All funds from the fundraiser will goto the infastructure of what we do. We want to be as self-sufficient as possible so that we can eliminate third party over-head. We will purchase equipment and supplies that renders us full control of manufactering and distribution of our product. We will have a web-site and initiate youth workshops worlwide. $5000 is the amount needed to move forward. We have recently developed our own studio so now that is a cost that is eliminated. For your generous donation we have a variety of perks from public thank yous to personalized video performances on dvd.

The Impact

We have gathered a cadre of supporters and collaborators that have grown the brand that is Precise Science. We thank the almighty and the ancestors for this opportunity and overstand the duty attached. Ultimately the goal is the liberation of the minds and bodies of a conscious critical mass, so we can reclaim our rightful place in this spiriual existance of human form collectively. Music is the key.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't the only way you can donate. If you could book us for an event in your town or maybe you own a business or have a skill that will further the development and growth of our cause. It would be extremely appreciated as well. Also if you wish to donate audio/computer equipment or supplies that will be appreciated. Just email us at emceoofm2m@gmail.com.

story:
Ghost Music EP

Lacy Rose is nearly finished with Ghost Music, an EP-length album comprised of all original compositions, recorded at the studio of Same Sky Productions.

After years of personal growth as an artist, a record is finally coming to fruition. Lacy is a classically trained vocalist and pianist who began shaping a new kind of music when she moved to New Orleans in 2009. During her two-year stay there and since her move back to Texas, she has relentlessly continued to create, drawing from her eclectric surroundings, opera, jazz, early musical theater, and gothic horror. This is now "Ghost Music," a unique, interesting, and--to many--a beautiful, haunting sound all her own.

What's Left to Do

Recording and mixing of the tracks, including vocals and instrumentation, is complete. What remains is to finish paying the studio for its time and services, as well as paying for mastering and printing/manufacturing. Donations will be used to cover as much of these costs as possible.

What You'll Get

By helping make Ghost Music come into being, you will be among the first to experience Lacy's recorded works. Additionally, you'll receive limited-edition materials of thanks made by Lacy herself. Depending on donation level, these can include:

  • The album itself, signed and with a thank-you note
  • Printed stickers and posters of the album art
  • T-shirts
  • Creature dolls, hand-sewn by Lacy
  • A private performance

Lacy Rose is nearly finished with Ghost Music, an EP-length album comprised of all original compositions, recorded at the studio of Same Sky Productions.
After years of personal growth as an artist, a record is finally coming to fruition. Lacy is a classically trained vocalist and pianist who began shaping a new kind of music when she moved to New Orleans in 2009. During her two-year stay there and since her move back to Texas, she has relentlessly continued to create, drawing from her eclectric surroundings, opera, jazz, early musical theater, and gothic horror. This is now "Ghost Music," a unique, interesting, and--to many--a beautiful, haunting sound all her own.
What's Left to Do


Recording and mixing of the tracks, including vocals and instrumentation, is complete. What remains is to finish paying the studio for its time and services, as well as paying for mastering and printing/manufacturing. Donations will be used to cover as much of these costs as possible.
What You'll Get


By helping make Ghost Music come into being, you will be among the first to experience Lacy's recorded works. Additionally, you'll receive limited-edition materials of thanks made by Lacy herself. Depending on donation level, these can include:

The album itself, signed and with a thank-you note
Printed stickers and posters of the album art
T-shirts
Creature dolls, hand-sewn by Lacy
A private performance

story:
Please go to www.joshjamesmusic.com/listen to download a free preview of the album!

Who Am I?

  • My name is Josh James. I am 25 years old. I am a singer/songwriter originally from Minnesota. I now reside in TN with my beautiful wife and two dogs. I have written songs since the age of 13.

  • Making music has been my passion ever since I started doing it. I believe it is what I was born to do. It has taken a while to get this album done. All mushy stuff aside, I need help! With your financial support, these 9 songs I have recorded can be released in a truly effective way. Instead of passing my album to family and friends over the internet or peddling a few burned CDs at small gigs, I am aiming high. I want to press 1,000 professionally replicated and packaged CDs, make T-Shirts, help pay for some studio costs, and most importantly, hire a PR firm to help me release and promote a single. I also want to offer YOU some very cool incentives for aiding me along the way.

  • The album I have made is probably the coolest thing I have ever done in my life. It has been a great experience. If I don't ever get anyone to listen to it, I am not doing my job. In fact, it will be nearly pointless. I can't justify the time and money spent on this album if it is just satisfying a personal dream of mine. My wife, family, and friends have made too many sacrifices for that. That's what you are doing when you contribute to this campaign. PR is going to be the engine in this musical car. I am anticipating shows, press releases, and a bigger social media and internet presence.

Where does the money go?

  • I am asking for $5,000.
  • $1,000 will go to making CDs packaged and ready to sell
  • Depending on what route I pursue (single/radio release or publishing deals), PR cost could vary, but it won't be cheap! (I would anticipate $4,000 or more).
  • If the goal is not reached, the making of CDs takes priority.
  • If the goal is exceeded, it will assist with studio costs.

Incentives

With the making of merchandise, I am allowing at least 4 weeks to receive the funds and process my orders. With songwriting and house shows, depending on scheduling, I hope to get them done within six months.

The Impact

You are directly influencing the future of my songwriting career by contributing to this campaign. If it goes well, I can continue. If it doesn't, I will not be able to make another album for a long time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Use the tools below to spread the news about this campaign! Facebook, Twitter, Email, Blogs - I need all the publicity I can get. You are the best resource I have!

story:
We are The Dirty Gems and we are so happy you stopped by!

We began as five Hofstra University alumni (Raycee, Cam, Ulises, Jack and Mills) and were joined in 2011 by our roaming guitar wizard, Gary. It's been an amazing two years. Since the release of our self-titled debut EP, we've played festivals, variety shows, interactive theater experiences, and venues all around NYC including Highline Ballroom, The Bitter End, Sullivan Hall, and many, many more.

We are now in the beginning stages of recording our second EP, Vujà Dé. This second release means a lot to us because it represents our growth as a band. The groove is in place and the audience is dancing, singing, crying and screaming! We want to capture that in an album.

By contributing to this project, you will be helping us continue to move in a direction that we have been walking together. With the funds, we will be able to go from just having an EP to (hopefully) reaching new fans far and wide, taking our music somewhere we can only imagine! We want the far coasts to be moving and we want you to be there every step of the way! We need that extra push to get to the next level and we want you to be as excited as we are about the future! With your help, we can do anything.

The money we raise will cover costs including:

  • Recording 
  • Mixing & Mastering
  • Artwork
  • Packaging of the EP 
  • New Merchandise
  • Videography
  • Publicity & Promotion

Did we mention the perks?!

If you are able to contribute we have prizes such as: personal thank you videos, signed posters, free t-shirts, free admission to our shows, etc! It's going to be a fun time sharing it all with YOU!

The Impact

The money we raise will have a real impact on this project in the way that it looks, sounds, and is presented to the world. We're already hard at work planning the promotional campaign, the artwork and the beautiful packaging that will all become a reality when we're fully funded.

We have always made our music to connect to you, our fans. There is nothing more rewarding than seeing a person in the audience finally let loose and let the music move them! We are eager to take that emotion to bigger stages and states!

Where will your money go IF we don't completely fund this project? Not to worry! The money you do contribute will still be put toward us reaching our goal & the EP will still bring the funk.

If you are unable to contribute money please share the link using the indiegogo share links - simply spreading the word will be helpful. We appreciate all that you do for us and we are crazy excited to be able to continue creating our music for and with you!

Keep on rocking, Gemheads!

-The Dirty Gems

story:
Right now, Teramaze might be Australia's best kept secret ... but with your help it won't be for long. This is one high quality progressive metal band, ready to burst out of their home country and make a well-deserved worldwide impact.

Teramaze are currently working on their fourth studio album. After the success of AnhedoniA, and with your help, they are hoping to release their yet to be named album in Mid 2013.

AnhedoniA was released, after a long hiatus; in April 2012 the album was relased, receiving amazing reviews worldwide. They made it to number 13 on the Canadian metal charts, winning out over bands such as Lamb of God, Slayer and many more.

Teramaze AndhdoniA received rave reviews such as;

"Tight, Aggressive and Progressive...Metal the way I like it!" David Ellefson MEGADETH

"Quite similar to latter-day Dream Theater but nowhere near as tedious" HEADBANG

"I give it 5 out of 5 Jason Newsteds!" Mark Simpson FLOTSAM & JETSAM

"...the rhythms pounding and the riffs direct" THE ROCKTOLOGIST

"Teramaze have created a balanced effort that spews uniqueness.." BLISTERING.COM

"The musicianship is top-notch and the vocals of Brett Rerekura are impressive. He has a James Hetfield-like range, yet more powerful and melodic" ABOUT.COM

Teramaze are currently completing there yet unnamed album. Hoping to impress audiences once again and cement their place on the international metal scene.

Together lets make sure it's not another 13 year wait for audience to be dazzled once again.

This album is an epic musical journey, the band drawing on influences such as Dream Theatre, Devin Townsend, Tool, Sevendust, and of course the godfathers of metal, Metallica 

They are currently looking for funds to help mix and master and complete the album artwork for this epic album and will be giving all generous donationations, singned merchandise, album downloads and

story:
Six String Raga Project - Bruce Wayne Rash

...Launched Feb 28th, on John Fahey's Birthday...

Better Video Coming Soon!

They say now is the best time ever to be an Independent Musician, and that Portland, Oregon is one of the best places to do so. Portland embraces the street musician and all forms of music in an eclectic range of styles.That's good for me, as my instrumental compositions range in style from Indian Raga, to Classical, Celtic, to American Primitive and the newer acoustic fingerstyle, all written over the past 35 years. 

With the downturn in the economy, I wanted to try something new with the rewards section to make it affordable to share with your friends, (and help promote my music around the World!) so I came up with The Six Degrees of Separation Challenge. Six Degrees of Separation is the theory that anyone on earth is connected to any other person on the planet through a chain of acquaintances that has no more than five intermediaries, i.e., Someone you know, knows someone in Australia, who knows someone in Asia, who knows someone in Iceland, who knows someone in Brazil, who knows someone in Europe, who knows YOU!

Soooo, some of the reward levels allow you to not only get your own reward but send that reward to a friend in the USA or an International friend, anywhere in the world, for a price less than donating for two individual rewards.  Help give my IndieGoGo fundraiser a kickstart with the Six Degrees of Separation Challenge! 

Also, my older brother was a Vietnam Veteran and who died recently, homeless and addicted, a decades long sufferer from Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), so 10% of the proceeds from all of my musical endeavors, CD's digital downloads and performances, will go to the David Lynch Foundations "Operation Warrior Wellness" program to help fight the devastating effects of Post Traumatic Stress in soldiers and their families.

Funds will be used for hiring a tabla player, recording, mastering and duplication, with any excess going for marketing and promotion.

You can contribute anything from $2 up to $500 (or $1000 if you're rich, rich,rich!) and receive a reward, from a download of the title song to a concert at your home and lifetime downloads of all digital media I ever produce; music, film, art, writing. Thanks so much for your contribution!!!

This project is dedicated to my late brother Steven B. Rash, and two of our favorite musicians, John Fahey and Ravi Shankar, whom Steve introduced me to when I was just a teenager, and who continue to influence my direction in playing and composing...

story:
Short Summary

I am Stephanie Mazzella, a 24-year-old 7th grade teacher in a high-poverty school with a dream to go on a world missions trip to Monterrey, Mexico. I want to make change that I am passionate about.

This is important to me because helping people is the most rewarding way I can think of to spend my time and any money I am able to raise. 

The money that I am able to raise with this contribution site will go towards travel expenses and donations to the missions group that will be attending the trip. On this trip, other dedicated young adults, and myself, will be working with children in an orphanage with others from Vineyard Church and Back2Back. These children come to the homes from a variety of backgrounds: neglect, abuse, abandonment, and simply the economic inability of the parents to provide for them.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the break down.

In order to make this a successful trip, I need to raise $2,500.00. This money goes towards paying for travel expenses and lodging.

Back2Back Mexico exists to serve the abandoned and neglected children of Monterrey, Mexico who live in the Casas Hogars (children’s homes). These children come to the homes from a variety of backgrounds: neglect, abuse, abandonment, and simply the economic inability of the parents to provide for them. It is our hope that each child would have a personal relationship with Jesus Christ and have opportunities for a meaningful life. By connecting mission groups from the United States with children's homes, Back2Back is able to meet the physical needs of the children while serving them spiritually. Back2Back is able to provide "care for today and hope for tomorrow" to the children of Monterrey. Groups also have the opportunity to serve through outreach. 

Whatever funds I raise through Indiegogo will go towards this trip, and I will contribute the rest myself. I WILL be going on this trip, no matter what! DEDICATION! 

Any and all contributions will be met with a thank you of handmad jewlery using vintage fabric. Please leave your shipping address! 

The Impact

This project will build a sense of community with our Vineyard Church, Back2Back Mexico, and all of the children we help to affect. It is a partnership of ministries that facilitates outward focused living and the ministry of the Holy Spirit. Basically - we'll be spreading the love!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't help monetarily? No problem!! 

Send prayers, thoughts, or good energy our way. We can use it!! 

Spread the word out and help make some noise about my campaign.

Facebook, Twitter, or other social media? Just use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU.

This trip has become my dream and sole focus and goal in the last month. I plan to make it happen, no matter what it takes. I am counting on support of friends, family, and strangers (and a miracle if I need one.) I promise that your support will not go unnoticed.

<3 Stephanie

story:
What We Are Hoping to Do

We are attempting to take a year and a half’s worth of failures, success, writing, learning, and pouring every spare minute of our creative ability into this full-length album. We want to give a piece of ourselves to you, the listener. We want to take our concepts and dreams and tangibly sculpt them into an experience for the people we love. After cutting our teeth on our first EP, which you funded and made possible, we discovered a vision for our sound and ideas that has culminated into this full-length project. But again, as with our EP, we need your help. We are putting in a lot of our own funds, and skipping a few meals, to afford this gift to you. Even so, we would be hard pressed to manage the funds necessary to see this album come to fruition. We humbly ask for your backing and support to help make our longstanding vision come to life. We cherish any donation, big or small, and Jason can’t wait to make you breakfast.

Our Position and the Risks

We have the help of a great friend, Paul Kimsal, who has agreed to record this album for us. The exciting part of where we are in life is that we have access to gear we wouldn't normally have access too in order to make a great recording. We are in a prime position to explore the avenues of sound we'd like to explore. Our biggest and only real issue with this project is overcoming the shear mountain of money it takes to see our vision all the way through. What we're asking for on Indiegogo is only a portion of what we project it costing us in the long run. With all that said I think our only real risk is not raising what we need.

How You Can Help


On the right side of the screen we have listed various perks for you, should you choose to back us with a bit of money. Anything from a $1 to $1,000 helps. But lets be honest we understand not all of us have extra money to give, and trust we understand that. If you'd still like to help us out please help us post this page and tell as many people as we can. Any bit of you, the reader, passing on our project to others helps. And we appreciate any help we can get.

story:
If you are a Mommy DIY-er get some great tricks and tips from Laurel Stavros at www.abubblylife.com  

 

Who I am and why I am asking for help.

My name is Jake and I am a Captain in the US Army.  One of the reasons why I applied to be a glass explorer is because I understand the barriers that can be created while trying to connect with friends and family over long distances.  My main goal in becoming a #glassexplorer is to help Google tear down those barriers and make time and distance irrelevant in relationships.  

I want to:

  • Work on ways to introduce seamless sharing of lifes one time moments.

  • Work on improvements to how we communicate with new technology.

  • Give constructive criticism in regards to the simplicity and ease of use of the device so everyone can use it.

  • Develop methods of productivity so we can spend less time working and more time with family.

  • Give my parents the opportunity to see their grandchild grow up (personal goal)

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $1500.00 (USD) funding to cover the cost of the device. (Selling this to the wife isn't so easy).

  • I will cover the cost to fly to San Fransisco to receive the device and training.

  • I will create an open group on Google+, Facebook, and Twitter to allow you all to share in the journey and take suggestions which I can pass along to #projectglass (crowdsourcing suggestions).

  • Anyone that contributes $100 or more will get invited to weekly Google+ Hangouts to discuss the progress of my review and have your suggestions and ideas highlighted when sent up to #projectglass

If I don't reach my entire goal I will use what money you all have funded towards purchasing Google Glasses. If I get overfunded then I will use the extra money towards taking my 18 month old son to Disneyland for our first Google Glass adventure!

The Impact

We can help create a product that will change the way we communicate, we will erase the gap of time and distance.    

My military experience will assist in my ability to compile organize and distribute relevant information to improve the project.  

My life in the military and 2 deployments qualify me as someone who understands how relationships can be broken, strained, or orphaned because of time and distance.  

I am fully committed to helping #projectglass get the best experience into the hands of the end user.  

 

Google+ http://goo.gl/c3U0g

Twitter: @jakebowenecu

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get this Project Out to as many people as possible.  The threshold for this project is so low; that volume is the key.  If we get this out to 3,000 people and they all contribute .50 cents we met our goal easily!

 

Use these Hashtags to get the word out!

#projectglass

#jakesprojectglass

 

Don't forget to use the share tools at the top of the page to get the word out!

Thanks for helping!!!
story_txt:
If you are a Mommy DIY-er get some great tricks and tips from Laurel Stavros at www.abubblylife.com  
 
Who I am and why I am asking for help.
My name is Jake and I am a Captain in the US Army.  One of the reasons why I applied to be a glass explorer is because I understand the barriers that can be created while trying to connect with friends and family over long distances.  My main goal in becoming a #glassexplorer is to help Google tear down those barriers and make time and distance irrelevant in relationships.  
I want to:


Work on ways to introduce seamless sharing of lifes one time moments.


Work on improvements to how we communicate with new technology.


Give constructive criticism in regards to the simplicity and ease of use of the device so everyone can use it.


Develop methods of productivity so we can spend less time working and more time with family.


Give my parents the opportunity to see their grandchild grow up (personal goal)

 
What We Need & What You Get


I need $1500.00 (USD) funding to cover the cost of the device. (Selling this to the wife isn't so easy).


I will cover the cost to fly to San Fransisco to receive the device and training.


I will create an open group on Google+, Facebook, and Twitter to allow you all to share in the journey and take suggestions which I can pass along to #projectglass (crowdsourcing suggestions).


Anyone that contributes $100 or more will get invited to weekly Google+ Hangouts to discuss the progress of my review and have your suggestions and ideas highlighted when sent up to #projectglass

If I don't reach my entire goal I will use what money you all have funded towards purchasing Google Glasses. If I get overfunded then I will use the extra money towards taking my 18 month old son to Disneyland for our first Google Glass adventure!
The Impact
We can help create a product that will change the way we communicate, we will erase the gap of time and distance.    
My military experience will assist in my ability to compile organize and distribute relevant information to improve the project.  
My life in the military and 2 deployments qualify me as someone who understands how relationships can be broken, strained, or orphaned because of time and distance.  
I am fully committed to helping #projectglass get the best experience into the hands of the end user.  
 
Google+ http://goo.gl/c3U0g
Twitter: @jakebowenecu
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Get this Project Out to as many people as possible.  The threshold for this project is so low; that volume is the key.  If we get this out to 3,000 people and they all contribute .50 cents we met our goal easily!
 
Use these Hashtags to get the word out!
#projectglass
#jakesprojectglass
 
Don't forget to use the share tools at the top of the page to get the word out!
Thanks for helping!!!

story:
Goodbye Nashville – a career restart

Listen to a track: http://www.elizalynn.com/new_cd_listen/

How do I begin again?  Next year will be the 10th anniversary of my first album, Frisky or Fair.  It is humbling to remember all the remarkable gifts that have come into my life from my community’s response to my first request for CD pre-orders.  Hearing my songs recorded, fleshed out – rhythms and solos – I can’t describe the literal ecstasy that I felt experiencing a vision come into being.  I made a band and learned to book gigs and play different kinds of venues and be on radio and TV and live at Abbey Road Studios (for goodness sake).  I got some pretty incredible feedback from lay folk and industry folk alike and had landmark gifts in the Putumayo album and performing in Scotland.

But three original albums in four years brought me to a state of near collapse.  Gone was the initial energy, the willingness to put up with the constant rejection required to be heard through the cacophony of a flooded market.  I’d moved to Nashville where I effectively became a hermit, paying down musical debt and just so grateful that my relationship to the medicine of music did not leave.  When my friends and fans pre-ordered the community produced album, I was given another gift in my exhausted state.  The songs that were chosen were a balm to my psyche, both to record and to hear. 

Little by little, things were changing in my relationship with the music business and my songs.  Singing one song in response to a sermon in a tiny Sunday evening service became so deeply fulfilling.  And then, in 2012, while playing music at a prayer retreat, I heard the words, “Divinity school is now.”  I followed those words and have just completed my first year of graduate theological education and it has been a tremendously healing experience.  I’m writing a thesis on American Blues as Contemporary Lamentations and amidst all my studies, it seems time to begin again with the business side of music.

And what better way to do that than to releasing my fourth album of original music?  It’s called Goodbye Nashville and it was recorded on the Isle of Mull one year ago with musicians from the Perthshire Amber festival: Gordon MacLean, Sorren MacLean, Hannah Fisher and Danny Grant who are simply stellar musicians and wonderful human beings.  They gave wings to these songs I have spent years crafting.  Three of these songs are co-written, an adventure I attempted while living in Nashville.  This album has been my companion through this year of rebuilding something that was broken through the grief of many losses.  A few days ago, the final mix was completed.  After months of back and forth with co-producer Gordon MacLean, this album is ready to leave the nest.

I’ve been invited to return to Scotland to perform this fall at Perthshire Amber Festival and can’t think of a better place to release this album that has so much of Scotland within it!  I need to raise $3,000 to have the album in hand.  If I’m able to raise $5,000, I can hire a publicist for a targeted campaign to radio and publications.

I don’t know exactly what my music business will look like this time around, but I know that this is one of the things I am called to do with my life. 

My gratitude for my community’s companionship with me through these years is enormous – literally the air and water for my seeds of artistry. Thank you so much for considering to join with me on this journey to restart my musical career.  Thank you is too small, but thank you so very much!

What I Need & What You Get

BREAKDOWN OF COSTS to release Goodbye Nashville:

· Mastering the album: $600

· Design of the album: $400

· Pressing 1,000 albums: $1,950 (includes shipping, etc)

· Hiring publicist for a limited radio and publication release: $1,600

· Fee for using Indiegogo: $200 (if goal is reached); $450 (if goal not reached)

If my goal is not quite reached, what we do raise will help me release the album on a smaller scale.  If we exceed the goal, there are many extras (videos, larger release, additional products, etc) that will become possible.

DISCOUNTED ALBUM for Previous Pre-orders:

For those of you who have pre-ordered my previous albums, you should have received a letter (similar to the one above, with an order form for albums at the reduced price of $15, shipping included).  If you didn’t receive a letter, it just means I don’t have a good current address for you.  Please send me an email (eliza@elizalynn.com) with your address and I’ll get one out to you.  I’m so grateful for everyone who continues to enjoy my music and order my albums.  It means more to me than you can know!

PERKS:

So I have some incentives if you’re able to give a little more than the cost of the album.  I am a quilter, so I’d like to offer this joy of mine to you.  For pictures of these items, please go to http://www.elizalynn.com/pre_order_2014 

· For $55, you’ll receive a signed album and a handmade, quilted potholder

· For $145, you’ll receive a signed album and a tea cozy

· For $500, I’ll put on a live concert at your home (or office, or backyard, etc) plus you’ll receive 5 signed albums.

· Now we get into some wild territory:

· For $1,000, I’ll make you a lap quilt (you can choose the colors and the quilt will be made within the year), plus you’ll receive 5 signed albums.

· For $2,000, I’ll make you queen or king size quilt (you can choose the colors and the quilt will be made within the year), plus you’ll receive 5 signed albums.

Every purchase also comes with my heart’s extreme gratitude and my exceeding anticipation for you to hear (and sing and dance along to) this album!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP OUT

I appreciate any and all assistance getting the word out about my album and this campaign project.  You can use this link to share on Facebook, Twitter, etc: http://igg.me/at/elizacd2014/x/7911216

Many, many thanks!

With love,

Eliza

story:
Hello !

Thanks for stopping by!

We'd like to invite you on an amazing journey of adventure. Take a seat, relax and take a moment to imagine the following:

Take the epic mysterious and dramatic tones of John Barry’s legendary James Bond tracks and combine it with a hint of jazz. Then add a swingy rhythm, and a large soulful voice of a modern diva.  Stir this well with a retro vibe that takes you way back to the sound of the freedom of the 1960s, and even further back to the foggy obscure back streets of the 1920s’ London. Season with a twist of sensual Frenchness and a glimpse of winter's frosty Scandinavian woods, and you get the sound of Grace Moon & The Jaguar - Epic, dramatic, deliciously crisp and classy and ready to eat.

Grace Moon & The Jaguar consists of London based, Danish singer-songwriter and pianist Grace Moon and French artist and producer JB Pilon. Together they have more than 35 years of experience in writing and performing music. 

Grace Moon has played classical piano since the age of 7, and started writing her own music when she was 10. Since beeing based in London she has worked with various musicians and producers, and performed her own music  in various legendary London Venues such as The Troubadour, The Forge and The Natural History Museum. The press wrote: "Mysterious and lovelorn soul-jazz-folk fusion is delivered with conviction. Playful yet graceful, a performance not to be missed."

JB Pilon is an established music producer and co own WAX recording studio in Dalston, London. At a young age his musical career has already taken him far. He produced a number of up and coming and established artists, worked for record labels, toured and performed countless liveshows and  composed and produced tracks for major worldwide TV commercials. His latest achievement includes production of the sound track for one of next years most hyped Hollywood films. Music is his life, and he breathes it around the clock. 


For the last year now, we have have put our hearts, souls, money and a lot of hard work into this project, and we have gathered some of the crème de la crème of London’s musicians to play along. We have chosen 5 melodies that are ready to be recorded at WAX studios in London. Now we just need a little bit of your help to make it happen.

We’ve got an amazing band together and are ready to kick off our UK tour as soon as the EP is done. Among our band members we count the honorable Paul Winterhart – the drummer of legendary British band Kula Shaker. 

We are incurable fire souls and absolutely passionate about what we do. Whether or not we reach our goal via Indiegogo, we will find a way to make this EP happen. 

We can’t wait to  share the music, play for you and just give back to all of those people who have helped make this possible!


Cost Breakdown

Total Cost: £ 2,700
  • Hiring session musicians : £1,850
  • Hiring strings & horns conductor : £200
  • Hiring extra engineers : £200
  • Grand piano recording : £150
  • Mastering the EP : £300

What if we raise more than the goal?

If we surpass the goal we will consult all of our backers to talk about PR, music videos, tours. This way you will be able to give your input on what the rest of the money should be spent on. 


List of Perks

£5: Download of one Track

Free download of your favourite track from the EP. 

£10: Download the EP

All five songs plus bonus track

£20: Physical CD

Remember those round shiny things from the good old days, with music, artwork and everything.

Will be sent by good old-fashioned post to your starving mailbox.

£50: Invitation for Launch Concert

Personal invitation for our EP launch concert in London (travel expenses not included)

£100: VIP ticket for Launch Concert, T-shirt & Hand Written Lyrics Sheet

Get a personal invitation and VIP access to meet the band after the launch concert. You also get a Grace Moon & The Jaguar T-Shirt and a hand written lyrics sheet to one song of your choice.

£250: Chose a Cover to be Recorded

Grace Moon & The Jaguar will record their acoustic version of a cover by your choice that you will receive along with a personal letter.

£ 500: Meeting and Acoustic Performance.

Meet Grace Moon & The Jaguar for a nice cup of tea (as we say in the UK) or a drink in London and get a private acoustic performance.

£ 750: Live Concert

A glamorous and festive live performance by our amazing band in your home or at another venue of your choice. Transportation and lodging not included.

£1000 or more: A Day with Grace Moon & The Jaguar at WAX Studio in London

Get a day with Grace Moon & The Jaguar at the recording studio WAX in London. Transportation and lodging not included.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Wether you are able to purchase any of our perks or not, there are sevral other ways to get involved and help us realise this EP.

    Make some noise, tell your friends about us, spread the word and share the love through:

    • Facebook
    • Twitter
    • Instagram: (Use the hashtag #GraceMoonAndTheJaguarIndiegogo and share our campaign link to give it some buzz!)
    • Youtube
    • Send us a greeting and say hello at info@gracemoonandthejaguar.com
    • Meet us and experience Grace Moon & The Jaguar live at one of our UK gigs in the Fall 2014
    • Or whatever you can think of!

    Get in touch! We would love to hear from you.

    If you have any questions, comments or if you would just like to say hello, we would love to hear from you:
    Drop us a line on info@gracemoonandthejaguar.com
    We are really very friendly and promise not to bite!

    Thank You!

    THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR TAKING THE TIME TO STOP BY AND FOR TAKING PART IN THIS PROJECT. 
    WE REALLY APPRECIATE IT!

    And finally a special thanks to:
    Kristina Sparsoe - our awesomely creative art director and graphic designer (check out her wickedness www.kristinasparsoe.dk)
    Sammy Deveille - our wicked videographer who made our video, and bassist of Grace Moon & The Jaguar. 
    Attila Gasparetz - Talented photographer and videographer who delivered clips for the video and will be doing our first music video. (Check him out http://fotogati.wix.com/gatifoto)

story:
Short Summary

The Shropshire Music Foundation, www.teachingchildrenpeace.org, organizes music classes for children and youth in war-affected areas of the world. Current programs in Kosovo, Uganda, and Northern Ireland teach peace through music by providing healthy activities and giving Youth Teacher Volunteers the chance to grow in confidence and skill by working with younger children.

At the University of Colorado Boulder, the Teaching Peace Through Music club has teamed up with similar organizations at the University of North Texas and Brigham Young University Hawaii to raise money for SMF through a fantastic Indiegogo campaign! Your support will help provide music instruments and instruction to students who live in violent areas and need a positive force in their lives! SMF hopes to begin new programs for refugee children in Syria and other areas of the world, and your donation will help them do it! Thank you so much for your support!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise over $2000 for the Shropshire Music Foundation to assist them in funding their music programs around the world - all funds raised will go directly to SMF and will be used to supply materials for music classes, training sessions for youth volunteers, and travel for SMF volunteers. SMF programs are run by locals in each country, and all money directly supports the children and youth who participate in the programs.

We want to thank you for your support with PRIZES! Here are the prize levels:

$10 will receive a personalized thank-you from a CU Boulder student!

$50 will receive a handmade bracelet, donated by friends of CU Boulder students!

$100 will receive a Shropshire Music Foundation t-shirt!

$150 will receive a Shropshire Music Foundation poster (Choose your country: Kosovo, Uganda, or Northern Ireland)! 

The highest five donors from the Boulder, Colorado area will receive vouchers for one CU Presents event at the University of Colorado Boulder!

The highest donor will receive a signed manuscript from composer Eric Whitacre!!

The Impact

The students at CU Boulder, UNT, and BYU Hawaii have been deeply inspired by Liz Shropshire and the Shropshire Music Foundation. The student clubs work to provide music service in their communities and host guest speakers who use music for unusual purposes, like SMF. SMF has been working in refugee camps and other areas for 15 years, and the current conflict in and around Syria (see links below) deserves a response that provides music education and a peaceful alternative to children and youth who are living in war-devastated areas. SMF's programs in Kosovo, Uganda, and Northern Ireland have benefitted thousands of children, and we are grateful for your help in continuing those programs as well. 

www.teachingchildrenpeace.org

http://data.unhcr.org/syrianrefugees/syria.php

http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/worldviews/wp/2014/09/22/the-worst-refugee-exodus-of-the-syrian-war-is-happening-right-now/

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your donations, but we also appreciate your networking! Please share our campaign with others who may be interested in supporting university student clubs for Peace Through Music and the Shropshire Music Foundation! Thank you!!

Your support will help provide music instruments and instruction to students who live in violent areas and need a positive force in their lives! SMF hopes to begin new programs for refugee children in Syria and other areas of the world, and your donation will help them do it! Thank you so much for your support!   What We Need & What You Get Our goal is to raise over $2000 for the Shropshire Music Foundation to assist them in funding their music programs around the world - all funds raised will go directly to SMF and will be used to supply materials for music classes, training sessions for youth volunteers, and travel for SMF volunteers. SMF programs are run by locals in each country, and all money directly supports the children and youth who participate in the programs.
We want to thank you for your support with PRIZES! Here are the prize levels:
$10 will receive a personalized thank-you from a CU Boulder student!
$50 will receive a handmade bracelet, donated by friends of CU Boulder students!
$100 will receive a Shropshire Music Foundation t-shirt!
$150 will receive a Shropshire Music Foundation poster (Choose your country: Kosovo, Uganda, or Northern Ireland)! 
The highest five donors from the Boulder, Colorado area will receive vouchers for one CU Presents event at the University of Colorado Boulder!
The highest donor will receive a signed manuscript from composer Eric Whitacre!!
    The Impact The students at CU Boulder, UNT, and BYU Hawaii have been deeply inspired by Liz Shropshire and the Shropshire Music Foundation. The student clubs work to provide music service in their communities and host guest speakers who use music for unusual purposes, like SMF. SMF has been working in refugee camps and other areas for 15 years, and the current conflict in and around Syria (see links below) deserves a response that provides music education and a peaceful alternative to children and youth who are living in war-devastated areas. SMF's programs in Kosovo, Uganda, and Northern Ireland have benefitted thousands of children, and we are grateful for your help in continuing those programs as well. 
www.teachingchildrenpeace.org


http://data.unhcr.org/syrianrefugees/syria.php
http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/worldviews/wp/2014/09/22/the-worst-refugee-exodus-of-the-syrian-war-is-happening-right-now/

Other Ways You Can Help

 We appreciate your donations, but we also appreciate your networking! Please share our campaign with others who may be interested in supporting university student clubs for Peace Through Music and the Shropshire Music Foundation! Thank you!!

story:
It's been almost 3 years and this band has been a crazy undertaking! (And we love every damn minute of it) We have released two EP's (Short CD's with 4-5 songs), had our single 'Out of This Place' play on commercial and college radio in many parts of Canada and opened for some iconic bands like Sloan. However, we are just getting started. From the very beginning we have always had such a supportive fanbase and for our next EP we really want to make something for you guys that is top notch! For those of you that might not be familiar with our music, we encourage you to check us out at www.amberwoodmusic.com 

Plan of Attack 

Over the past 2 months we have been working on some new material that we are very proud of. As we continue to hone our songwriting skills we feel our songs are always improving. 

We have had several meetings and begun the early stages of pre-production (writing songs, improving those songs, discussing tracklisting, structuring songs etc...) with a producer based in P.E.I named Paul Milner. Paul has over 30 years of experience in the music industry and has worked with some of he best talent in the world...too many to list.

We are going to be heading to his studio in P.E.I and staying there while we track the new EP. We will be there for at least a week while we try to create something you and Amberwood will love. We also plan on touring in the east coast area just prior to recording.

It was important for us to have plenty of time in the studio as well as completely immerse ourselves in the process. Being out in P.E.I by the water seemed like a perfect fit for us.

This will not be a cheap undertaking so we cannot do this without your help! 

What We Need & What You Get

What we are asking for is $8000 to fund this project. We don't want you to think we are just asking for a hand out. This is around 50% of what the project will cost us, so we have been saving our own money the best we can as well.

Why is it so expensive? Here are the costs associated with recording an EP.

Paul's Fee's: ~$12,000-$15,000 

Paul does a lot...he provides us a studio, helps create the best songs possible, mixes the recordings, masters the recordings etc etc. The price varies quite a bit based on several factors like bringing in guest instrumentalists for strings or horns, time spent in the studio and number of songs recorded (between 5-7 based on which songs work together and in what order) etc

Travel: $1000+

Gas money, lodging on the way over and all that good stuff.

Food: $500+

We can make a twice the deal pizza go a long way...but we do need to eat!

Lost Wages: 

We will all be missing work, digging us a deeper financial hole.

Perks:

You didn't think we would let you leave empty handed did you? In exchange for your generosity we are offering several cool packages.

Please refer to the side panel to check them out.

We are also adding an incentive. Due to high, high, high, high demand if we reach 50% of our campaign goal ($4000) we will shave the beards that all four of us have been cultivating over the last several months...hell we'll even make a video of the process! 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Money is tight, we totally get that...we experience it daily. Some of you just aren't at a point where you can make a financial contribution and that's understandable. 
This campaign will be running for 50 days so time is on your side.

You can also do your part by sharing this page with your friends, co workers and family! 

You can also come to a show or buy the album when it comes out.

Thank You

We really appreciate you taking the time to hear us out and we want to express our utmost gratitude in advance for any contributions: big, small or otherwise. 

We can't wait to share what we have created with you and are excited that you can all be part of the process!

Cheers,

Oli, Cam, Colin and Wes

story:
It's a LOVE thang...

FINALLY... I've signed CDs, addressed bubble envelopes and LOVE THANG is on it's way to you. *high five* Thank you for your patience. Cannot WAIT for you to hear it. 

Love Thang is now a REALITY! 

And your contribution helped me fund it all... musicians, studio time, engineering, production, session fees, CD art, CD production and mastering. 

THANK YOU!

no... seriously... 
THANK YOU.
Your support of me, independent artists & live music means the world to me and all of us out there, doing what we have to do, to pursue our dreams. There are days it is hard to listen and give the world the art that has been put in our hearts. 
YOU believing in us... fuels our fire. 
There are no words to express how much this means to me. 
SO... THANK YOU, again. And... again.
EP release concert is in the works. Watch for a date TBD this summer.
Love y'all soooo much.
*HUG*
Jeanne
---------------------------------------

Day-to-day, it's all about love, relationships and life. This EP is comprised of songs I've written / co-written about living love, losing love, giving love, surrendering... learning to love yourself. I cannot wait to share it with y'all. 

On 12/4, we went into the studio and recorded the EP live. We enlisted some extremely talented friends to pull it off:  Sam Hawksley (guitar, producer, vox), Tom Bukovac (guitar), Jared Kneale (drums), Billy Nobel (keys / b3 / wurli) and Brian Allen (bass). Not only are they musical friends, but they are world class musicians who play and record with some of your favorite artists (BoDeans, Keith Urban, Kacey Musgraves, Tim McGraw, Robben Ford). CANNOT WAIT for you to hear the love they put into these tracks!

I want to be the positive soundtrack in people's heads... Helping to feel hope and believe that there is something bigger than all of us out there. 

If all goes as planned, the new EP will be done in the next couple weeks.  Watch your mailboxes at the end of March!

Thank you... for listening, for believing, for loving on people with music. 

*love*
Jeanne

Songs we recorded:
  • It's a Love Thang (Jeanne Petersen / Ford Thurston)
  • Middle Years (Jeanne Petersen / Travis Meadows)
  • Nobody Wants to Say It (Jeanne Petersen / Bill Tennyson)
  • Ready for the Rain (Jeanne Petersen / Karleen Watt / Lisa Carver)
  • World Famous (Jeanne Petersen / Karleen Watt)
  • You Have Stayed at this Mountain (Jeanne Petersen / Bill Tennyson)

story:
Hello everybody,

For those of you who don’t know me, my name is Conor Standish, I’m a singer songwriter here in Cleveland, Ohio and I’m the lead singer and rhythm guitar player in a band called the Burning River Ramblers. 

Ever since I began writing songs in 8th grade, nothing has made me happier than sharing my music with other people and affecting them in a positive way. It’s a huge passion of mine and there is nothing I would rather do for as long as I possibly can.

Although I absolutely love collaborating with some amazing musicians and friends in the Burning River Ramblers, there are still a lot of songs that don’t fit our style that I would love to share with all of you and that I think you’ll love!

And that’s where I need your help! I want to do this right and I won’t be able to do it without all of you.

In April I’ll be taking a road trip with a few friends to record an EP in San Francisco at a place called Tiny Telephone. My good good friend Dave Young who played keys and co-produced BRR’s last album will be producing this EP and it will consist of around 4-6 songs. The money given will be used for studio time, hired musicians, mastering, CD production, and merchandising. The more money we raise, the better this project will be! The sky is the limit.

So here’s how you can help:

As you’ll see on this project’s IndieGoGo home page, there are certain gifts I have ready for you if you donate certain amounts of money. Some of the gifts I have for you are the actual EP, merchandise, personalized doodles, or you can even sing back up vocals on one of the songs!

Finally, for every $2,000 we raise, I’ll do something ridiculous. Here we go!!

story:
My Story

I've faced a number of hardships in my life, and in the pursuit of my dream career; but this, this was somewhere I never thought I would be. 

As someone who is constantly fighting for a position that almost doesn't exist amongst great competition and many many peers, I've become accustomed to struggles. I've fought through patches of time with no work, no money. I've fought through my parents telling me 100s of times to get a "real job." I've fought through being put down, being told I can't do what I want. And now I'm fighting through getting robbed.

I had a lot of stuff taken from me, my wife, my kids! Our Disneyworld fund, loose bills and change that we have saved up to take our kids to see their cartoon heroes. A camera and a big hard drive, full of all the pictures of our childrens' entire lives. Studio equipment including many expensive microphones, drums, guitars, guitar pedals and equipment including $1000s of pedals and a $1300 guitar amp head that were not even mine! And with no home insurance, the burden of this loss is upon me. 

I've never been one to ask for help, but my friend told me that if I set this up, he would contribute and even help me get contributors to help with the losses. I don't expect people that I may not even know to replace everything that was lost in this, but anything contributed will help me get back on my feet. I need to install an alarm system in my home, as well as replace some of the equipment I used to do the only job that I have. 

I don't have much to offer right now in way of "perks" but I am offering some $$ amount off of producers products that I sell in my store. 

My family and I thank you so much for your support, even if your support isn't by way of money, and its by way of SHARING this page with your friends through social media. EVERY SINGLE DOLLAR helps us get back into our home and helps me get back to work in my studio!

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU.

story:
Watch video en Español, en Français, auf Deutsch HERE: 



Here is Junior's story in his own words: 

Dear Sir / Madam,

My name is Junior Mamani. It is because my father likes a famous Argentinian football team called Boca Juniors. I am Peruvian and I live in Arequipa, a beautiful town in the south of my country.

I live with my parents and my four sisters. I am 24 years old and I am a musician. I have studied music in a national university of my town and I really enjoy it.

I come from a poor family but humble. Since I was a child I was very interested in music and I remember I used to sing songs that I heard from my father’s radio. One day, though he had not a lot of money he gave me a plastic saxophone with some holes. I did not know how to play it but I really tried hardly. Later when I was at the secondary school my father did a thing that would change my life until now. He had enrolled me on the school’s music band. I think it was the best present that I got in my life! I started playing tambourines, then cymbals, and finally and old euphonium. My older classmates and my band’s teacher said that you had good skills at learning and playing music. During the five years at school, the band took part in many competitions in different towns and many times I was in charge of the euphonium’s solos. At mid-last year at school I was so captivated by the trombone’s sound that I decided to learn trombone. 

My house in Arequipa

When I finished the school I was expected to study any career or degree course,but not music. I was 16 and at this point of my life I only thought of music more than other things – some of them were building,engineeringor law (which are the most important degree courses here) -, finally I decided upon music. In 2007 I applied to anuniversity and passed the school of Art and Music’s exam. It was a big step! Here, the true path of music began for me.

Recently, I was accepted to study at the Saatliche Hochschule für Musik Trossingen. I cannot believe it and my family too. Even my mother cried of happiness. 

I have little money but a lot of desires to study and experience the musical life in Germany. I hope you can help me to reach this dreamy wish and I will be really grateful! 

Junior Mamani

story:
Preaching to the Choir

Hexes is an electronic trio/music collective that started and formed in Portland, OR.  Hexes has a plethora of artists and contributors, but is recorded, performed and produced by its two core members, Gavin Neves, and Jeannie Colleene. we're just trying to get down and dirty, and remember what sweat feels like without having to make electronic jams with a lap top.

WE ARE HEXES: WE ARE TRYING TO GO ON TOUR ACROSS THE US TO SHARE OUR MUSIC WITH PEOPLE WHO WILL LISTEN AND LOVE.

 

There is never a proper way to start these. There is never a proper way to get over your own ego to ask for a little help in exchange for heart and soul I suppose. We've been at this a long time. A very long time. Max and I first started collaborating in some very poorly mismanaged projects in 2006/07ish, can't really be sure on which year but it was around then. It could've started 2 years earlier then that, the details are hazy. Anyway, we moved to portland and radically changed our perception about how we write and perform music. It was a mix of a lot of different experiences that cultivated us to step far outside our boundaries. Now we have made something very real out of it, and we are really excited to be doing it with some amazing people, and some other amazing opportunities. The reality is, so much of this stuff costs money that we would be silly to think we could do ALL of it on our own, or someone will cut us a break in a lump sum. We've been given access to enough resources that we can make this work, and give you guys some really cool stuff of ours in the process. So after finishing a record, and while waiting for it to finish with finalizing the masters and figuring out some last minute details with our upcoming LP we have started to plan a tour, and we need a little cash for it. IT would be so important to us if YOU, any of you, friend, family, or patron could be apart of this. We have been having an insane amount of fun and we would like to bring that to other people nationally, on our own terms and to the people that really want to hear it. We have some amazing merch to give you as a token of gratitude for your help. We are Hexes, we are an electronic music collective from portland, OR that has now been living on the road for a few weeks. Recording and playing on the west coast mostly and now we'd like to take it out even farther. The important part of this, is that we have a good majority of things covered, we just need to cover gas and help with pressing the 7" essentially. This is our first tour, there are so many things I could go into detail about what this trip means to us, and what we are doing, but it wouldn't be done justice in an internet blurb.

    The Impact

    Helping us with this, will immensely make an impact on the support of local music. It's rare for a band of our caliber to take to the states completely on our own, with no help from promoters, labels or anything in between. We are asking for support from the people that have been following us since our early incarnations, and hope to share our music with others along the way with this tour. Just trying to get it out there, ya know?

    Risks & Challenges

    The challenges we face right now, is proper promotion. We have a ton of friends that see this stuff and are probably fully supportive of what we're doing, however we're all friends here. We see everything in our feeds, half the time I find myself assuming people have seen stuff that I posted a week ago. Social media is growing so fast and works pretty effectively if things are given the proper press. We know you don't want to see someone asking you to give them a buck everyday on your Facebook, and thats totally cool. We're going to however promote as much as we need to to fulfill our goal. 

    Keeping this in mind, we are in strong support of the creative fervor that we would like to embellish within our own creative community. Showing that the things we are capable of are available and possible with the proper amount of dedication and passion for art.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't contribute, you mustn't worry! just spread the word to like-minded individuals that would want to see something like this achieve its goal! We would simply just like you to listen and love our music and maybe even share it with others.
story_txt:
Preaching to the Choir
Hexes is an electronic trio/music collective that started and formed in Portland, OR.  Hexes has a plethora of artists and contributors, but is recorded, performed and produced by its two core members, Gavin Neves, and Jeannie Colleene. we're just trying to get down and dirty, and remember what sweat feels like without having to make electronic jams with a lap top. 

WE ARE HEXES: WE ARE TRYING TO GO ON TOUR ACROSS THE US TO SHARE OUR MUSIC WITH PEOPLE WHO WILL LISTEN AND LOVE.
 
There is never a proper way to start these. There is never a proper way to get over your own ego to ask for a little help in exchange for heart and soul I suppose. We've been at this a long time. A very long time. Max and I first started collaborating in some very poorly mismanaged projects in 2006/07ish, can't really be sure on which year but it was around then. It could've started 2 years earlier then that, the details are hazy. Anyway, we moved to portland and radically changed our perception about how we write and perform music. It was a mix of a lot of different experiences that cultivated us to step far outside our boundaries. Now we have made something very real out of it, and we are really excited to be doing it with some amazing people, and some other amazing opportunities. The reality is, so much of this stuff costs money that we would be silly to think we could do ALL of it on our own, or someone will cut us a break in a lump sum. We've been given access to enough resources that we can make this work, and give you guys some really cool stuff of ours in the process. So after finishing a record, and while waiting for it to finish with finalizing the masters and figuring out some last minute details with our upcoming LP we have started to plan a tour, and we need a little cash for it. IT would be so important to us if YOU, any of you, friend, family, or patron could be apart of this. We have been having an insane amount of fun and we would like to bring that to other people nationally, on our own terms and to the people that really want to hear it. We have some amazing merch to give you as a token of gratitude for your help. We are Hexes, we are an electronic music collective from portland, OR that has now been living on the road for a few weeks. Recording and playing on the west coast mostly and now we'd like to take it out even farther. The important part of this, is that we have a good majority of things covered, we just need to cover gas and help with pressing the 7" essentially. This is our first tour, there are so many things I could go into detail about what this trip means to us, and what we are doing, but it wouldn't be done justice in an internet blurb.


The Impact
Helping us with this, will immensely make an impact on the support of local music. It's rare for a band of our caliber to take to the states completely on our own, with no help from promoters, labels or anything in between. We are asking for support from the people that have been following us since our early incarnations, and hope to share our music with others along the way with this tour. Just trying to get it out there, ya know?
Risks & Challenges

The challenges we face right now, is proper promotion. We have a ton of friends that see this stuff and are probably fully supportive of what we're doing, however we're all friends here. We see everything in our feeds, half the time I find myself assuming people have seen stuff that I posted a week ago. Social media is growing so fast and works pretty effectively if things are given the proper press. We know you don't want to see someone asking you to give them a buck everyday on your Facebook, and thats totally cool. We're going to however promote as much as we need to to fulfill our goal. 
Keeping this in mind, we are in strong support of the creative fervor that we would like to embellish within our own creative community. Showing that the things we are capable of are available and possible with the proper amount of dedication and passion for art.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, you mustn't worry! just spread the word to like-minded individuals that would want to see something like this achieve its goal! We would simply just like you to listen and love our music and maybe even share it with others.

story:
Unnecessarily Wordy Introduction 

You've been there. You've done that. Don't lie now, we know. We've all been in the position that our society has contractually agreed is known as being third-wheeled. You know, that spot where you have either accidentally or willfully intruded on an activity that was only supposed to be for your friend and his/her love interest/significant other/spouse. Awkward... What do you do now?

  • Wallow in denial?
  • Try to make the best of the present circumstances?
  • Act as if this is actually OK?
  • Leave?
  • Make an uncomfortably long Bulleted list to attempt to maintain some amount of self-confidence?
  • Make an even longer Bulleted list of reasons not to be third wheeled?
  • Read this Bulleted list in an effort to waste time in hopes that the merciless activity in which you are presently engaged will soon cease?
The real solution to this predicament is to find the first natural exit out of the scenario, (if you're socially inept, you can pretty much forget that... but it's OK, just wait for this next part) we suggest you find the first access hatch to the interwebs, and join.

Join What, You Ask?

Well, Mon Capitaine, thank you for inserting this obviously unnecessary, but importantly bolded title (and also, a conveniently placed lead-in) for our further deconstruction.

The Fellowship

IN PLAIN ENGLISH

(Apologies to those who don't speak the language)

The Fellowship of the Third Wheel is an online group of real people who feel that at some point in their life, they've been a third wheel. Once you contribute, you're in the club, forever a member. If you don't contribute, we guess you can still be a member, but no one will really know about it. The club is open to everyone, and we don't judge. Ever. It's just not our place. We're here to have fun and maybe to start a movement, so please don't do something dumb and then stick it to us. This is a place where we can all make fun of ourselves for being that dreaded extra tire, and have a good shared laugh about our condition in relation to the universe. If you've been third-wheeled you know what it's like to be the square peg trying to fit through the circular hole we call society. But it's people like us that really make the world go round, so let's make it a better place. Join us in this gag, wear a pin, stick a bumper sticker, or just talk about us. The only thing it can do is lower other people's opinion of you. But who really cares about that?

>Begin Sarcastic Lawyerspeak< (refer back to "In Plain English" should you want to absolve yourself of comical satire and/or extraneous cognitive effort)

The body/organized group heretofore known as "The Fellowship of the Third Wheel" and referenced within this page and in common speech as "The Fellowship" is an organization dedicated to and comprised of those willing members of society who have been, in past times, or are presently subjected to the circumstantial events which can be without reasonable doubt identified under the social misnomer of "third-wheeling". The facets of the aforementioned condition need only be measured by the victim of said condition to have, for all intents and purposes, suffered said misnomer. Additionally, the only witnesses necessary, aware or unaware that said circumstances had ensued, are the remaining two individuals (usu. romantically endowed) creating the paradigm. There is no infringement of membership rights upon those other individuals should they, too have at some point been "third-wheeled", and testament is not deemed necessary by the witnesses. Those in Membership of the Fellowship of the Third Wheel, after their original monetary contributions, are hereby non-contractually obligated to treat said membership with reasonable respect in compliance with the rules of society, and are detracted from using the name or status of said Fellowship with any indication or association of vanity, negligence, violence, or misconduct of any type. The intent of the Fellowship is solely of Comic Relief, a sense of belonging among it's membership, and the precursor to a guerrilla mission to civilize. The Fellowship, it's founding party, and it's membership does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, gender, race, disability, lifestyle choices, opinion, or any other factor by which one or more humans might possibly discriminate against another. It's membership is open to any good-natured and humor-minded human individual(s), and guarantees upon initial commitment a lifetime inclusion. No individual shall have the power to control/dictate the Fellowship, and no person(s) may claim the right to have founded/lead it. Anonymity will hereby be maintained by the publishers of official Fellowship material. Additionally, in no way is The Fellowship intending to parody any other organization, including the Brotherhood of the Third Wheel.

>End Lawyerspeak< (If you suffered through that, good for you! You've officially read your first set of terms and conditions.)


If You've Read This Far, You Must Be Reeeeaaaaallly Bored

Oh no! Another Bulleted list!

  • There is absolutely no reason in the realm of sanity that you shouldn't have found this page at least slightly amusing.
  • Don't think that if you click off of this page without a contribution that you'll have heard the last of the Fellowship.
  • I think I've adequately made my point with three bullets.
  • But I'm going to add a fourth just in case.

Congratulations! You've Successfully Scrolled to the Bottom of the Page! 

Just in case you missed anything:

  • All of the important information is above this.
  • No, the person agreement throughout the page is not sound. Yes, this was intentional. Deal with it, grammar nazis!
  • The Fellowship really likes Bulleted lists.
  • We hope you contribute and join!
Have a great day, and thanks for taking this page (completely) seriously!

story:
Hello!

Amoret is recording their third EP in Nashville and needs YOUR help!

2015 was a great year for us. We released HRZN EP, an album we wrote and recorded completely on our own, at the beginning of the year and kicked it off with an incredible release party full of music, great beer, and Star Wars.

We played tons of shows throughout the year and met amazing people. Now, we caught the writing bug and want to create something better than ever to share with you.

We put together all the funds Amoret had on flights to get there and back again (hehe). We figured we had saved some personal funds and could make it happen, and then something exciting happened...

Guitarist CJ Ramsey and singer Christine Graham got engaged! (cue this song from Aladdin https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GuZ2EwbxCZc)

And with all the fun and excitement of wedding planning, also comes the dispersement of personal funds. 

So, that's where you guys come in!

Who is Amoret?

We are Amoret and we reign from the center of the Golden State. We are a pop-infused synth rock quartet, blending our upbeat, synth-driven persona with rock and roll. 

Together for four years, we have developed from our singer's solo-project into a band likened to Canadian act Metric with a presence that both captivates audiences and makes them want to dance. 

Amoret is:

  • Christine Graham: Vocals and keyboard
  • CJ Ramsey: Guitar
  • Jared Johns: Bass
  • Joshua Ramsey: Drums

Here are the deets:

We are recording at the Tiny Tape Room in Nashville, Tennessee with our friend, and the incredibly talented, Kyle Monroe. (http://www.tinytaperoom.com) We're recording October 10-17. 

  • Writing and recording our first full-band EP was an incredible learning experience, and now we would love to create a quality product with an incredible engineer.
  • We will be recording four songs. Recording, mixing, and mastering will come out to approximately $2,200. 
  • Pressing the album, posters, and other merchandise for the album will cost about $800.
  • Your contributions will be worth your while! Anything from the CD itself, to signed t-shirts, to even a pizza party with the band! We want to let you know that we appreciate each and every donation.
  • If we do not reach our funding goal, it could lead to us recording fewer songs, producing less merchandise, and could delay the production of the album altogether.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate, you can still help! Share our campaign with your hip friends on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or wherever else you internet! And spread the word with the hashtag #AmoretGoGo
  • The more people our campaign reaches, the better chance we have at reaching our goal!

Thank you for reading. We love you all.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! My name is Zach Dufrene, and I have a pop rock project called Substance. I've just recently recorded a song called "I Always Knew" that I feel will be of much value in the world we live in. This is an uplifiting, positive song about communion, love, and compassion -- about seeing our fellow man as an extension of ourselves. It is melodic, sweet, and sincere, and I think a wide demographic of people will connect with it.

What I'm aiming for now is a completely professional music video to help launch "I Always Knew" as Substance's debut single. In today's music industry, the visual component that goes along with radio singles is nearly as important as the actual audio recording itself. I believe that in releasing a great-looking video, I will enable this song to reach far more people. It is my dream to inspire and move people with the power of music, and I know that, with YOUR help, this video will be among my most valuable tools in seeing that dream through!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this music video the success I know it can be, the project will need funding -- specifically $5,000. Generally speaking, this is a rather small budget for a music video, though thankfully, I have an experienced director on board, Reed Daigle, who will use his resources and networking to achieve the highest quality product possible. Your monetary contributions will go into everything from lighting to cinematography to establishing locations for shooting and editing/post-production. Every little bit helps and is greatly appreciated!

*Those who contribute $10 or more will receive name recognition and special thanks when the video is finally posted online!

*Those who contribute $100 or more will be welcome to participate IN THE VIDEO as an extra! Won't it be fun to tell all your friends and family that you're famous now?  ;-)

*Those who are extra generous, contributing $1,000 or more, will be on Substance's guest list at EVERY live show in the future -- that means FREE admission for life! That's right: you'll be a part of the Substance family.

The Impact

In addition to furthering my craft, this music video will in fact give my South Louisiana community some well-deserved attention. There's actually a tremendous amount of musical and artistic talent in my hometown of Houma (and its surrounding areas) -- some of these individuals may even appear in the video. I would love for a spotlight to finally be shined here, and I know the community would be incredibly excited about that as well! Together, we can put Houma on the map!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have the means to contribute monetarily, you can still be a HUGE help to this campaign:

MAKE SOME NOISE! Share this campaign wherever you can! Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, anywhere... Get the word out that an awesome music video is being made that will not only contribute to the success of up-and-coming musicians, but will promote a message of love and peace throughout the world. It's going to be an absolutely rewarding and fun experience!

story:
Dear June was created almost serendipitously. Liz was called, last minute, to do backing vocals on a song for a friend of a friend, who just happened to be Justin. Their voices blended so perfectly together, that neither of them could pass up the opportunity to do something bigger. 

Dear June's first EP was released last summer, as a duo, and Justin and Liz toured all over New England, playing to crowds, sized anywhere from 1-100. At the end of August, we knew we wanted four more along side us. 


Pedro, Harry, and Dan joined the team with an incredible force, and together we've created a sound that we are exceedingly proud to share with you. 

We just finished recording our second EP, Come Around. After a 72 hour lockout in the studio, we're ready to stretch our legs and go on an adventure. We want to share our music with you. 


As most people know, being a musician isn't a very lucrative profession in it's early stages, but we are so driven and passionate about our art, and with your help, we can make this next step happen. 


We are investing in a hitch and trailer for our gear, and we need fuel to get from city to city. Accommodations will be necessary so Pedro can get his beauty sleep. We'll need an allowance for meals so we can keep our energy up, and a savings for the potential flat tire or break down.

 

We are so grateful for any help you can give. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and support our passions, dreams, and future. See you on the road!
