story:
ENGLISH VERSION BELOW! THANK YOU! 


Hallo, mein Name ist Katharina Maschmeyer, ich bin professionelle Saxophonistin und Komponistin aus Deutschland und brauche dringend Ihre Unterstützung, um das nächste Album Projekt unseres Quartetts (KA MA Quartet - „A Love Supreme / Universal Tone“ - A Tribute to John Coltrane) sorgenlos abschließen zu können. 

Kurze Info zum Album:

Nach drei weltweit veröffentlichten Alben und einer limitierten Vinyl Ausgabe eines Studiokonzerts in den Bauer Studios plant unser KA MA Quartet jetzt erstmalig die Veröffentlichung eines Tribute Albums „A Love Supreme / Universal Tone“ zu Ehren von Saxophonist John Coltrane. Auf diesem Album gibt es neben neuen Stücken des Quartetts eine neue Interpretationen der legendären Suite „A Love Supreme“ von John Coltrane zu hören. Als Gast für die Produktion konnten wir den indonesischen Percussionisten Nippy Noya, einen der bekanntesten Conga- Spieler/Legenden in Europa, gewinnen.

Das KA MA Quartet ist ein Bandprojekt, in das ich die letzten zehn Jahre investiert habe und all meine Energie reingesteckt habe. Das bedeutet u.a. komponieren, proben, Managementarbeit, Konzertbooking und Alben für die Band produzieren. Es ist für Jazz Musiker generell nicht leicht, ein eigenes Projekt auf den Markt zu bringen. Die Album Produktionen kosten eine Menge Geld, welches man als ausübender Musiker aber nur schwerlich verdient. 

Das neue Album bedeutet uns extrem viel! 

Wir wollen mit diesem Tribute Album in erster Linie John Coltrane für seine Musik und ebenso kraftvollen Aussagen danken. Die legendäre Suite  „A Love Supreme“ hat eine immense Kraft und in gewisser Weise auch eine „reinigende, heilende“ Wirkung auf uns. Sie hat uns schon in vielen Situationen beigestanden, so dass es uns ein Bedürfnis war, diese Musik einmal selbst zu spielen.

Die Idee für dieses Album und auch das Arrangement der Suite kam letztendlich von unserem Gitarristen Nils Pollheide und stieß bei allen auf Begeisterung, insbesondere nachdem wir uns das erste Mal getroffen haben, um diese Suite zu spielen. Denn beim Spielen dieser Suite ging es uns vor allem um das musikalische Zusammenspiel und das Freisetzen von Energie. Wir danken auch Nippy Noya für seine musikalische und inspirierende Unterstützung bei diesem Projekt.

Für einen ausführlicheren Eindruck der Musik finden Sie noch weitere Hörbeispiele auf meiner Website: www.katharina-maschmeyer.com

Warum benötige ich Unterstützung: 

Das Album wurde von uns bereits aufgenommen, gemischt und gemasterd. Ich brauche aber noch dringend Unterstützung, um das Label und den Promotor finanzieren zu können. 

Die Arbeitsbedingungen für Jazz Musiker in Deutschland sind so prekär, dass es für mich immer schwieriger wird, ein neues Album zu produzieren. 
Eine aktuelle Studie der Union Deutscher Jazzmusiker zeigt diese Lage auf:
http://www.ndr.de/kultur/musik/jazz/Studie-zu-Arbeitsbedingungen-von-Jazzmusikern,studie240.html

Was ich brauche:

Ich versuche 6000€ mit dieser Aktion zusammen zu bekommen. 
Folgendes habe ich bereits gezahlt:
das Aufnahme Studio (3 Tage) Fattoria Musica Osnabrück 
den Toningenieur für diese 3 Tage
den Mix von Adrian von Ripka in den Bauer Studios in Ludwigsburg
das Master von patchmusic
den Photographen 
das Werbevideo

Für folgendes benötige ich noch 6000€ (diese Summe ist deutlich kleiner als das, was ich bisher schon für die Produktion gezahlt habe):

die Plattenfirma / das Label Neuklang
das Artwork für die CD
den Promotor

Das Label ist notwendig, um die CD auf den Markt zu bringen und weltweit erhältlich zu machen. Der Promotor ist wichtig für uns, um das Album in ganz Deutschland (Radios/Jazz Magazine) publik zu machen. Die Summe von 6000€ würde es mir ermöglichen, sorgenlos ohne Schulden an dem Projekt weiter arbeiten zu können. Dies bedeutet für mich, weiter zu komponieren, weitere Produktionen zu planen, Konzerttouren zu organisieren etc. 

Ich danke vielmals für Ihre Hilfe!

Was Sie bekommen: 

Für jede Spende bekommen Sie eine Vergütung. Die Angebote stehen auf der rechten Seite. Ich hoffe, dass Sie dort ein interessantes Angebot für sich finden. Falls Sie eine andere Angebotskombination haben möchten, kontaktieren Sie mich gerne! Falls Sie eine andere Zahlungsmethode wählen wollen oder Probleme mit der vorgesehenen Zahlungsweise haben, kontaktieren Sie mich auch gerne! Unter info@katharina-maschmeyer.com können Sie mich anschreiben, falls Sie direkt auf mein Konto überweisen wollen. 

Auf www.katharina-maschmeyer.com finden Sie unsere Tourdaten, falls Sie eine Freikarte zu einem unserer kommenden Konzerte vorbestellen möchten.

Wie kann ich das Projekt unterstützen ohne zu spenden? 

Falls Sie mich nicht finanziell unterstützen können, Ihnen das Projekt aber gefällt, bin ich jedoch sehr dankbar, wenn Sie dieses Video bzw. auch die Info zu dem Crowdfunding an Freunde, Kollegen, Bekannte etc. weiterleiten. 

DANKE VIELMALS!



ENGLISH VERSION: 

Who I am:

I`m Katharina Maschmeyer, a professional saxophon player and composer from Germany, and I need your help to finish my next project.

Following three regular studio albums, the KA MA Quartet wants to release their first tribute album called "A love supreme / Universal Tone". It will feature new interpretations of John Coltrane’s legendary suite „A Love Supreme“. The album will also feature a very special guest: legendary Indonesian percussionist Nippy Noya, one of the most renowned and sought-after conga players in Europe. 

The KA MA Quartet is a jazz band, I put all my efforts in over the whole last 10 years. It is a long hard way for jazz musicians to move their project forward. It is hard to pay the money for new albums and to earn money as a musician in general and also to do the booking work for the project. 

I believe in this new album called "A love supreme / Universal Tone". It means really much to me:

We wanted to record this music, because the music of John Coltrane has such a great impact! It is music, which helps you in bad situations and even haves a curative effect. And it felt so natural and absolut right to play this music with the quartet. It felt almost spiritual. And we want to thank John Coltrane for his music and message.

Please listen to some more music of the album, if you are interested, and also to get a proper impression of the music on 

www.katharina-machmeyer.com

The album is already recorded, mixed and mastered. 

But I need your help to release and promote it. The conditions for jazz musicians, to earn money with jazz concerts and teaching are that bad, that it becomes more and more difficult for me to produce new albums. And concerning album productions it is for most jazz musicians normal, that they invest really much money in productions, but don't earn money with it. 

(If you are interested: Here is an actual study about jazz musicians work condition:

http://www.ndr.de/kultur/musik/jazz/Studie-zu-Arbeitsbedingungen-von-Jazzmusikern,studie240.html)

(And at least John Scofield said: you can start to earn some money with your own music if you manage to release 7 albums. Please help me with no 5, so I don't need to bug you guys anymore;) 

What I need:

I try to reach a goal of 6000€. 

I already covered:
the recording studio (3 days) Fattoria Musica in Osnabrück 
the engineer
the mix by Adrian von Riepka at Bauer Studios Ludwigsburg
the master by patch music
the photograph 
and at least the video 

What I still need money for, in total 6000€, less than I already spend:
the record label
the artwork
the promotor

The record label is necessary to make the album available in record stores and in the internet. The promotor is important for us to promote the album in germany and to make it public.
If I would reach the whole amount of 6000€, I don't have to overdraw my bank account that much, and I will try to save more money to release the album at a later time also on vinyl.....or organize some more concerts for the quartet with Nippy Noya.....and at least the work for the next album can start, when this one is released.

Thank you so much for your help!

What You Get:

For every donation you can receive perks. You can see them on the right side. I hope there will be something of interest to you. Feel free to contact me as well and propose other combinations that are more appealing to you. Donations are not necessarily connected to the perks. And please contact me as well if you encounter difficulties with not having PayPal.

How you can help without donating:

I understand very well that you might not have the financial opportunity to donate to this project. Still, there are other ways to help me and I will be very thankful if you did: 

Share this video with your family, friends and colleagues and please don´t forget to send a link to this tool and website. In that way people can easily see how to donate and read all the information.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!
story_txt:
ENGLISH VERSION BELOW! THANK YOU! 

Hallo, mein Name ist Katharina Maschmeyer, ich bin professionelle Saxophonistin und Komponistin aus Deutschland und brauche dringend Ihre Unterstützung, um das nächste Album Projekt unseres Quartetts (KA MA Quartet - „A Love Supreme / Universal Tone“ - A Tribute to John Coltrane) sorgenlos abschließen zu können. 

Kurze Info zum Album:Nach drei weltweit veröffentlichten Alben und einer limitierten Vinyl Ausgabe eines Studiokonzerts in den Bauer Studios plant unser KA MA Quartet jetzt erstmalig die Veröffentlichung eines Tribute Albums „A Love Supreme / Universal Tone“ zu Ehren von Saxophonist John Coltrane. Auf diesem Album gibt es neben neuen Stücken des Quartetts eine neue Interpretationen der legendären Suite „A Love Supreme“ von John Coltrane zu hören. Als Gast für die Produktion konnten wir den indonesischen Percussionisten Nippy Noya, einen der bekanntesten Conga- Spieler/Legenden in Europa, gewinnen.

Das KA MA Quartet ist ein Bandprojekt, in das ich die letzten zehn Jahre investiert habe und all meine Energie reingesteckt habe. Das bedeutet u.a. komponieren, proben, Managementarbeit, Konzertbooking und Alben für die Band produzieren. Es ist für Jazz Musiker generell nicht leicht, ein eigenes Projekt auf den Markt zu bringen. Die Album Produktionen kosten eine Menge Geld, welches man als ausübender Musiker aber nur schwerlich verdient. 
Das neue Album bedeutet uns extrem viel! Wir wollen mit diesem Tribute Album in erster Linie John Coltrane für seine Musik und ebenso kraftvollen Aussagen danken. Die legendäre Suite  „A Love Supreme“ hat eine immense Kraft und in gewisser Weise auch eine „reinigende, heilende“ Wirkung auf uns. Sie hat uns schon in vielen Situationen beigestanden, so dass es uns ein Bedürfnis war, diese Musik einmal selbst zu spielen.Die Idee für dieses Album und auch das Arrangement der Suite kam letztendlich von unserem Gitarristen Nils Pollheide und stieß bei allen auf Begeisterung, insbesondere nachdem wir uns das erste Mal getroffen haben, um diese Suite zu spielen. Denn beim Spielen dieser Suite ging es uns vor allem um das musikalische Zusammenspiel und das Freisetzen von Energie. Wir danken auch Nippy Noya für seine musikalische und inspirierende Unterstützung bei diesem Projekt.

Für einen ausführlicheren Eindruck der Musik finden Sie noch weitere Hörbeispiele auf meiner Website: www.katharina-maschmeyer.com

Warum benötige ich Unterstützung: Das Album wurde von uns bereits aufgenommen, gemischt und gemasterd. Ich brauche aber noch dringend Unterstützung, um das Label und den Promotor finanzieren zu können. 
Die Arbeitsbedingungen für Jazz Musiker in Deutschland sind so prekär, dass es für mich immer schwieriger wird, ein neues Album zu produzieren. Eine aktuelle Studie der Union Deutscher Jazzmusiker zeigt diese Lage auf:http://www.ndr.de/kultur/musik/jazz/Studie-zu-Arbeitsbedingungen-von-Jazzmusikern,studie240.html

Was ich brauche:

Ich versuche 6000€ mit dieser Aktion zusammen zu bekommen. Folgendes habe ich bereits gezahlt:das Aufnahme Studio (3 Tage) Fattoria Musica Osnabrück den Toningenieur für diese 3 Tageden Mix von Adrian von Ripka in den Bauer Studios in Ludwigsburgdas Master von patchmusicden Photographen das Werbevideo

Für folgendes benötige ich noch 6000€ (diese Summe ist deutlich kleiner als das, was ich bisher schon für die Produktion gezahlt habe):

die Plattenfirma / das Label Neuklangdas Artwork für die CDden Promotor

Das Label ist notwendig, um die CD auf den Markt zu bringen und weltweit erhältlich zu machen. Der Promotor ist wichtig für uns, um das Album in ganz Deutschland (Radios/Jazz Magazine) publik zu machen. Die Summe von 6000€ würde es mir ermöglichen, sorgenlos ohne Schulden an dem Projekt weiter arbeiten zu können. Dies bedeutet für mich, weiter zu komponieren, weitere Produktionen zu planen, Konzerttouren zu organisieren etc. 
Ich danke vielmals für Ihre Hilfe!

Was Sie bekommen: 
Für jede Spende bekommen Sie eine Vergütung. Die Angebote stehen auf der rechten Seite. Ich hoffe, dass Sie dort ein interessantes Angebot für sich finden. Falls Sie eine andere Angebotskombination haben möchten, kontaktieren Sie mich gerne! Falls Sie eine andere Zahlungsmethode wählen wollen oder Probleme mit der vorgesehenen Zahlungsweise haben, kontaktieren Sie mich auch gerne! Unter info@katharina-maschmeyer.com können Sie mich anschreiben, falls Sie direkt auf mein Konto überweisen wollen. Auf www.katharina-maschmeyer.com finden Sie unsere Tourdaten, falls Sie eine Freikarte zu einem unserer kommenden Konzerte vorbestellen möchten.

Wie kann ich das Projekt unterstützen ohne zu spenden? 
Falls Sie mich nicht finanziell unterstützen können, Ihnen das Projekt aber gefällt, bin ich jedoch sehr dankbar, wenn Sie dieses Video bzw. auch die Info zu dem Crowdfunding an Freunde, Kollegen, Bekannte etc. weiterleiten. 
DANKE VIELMALS!

story:
Hey, y'all! Welcome to my Indiegogo Campaign!

My name is Elijah Mann (you can call me Eli), I am a Boston-based folk rock singer from Glastonbury, Connecticut. I'm finishing up my Songwriting/Poetry diploma at Berklee College of Music, I'm an avid street performer who can be spotted on Newbury Street, I'm a self-proclaimed coffee geek, and most recently, I'M RECORDING MY FIRST ALBUM!

You read that correctly, folks. I'm in the process of rehearsing and recording my debut album, a five-track EP called To Fall Apart. I've been writing these songs for the better part of four years now, touching on topics such as family, love, loss, fragility, and healing. To Fall Apart focuses on what exactly it means to "fall apart", and how sometimes it's the best thing one can do.

One problem though: A project like this with the right players, producers, engineers, etc can get pricy. Adding up the prices of studio time, paying the amazing people who are working on this album, and getting my music distributed to all of you lovely people comes to a grand total of $4,500! And that, my friends, is where YOU come in...

I cannot make this album without you! So for the next 30 days, we'll be running this campaign, offering you some amazing stuff in return for your donations. I'll be giving away signed CDs, buttons, lyric posters, t-shirts, hand-written notes/lyrics, and multiple opportunities to be personally serenaded by yours truly! This is gonna be fun, get in on this!

Thank you so much in advance for taking the time to donate and come along on this incredibly exciting adventure with me! Let's make some beautiful music together!

-Elijah Mann

story:
In the late 1990s I recorded two CDs of solo compositions for acoustic harmonica, "The Act of Being Free in One Act" and "The Second Act of Free Being," that are unlike anything recorded before or since.  The critically celebrated compositions on those records have been featured in films, TV, stage productions, independent radio, and original choreography.  In the early 2000s I began working with the multiFX devices produced by Digitech and others, and this recording represents my first full-length record of songs that use my electronic sounds and advanced harmonica techniques to drive a rock band.  

I've had a lot of time to work on it.  My performing career was cut short in 2002 when my wife was nearly killed by a physician's error.  In between session gigs, I've focused on developing my electronic sounds and incorporating my advanced harmonica techniques into the language of rock.  I'm ready to lay it all down.  

I've signed on Ed Abbiati, leader of the Lowlands band, whose records I've played on since 2008, to produce the record, and I've got Mike "SloMo" Brenner, with whom I've played on several of Ed's records, to play lap steel guitar.

Together, we're going to make a record that's dark and driving, something that lives in the intersection of Morphine, Little Walter, and the White Stripes. The goal is to define the role of harmonica in amplified music for the 21st century. 

Ambitious? Just wait.  And while you're waiting, check out the clips in the Updates section of this campaign so you get a taste of what 21st century harmonica sounds like.

story:
Be a part of making the Bridge of the Pacific 2016 tour happen! 

Bone Canyon will be flying out to the West Coast to play Portland, Oregon on February 19th, 2016 then traveling to Seattle, Washington to play the historic Columbia City Theater on February 21st, 2016.

We need your help to offset flights and hotel costs.   Any contribution is appreciated.  If you aren't able to contribute you can still assist by getting the word out, share the campaign, or come to the shows!  \m/

With big riffs driven by a whirlwind of hair and sweat, Honolulu’s Bone Canyon proves that living in paradise does not dull the intensity of their modern metal sound.

Formed in late 2012, vocalist Venus Trombley, guitarist/vocalist Ray Kan, bassist Mike Yeung, and drummer Kevin 'T-bone' Boehning met while playing shows at numerous venues around the island with their former bands Wicked Scarlet, Rolling Fire, and Big Toe.

Fueled by a common love of rock and metal, they set out to write original material filtered through their combined influences to produce songs that are heavy, challenging, and accessible.  The result is a sound that combines the aggression of Thrash, the groove of Stoner, and the experimentation of Progressive Metal.

Having recorded and released 4 songs including crowd favorites "Splinters" and "Within Without” which have received airplay on Honolulu Rock station K-Rock 101.5 FM, Bone Canyon are in the process of writing and recording additional material for a full CD release in Fall 2015.

In between song writing and recording, Bone Canyon has played shows at several Oahu music venues including Crossroads at Hawaiian Brian's, Station Bar, Rock Bottom, Kemo'o Farms, Rivals, and Kualoa Ranch in addition to having recently returned from a tour of the Pacific Northwest in January 2015 including shows in Portland, Oregon and Vancouver, Washington.

Bone Canyon achieved a career highlight when they were tapped to open for Metal giants Mastodon at the famed Honolulu concert venue The Republik on April 4, 2015

story:
This campaign is now officially over. Massive thanks to everybody who contributed!

You can now pre-order the R.I.S vinyl from our own shop instead :

http://www.crashdiet.org/audio-video/lp/rest-in-sleaze-gatefold-lp-detail.html

Thank You!


Dear Dïetheads, as you're most likely already aware of, our debut album Rest In Sleaze just turned 10 years old and we want to celebrate this with you!

This was the album that started it all, back in 2005, and a vinyl edition have been frequently requested by fans ever since it first came out on CD. We're now extremely pleased over the fact that we will be able to purchase the licensing rights straight from Universal, which means that we have permission to release a worldwide limited edition of 1.000 vinyls.

However, this means that there are costs involved that we usually don't have to deal with, such as Universal royalty fees (€4000), a proper remaster for vinyl (€1000), artwork adapted for gatefold vinyl (€350), professionally shot band photos from 2005 (never published before) (€200), just to name a few. Another challenge with vinyl in general is the shipping cost we have to add to every order, that we cannot do much about - shipping vinyl worldwide from Sweden is retartedly expensive...

Still... We don't feel comfortable letting any other record company release this for us. Control freaks as we are, we really want to do this ourselves, but counting all the factors above, this is a high risk project, which is why we chose to once again, reach out to you - our dear fans - to help us out. 

This is an "ALL OR NOTHING" campaign, meaning that unless we reach our €5000 goal, all your money will be paid back in full and the project will be canceled or put on hold.

Reserve your copy now, make this happen, celebrate with us and never forget the Dave Lepard legacy.

Cheers!

//LONDON, SWEET & YOUNG

story:
UPDATE: Stretch Goals!

Because this campaign took off in the first 24 hours, we're going to add some stretch goals to try to keep the giving going. While this money will adequately fund the recording itself, we can support these musicians and their teaching with a little bit more. Priorities for additional funding are:
  • Expanding our recording project to include other solo musicians' projects, like Moses Nante Ayambile:

  • We're also hoping to record Papagina performing solo on Kora:


Ideas moving beyond the recording project:

  • Buying/repairing drums, buying performance outfits/sticks/other equipment for Ehia Cultural Troupe - Joe's after-school drumming & dancing group

  • Providing some school supplies or whatever we determine some of Joe's students might need. (this picture is from a similar initiative in 2014)



Story behind the project:

I'm Miles Comiskey. I'm a high school music teacher and musician in Chicago. I took my first trip to Ghana in 2010 and am headed off on my fourth trip now, in 2016. What started as two weeks of studying Ghanaian music became a lifelong connection to this place and these people - all through music.

These musicians have given me so much in teaching me this music and sharing their culture with me. I feel lucky to know them and furthermore, to have the opportunity to help them fulfill a goal they've had for a long time. I have recorded 5 albums of my own and, last summer, an album of South African choral music. I'm excited to bring my creative energy to this project.

Why we need your help.

There's a lot of details that go into recording an album, and even more that go into doing it in Ghana. As a team, we found that it was all adding up to be too much to cover ourselves, so we're reaching out.

What you are helping to fund:

  • Rental of Zoom F8 MultiTrack Field Recorder
  • Rental of mic stands & mic cables
  • Rental of a recording space
  • Duplication of CDs or other physical media for Ghanaian distribution
  • School and after-school traditional music programs in Accra
What you are not helping to fund:
  • Any/all travel expenses
  • Rental of microphones - I'm bringing those
  • Mixing & Mastering

Goals:

  • Fulfill these musicians' dream to record and be able to share their music
  • Support traditional music throughout Ghana and West Africa
  • Share this music abroad - in the US and elsewhere
  • Support these musicians and the teaching that they do as part of their efforts to keep this music, and the wisdom that comes with it, alive.

Why should you care?

  • Music is amazing and connects us all in beautiful ways :)
  • Ghana has one of the world's richest folk music traditions. These musicians are helping to pass that on to the next generation throughout their lives.
  • This album will help these musicians continue that work in schools and allow them to share this music even more widely.
  • This music, despite it still being a living breathing tradition in Ghana, is starting to fade. Radio stations and smartphones are saturated with Western-style pop music that is turning traditional music into rural music and grandparents' music. It needs to be preserved and fought for.
  • Because this is still truly folk music, it brings further meaning to the fact that we are capturing these particular pieces as played by this particular group of people, at a particular time, making this project, in some ways, a valuable archive of this music in a historical sense.

Please pass this on to anyone who might also be interested in this music!
story_txt:
UPDATE: Stretch Goals!
Because this campaign took off in the first 24 hours, we're going to add some stretch goals to try to keep the giving going. While this money will adequately fund the recording itself, we can support these musicians and their teaching with a little bit more. Priorities for additional funding are:

Expanding our recording project to include other solo musicians' projects, like Moses Nante Ayambile:


We're also hoping to record Papagina performing solo on Kora:




Ideas moving beyond the recording project:

Buying/repairing drums, buying performance outfits/sticks/other equipment for Ehia Cultural Troupe - Joe's after-school drumming & dancing group


Providing some school supplies or whatever we determine some of Joe's students might need. (this picture is from a similar initiative in 2014)

story:
We realize that there is a lot of competition for the IndieGoGo dollar, especially with musically-based projects.  Artists who pour everything they have into their music are fortunate enough to have a platform where an ever-growing community gives them more than just money to fund their projects, but a chance to have all of their hard work and dedication showcased to the world.

2016 has been a crazy year for Mocklove.  We have played shows all across Missouri and Illinois, released a brand new single, made new friends across an ever-growing scene, and solidified a creative direction to which we have taken to grow as musicians.  The Mocklove sound has changed since our first effort, There Is No Place, and we would love the opportunity to share this sound with you.

We are launching this campaign to fund a five-song EP titled It’s a Sacred Privilege to Walk Someone Home.  The title is in reference to a comment left on a blog post by the musician Amanda Palmer.  The post was in relation to a dear family friend, who had been battling a terminal illness for quite some time, lying on his makeshift deathbed in his living room.  Amanda and others stayed by their friend’s side until he passed, hence ‘walking him home.’  Our music resonates with this title well, as we recognize the inevitability of death and a subsequent celebration of a life we often take for granted.

The EP will be recorded at Encapsulated Studios in St. Louis, Missouri under the guise of producer Matt Amelung (Story of the Year, Greek Fire, Kodiak).  Matt is an incredible, collaborative producer who guided us through tracking our single ‘Mnemophobia.’  We are really excited to potentially have the opportunity to be working with him on this project.

The artwork for this effort was created by Hali Oberdiek, an artist based out of Mid-Missouri.  Her work deals with complicated issues of secrecy and crypticism in relationships and life.  These motivations create powerful imagery that align well with this project.

Please know that all of the funds we raise will be SOLELY FOR RELEASING THE EP!  Any additional funds that we raise will be utilized for promotional materials and potentially more recorded material.

Thank you so much for supporting our efforts.  We cannot accomplish this without your help, and we are forever grateful for any contribution you can give.  With any luck, you’ll be hearing from us soon.

     - MKLV

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Behind the Sun - Brewed in Scotland, bottled in Germany!

 

I am really happy and excited to be able to announce the release of my debut album ‘Behind the Sun‘ First off though,  I'm launching this crowdfunding campaign to help raise the funds needed to get the album out.

Recorded in a studio in the sleepy little village of Steinbach in Northern Bavaria, the village is affectionately known  in the local vernacular as 'Hinner de Sunn' which lends itself to the title of the album.

So why Crowdfunding? Well, It takes a lot of time, effort and money to make professional sounding, well-arranged recordings. Studio time, engineering fees, production costs, all of this costs money. The bottom line is that without a certain amount of pre-sales via a campaign such as this, I would not be in a position financially to meet the cost of production and release of this album.

By offering the chance to be a vital part of this process, you will receive a copy of the album before the official release-date, on CD and download. You will be part of a community-based project borne from hard work, devotion and a genuine love of music. Perhaps, more importantly, you will know that you helped make it all possible! With your help I will be able to bring this project to it’s rightful conclusion and get the songs released.

There are a number of ways you can get involved and also a number of unique and exciting perks & rewards that I hope will encourage support for the campaign. From CD’s, artwork and other merchandise, to house concert’s, music workshops, guitar lessons and singing sessions.

This Campaign will run for a total of 40 days ending on the 19/11/2017!!!

For those of you who are uncomfortable sharing their Credit Card details over the Internet, there is also the option of sending Campaign contributions direct via Paypal:
https://www.paypal.me/chrispookah

              

Behind the Sun – Gebraut in Schottland, abgefüllt in Deutschland!

Ich freue mich unwahrscheinlich, dass mein Debut-Album „Behind the Sun“ endlich veröffentlicht werden kann. Um den letzten Schritt dieser langen Reise realisieren zu können, habe ich dieses crowdfunding-Projekt ins Leben gerufen.

Das Album wurde in einem Studio in dem verschlafenen, kleinen Dorf Steinbach in Unterfranken aufgenommen. Bei den Einheimischen ist Steinbach auch unter dem Namen „Hinner de Sunn“, also „Hinter der Sonne“ bekannt, ein Spitzname, der schließlich namensgebend für mein Album war.

Nun also die Frage: Warum crowdfunding? Nun ja, ein Album kostet eine Menge Zeit, Arbeit und Geld. Gerade um einen professionellen Sound, stimmige Aufnahmen, Studiozeit und Produktionskosten abzudecken, muss man einiges an Geld in die Hand nehmen. Daraus resultiert, dass ich, ohne den Vorverkauf mittels einer Kampagne wie dieser, nicht in der Lage wäre, die Kosten für die Produktion und Veröffentlichung dieses Albums zu stemmen.

Wenn du dich als Teil dieser Kampagne einbringst, wirst du das Album noch vor der offiziellen Veröffentlichung als Download und als „echte“ CD erhalten. Somit wirst du Teil eines Projektes sein, das aus richtig harter Arbeit, Hingabe und ehrlicher Liebe zur Musik entstanden ist. Vielleicht ist es sogar noch schöner, wenn du weißt, dass dies alles nur mit deiner Hilfe möglich geworden ist. Dank dir werde ich es schaffen, dieses Projekt zu Ende zu führen und die Songs zu veröffentlichen.

Es gibt einige Möglichkeiten, um dich in das Projekt einzubringen und auch so einige wunderbare Prämien, die du bekommen kannst und die dich hoffentlich noch mehr an meinem Projekt teilhaben lassen wollen. Da gibt es CD’s, Zeichnungen, prall gefüllte Goodie Bags und natürlich auch Hauskonzerte, Musik-Workshops, Gitarren- und Gesangsunterricht.

Diese Kampagne wird insgesamt 40 Tage dauern und endet am 19/11/2017!!!


 

The songs and the Musicians

The songs are all original material. Written & composed by myself so as such they are very close to my heart. To have the chance to make these recordings with both gifted musicians and down-to-earth people, is something really special. All musicians on the album, bar one, came from the local area in and around Aschaffenburg and every one helped bring to life the stories, tales and emotions that lay behind each song.

This collection of material consists of fourteen songs, recorded with fourteen different musicians, over a period of fourteen weeks...... give or take a day's recording here and there!

Each musician had a part to play in this, each one put a little bit of their heart and soul into the recordings and each of them helped to make this something really special. I would love to see these songs shared with as wide an audience of listeners as possible and so have started this crowdfunding project to help make that happen.

 

Die Songs und die Musiker

Auf dem Album findest du nur ehrliche und echte Songs, die ich alle selbst geschrieben und komponiert habe. Dass ich dann die Möglichkeit hatte, meine Songs, die eine Herzensangelegenheit darstellen, mit sowohl unglaublich talentierten aber dennoch vollkommen geerdeten Musikerinnen und Musikern aufnehmen durfte, macht es umso besonders. Alle von ihnen, bis auf einen, kommen aus der Region um und in Aschaffenburg und jeder einzelne von ihnen hat eigene Geschichten, Gedanken und Gefühle mit in jeden Song gebracht.

So besteht diese Sammlung nun aus vierzehn Liedern, die mit vierzehn verschiedenen Musikerinnen und Musikern in vierzehn Wochen aufgenommen wurden. Plus minus ein oder zwei Tage, wer will hier schon so genau sein.

Jeder und jede einzelne der Musikerinnen und Musiker hat seinen oder ihren ganz eigenen Beitrag zu diesem Album beigesteuert und somit jedes Mal ein Stück Herz und Seele in dieses Album gesteckt. Damit wurde es zu etwas Einzigartigem und ganz Besonderem. Gerade deswegen liegt es mir besonders am Herzen, diese Songs mit möglichst vielen anderen Menschen, denen ehrliche Musik etwas bedeutet, zu teilen. Deshalb habe ich dieses Projekt gestartet, nämlich damit du und noch viele andere diese Musik hören können.

 

 

Recording Process

All tracks on the album were recorded and produced by Michael Hauck from Loch Less Studio in Steinbach. A sleepy wee village just outside the town of Aschaffenburg.  These are real quality, professional recordings. Beautifully arranged and mixed to a very high standard. I am sure everyone who listens would agree, even if it's not your cup of tea.

The Album has been recorded and is now in the final mixing & mastering phase, which I plan to have complete by Autumn 2017. This will coincide with the end-phase of the crowdfunding campaign when the CD production will begin.

To date, recording these songs with so many great musicians brought some of the proudest and satisfying moments into my life. It was a lot of effort and hard work at times, but it has also been a most enjoyable and enlightening journey which I will never forget.

 

Die Aufnahme

Produziert und aufgenommen wurden alle Songs des Albums von Michael Hauck im Loch Less Studio in Steinbach, dem verschlafenen Dorf gerade hinter Aschaffenburg. Dank Michel zeugen die Aufnahmen von besonderer Qualität und Professionalität. Er hat es geschafft, alle Songs außergewöhnlich gut zu arrangieren und abzumischen und ich glaube, dass jeder, der dieses Album anhören wird, mir hierzu vollste Zustimmung geben wird. Und das selbst wenn die Musik an sich nicht dein Ding sein sollte.

Nach der langen Aufnahmezeit, befindet sich das Album jetzt in der finalen „Mixing & Mastering“-Phase, das heißt, es bekommt seinen Feinschliff. Die komplette Fertigstellung geht somit mit dem Beginn des crowdfunding-Projekts einher. Von daher steht der CD-Produktion nichts mehr im Wege.

Ich kann die Zeit, als ich dieses Album mit all diesen großartigen Musikerinnen und Musikern aufgenommen habe, zu den stolzesten und zufriedensten Zeiten meines Lebens zählen. Natürlich war es auch jede Menge Arbeit und Anstrengung, aber das war es definitiv wert, denn dies war so eine bereichernde Erfahrung, die ich niemals vergessen werde und will.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need help to cover the costs of studio time, Engineering fees, mixing, mastering and tracking. The pressing and release of the Album on CD and Vinyl, press promotion and publication.

Most of this does not come cheap, just as everything has a price. But we want to do this properly and in the right way, I really believe and hope that with a little help from people like yourself, we can make it happen…

We would really love to hear from you, especially if you are in a position to help fund this project. We have put together a list of perks and rewards for your kindness and generosity. A range of tasty goodie bags are on offer if you are able to contribute to the fund and get involved!

Even if you’re not able to back us financially, you can still help share this campaign with your friends & family or anyone else you think would be interested. Like that random guy at the bus stop, or on the morning train. Anything you can do to help us would be really appreciated and we would all be grateful to you.

 

Was wir brauchen und was du bekommst

Ich brauche Unterstützung, um das Aufnahmestudio, das Abmischen und Mastern, zu finanzieren. Natürlich muss das Album dann auch noch auf CD und Vinyl gepresst werden, zusätzlich fallen Kosten für Produktion und Werbung an. Das alles kostet Geld und gar nicht wenig, aber mir ist es wichtig, es richtig zu machen und in ordentliche Qualität zu investieren. Dabei bin ich mir ganz sicher, dass ich das gemeinsam mit der Hilfe von Menschen wie dir schaffen kann.

Ich würde mich wirklich riesig freuen, wenn du dabei sein würdest, in jeglicher Art. Natürlich ist hier eine finanzielle Unterstützung ganz besonders hilfreich. Als Dank dafür wirst du ganz wunderbare Dinge erhalten, die meine Dankbarkeit dafür ausdrücken, dass du ein Teil des Projektes bist!

Aber auch wenn du gerade nicht die Möglichkeit hast, mich finanziell zu unterstützen, kannst du trotzdem helfen, indem du meine Kampagne mit deiner Familie und deinen Freunden teilst und allen davon erzählst, von denen du glaubst, dass es sie interessieren könnte. So könnte es vielleicht deine allmorgendliche Begegnung mit dem Typ an der Bushaltestelle sein, oder die Dame am Kiosk, an dem du deinen Kaffee holst, mit denen du sonst kaum ein Wort wechselst. Vielleicht ist eine dieser Personen ja auch ein großer Musikliebhaber. Ganz egal wie, ich freue mich über jedwede Unterstützung.

 

 

The Impact

The main goal is to reach £5000. Every penny that is raised will go to paying and funding the project. Of course to reach this goal and even go beyond it would be absolutely fantastic. This would give further scope to make sure the outcome is a success. Every penny counts and every single one will go to where it is needed the most.

Each person who contributes to this project, will be kept up-to-date and informed of all progress made. Through Social media, mail shots and as a part of an online marketing campaign you will updated on what is happening and when it is happening.

 

Und dann?

Das Ziel ist es, 5000£ zu erreichen. Jeder einzelne Cent wird nur dazu genutzt werden, das Projekt zu finanzieren. Dieses Ziel zu erreichen, oder sogar noch mehr, wäre absolut unglaublich. Das würde mir auch noch mehr Spielraum geben und umso sicherer wäre ein erfolgreicher Verlauf. Jeder Cent zählt und wird dort genutzt werden, wo er am meisten gebraucht wird.

Jeder einzelne von euch, der Teil des Projektes wird, wird regelmäßig über die sozialen Medien oder Email-Newsletter über den Verlauf der Kampagne informiert werden, sodass du immer genau weißt, was wann passiert.

Dass ich dann die Möglichkeit hatte, meine Songs, die eine Herzensangelegenheit darstellen, mit sowohl unglaublich talentierten aber dennoch vollkommen geerdeten Musikerinnen und Musikern aufnehmen durfte, macht es umso besonders. So besteht diese Sammlung nun aus vierzehn Liedern, die mit vierzehn verschiedenen Musikerinnen und Musikern in vierzehn Wochen aufgenommen wurden. Plus minus ein oder zwei Tage, wer will hier schon so genau sein.
Jeder und jede einzelne der Musikerinnen und Musiker hat seinen oder ihren ganz eigenen Beitrag zu diesem Album beigesteuert und somit jedes Mal ein Stück Herz und Seele in dieses Album gesteckt. Damit wurde es zu etwas Einzigartigem und ganz Besonderem. Gerade deswegen liegt es mir besonders am Herzen, diese Songs mit möglichst vielen anderen Menschen, denen ehrliche Musik etwas bedeutet, zu teilen. Deshalb habe ich dieses Projekt gestartet, nämlich damit du und noch viele andere diese Musik hören können.
 

 
Recording Process
All tracks on the album were recorded and produced by Michael Hauck from Loch Less Studio in Steinbach. A sleepy wee village just outside the town of Aschaffenburg.  These are real quality, professional recordings. Beautifully arranged and mixed to a very high standard. I am sure everyone who listens would agree, even if it's not your cup of tea.
The Album has been recorded and is now in the final mixing & mastering phase, which I plan to have complete by Autumn 2017. This will coincide with the end-phase of the crowdfunding campaign when the CD production will begin.
To date, recording these songs with so many great musicians brought some of the proudest and satisfying moments into my life. It was a lot of effort and hard work at times, but it has also been a most enjoyable and enlightening journey which I will never forget.
 
Die Aufnahme
Produziert und aufgenommen wurden alle Songs des Albums von Michael Hauck im Loch Less Studio in Steinbach, dem verschlafenen Dorf gerade hinter Aschaffenburg. Dank Michel zeugen die Aufnahmen von besonderer Qualität und Professionalität. Er hat es geschafft, alle Songs außergewöhnlich gut zu arrangieren und abzumischen und ich glaube, dass jeder, der dieses Album anhören wird, mir hierzu vollste Zustimmung geben wird. Und das selbst wenn die Musik an sich nicht dein Ding sein sollte.
Nach der langen Aufnahmezeit, befindet sich das Album jetzt in der finalen „Mixing & Mastering“-Phase, das heißt, es bekommt seinen Feinschliff. Die komplette Fertigstellung geht somit mit dem Beginn des crowdfunding-Projekts einher. Von daher steht der CD-Produktion nichts mehr im Wege.
Ich kann die Zeit, als ich dieses Album mit all diesen großartigen Musikerinnen und Musikern aufgenommen habe, zu den stolzesten und zufriedensten Zeiten meines Lebens zählen. Natürlich war es auch jede Menge Arbeit und Anstrengung, aber das war es definitiv wert, denn dies war so eine bereichernde Erfahrung, die ich niemals vergessen werde und will.
 



 
What We Need & What You Get
I need help to cover the costs of studio time, Engineering fees, mixing, mastering and tracking. The pressing and release of the Album on CD and Vinyl, press promotion and publication.
Most of this does not come cheap, just as everything has a price. But we want to do this properly and in the right way, I really believe and hope that with a little help from people like yourself, we can make it happen…
We would really love to hear from you, especially if you are in a position to help fund this project. We have put together a list of perks and rewards for your kindness and generosity. A range of tasty goodie bags are on offer if you are able to contribute to the fund and get involved!
Even if you’re not able to back us financially, you can still help share this campaign with your friends & family or anyone else you think would be interested. Like that random guy at the bus stop, or on the morning train. Anything you can do to help us would be really appreciated and we would all be grateful to you.
 
Was wir brauchen und was du bekommst
Ich brauche Unterstützung, um das Aufnahmestudio, das Abmischen und Mastern, zu finanzieren. Natürlich muss das Album dann auch noch auf CD und Vinyl gepresst werden, zusätzlich fallen Kosten für Produktion und Werbung an. Das alles kostet Geld und gar nicht wenig, aber mir ist es wichtig, es richtig zu machen und in ordentliche Qualität zu investieren. Dabei bin ich mir ganz sicher, dass ich das gemeinsam mit der Hilfe von Menschen wie dir schaffen kann.
Ich würde mich wirklich riesig freuen, wenn du dabei sein würdest, in jeglicher Art. Natürlich ist hier eine finanzielle Unterstützung ganz besonders hilfreich. Als Dank dafür wirst du ganz wunderbare Dinge erhalten, die meine Dankbarkeit dafür ausdrücken, dass du ein Teil des Projektes bist!
Aber auch wenn du gerade nicht die Möglichkeit hast, mich finanziell zu unterstützen, kannst du trotzdem helfen, indem du meine Kampagne mit deiner Familie und deinen Freunden teilst und allen davon erzählst, von denen du glaubst, dass es sie interessieren könnte. So könnte es vielleicht deine allmorgendliche Begegnung mit dem Typ an der Bushaltestelle sein, oder die Dame am Kiosk, an dem du deinen Kaffee holst, mit denen du sonst kaum ein Wort wechselst. Vielleicht ist eine dieser Personen ja auch ein großer Musikliebhaber. Ganz egal wie, ich freue mich über jedwede Unterstützung.


 

 
The Impact
The main goal is to reach £5000. Every penny that is raised will go to paying and funding the project. Of course to reach this goal and even go beyond it would be absolutely fantastic. This would give further scope to make sure the outcome is a success. Every penny counts and every single one will go to where it is needed the most.
Each person who contributes to this project, will be kept up-to-date and informed of all progress made. Through Social media, mail shots and as a part of an online marketing campaign you will updated on what is happening and when it is happening.
 
Und dann?
Das Ziel ist es, 5000£ zu erreichen. Jeder einzelne Cent wird nur dazu genutzt werden, das Projekt zu finanzieren. Dieses Ziel zu erreichen, oder sogar noch mehr, wäre absolut unglaublich. Das würde mir auch noch mehr Spielraum geben und umso sicherer wäre ein erfolgreicher Verlauf. Jeder Cent zählt und wird dort genutzt werden, wo er am meisten gebraucht wird.
Jeder einzelne von euch, der Teil des Projektes wird, wird regelmäßig über die sozialen Medien oder Email-Newsletter über den Verlauf der Kampagne informiert werden, sodass du immer genau weißt, was wann passiert.

story:
Stretch goal (Professional Launch):

We have raised enough money to cover the studio and our star musician, plus rentals and travel. Now help us to give a little something to each of the musicians (4 total and not including me) and get professional mastering by our old friend Andy Vandette (Sevendust, Beastie Boys, David Bowie, Procupine Tree.) $450 Mastering, artwork, packaging, and digital distribution to iTunes, Amazon, Spotify and other digital streaming services. Can we reach $2000?

Goal Reached!

You made it happen - we reached our target in 72 hours. The project is moving ahead this weekend! Se update 3 for the amazing lineup this has made possible!

Keram Songs

Keram is not only a musician and lyricist, but a producer who has a keen eye and ear for remarkable talents that have rare and unusual qualities. He never plays it safe but rather seeks to turn unexpected corners and evoke unnamed sensations and emotions. His productions are densely layered and full of secrets. While he has released many demos, his professionally recorded  and mastered catalog is very lean for a three-decade career and every new collaboration reveals a new facet to this spectrum of ideas and talent pool. This campaign seeks to capitalize on a brief window of time where Keram may be able to record with two of his most potent musical partners. With your support, this campaign will make that possible.

  • Since the release of Come to Life in 2014 - the 7-year journey that led to  a ten song 76 minute album featuring 32 musicians including Ryan Brown (drummer for Dweezil Zappa) and guitarists Marc Thomas, Pete Devlin (Blue Dog Pict), Alex Budman (D'Angelo) and Alex Lifeson  (RUSH), singer, composer and producer Keram has released only one single "(Don't Get Caught) By The Dazzling Charades" whose creation he streamed from inception to competed mix live on Periscope over the internet, sharing with his supporters every painstaking moment of the process, unedited.
  • After an almost two year sabbatical from music to create VRTO and FIVARS - two of the world's prominent Virtual Reality events, Keram now has a rare opportunity to reunite with his collaborators Ryan Brown, fresh off a tour with Dweezil Zappa and master guitarist Marc Thomas in Los Angeles in a two week window, to track two new songs that reflect Keram's current musical ideas. This unique trio will be assisted in the studio by a group of stellar musicians and engineers (suprises to follow) to produce two professionally recorded and produced works for release.
  • It is only through the financial support of people like you that such new works are made possible and add the eternal catalog of songs left behind. For only a few dollrs we can meet the target goal and make this happen.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We only have until May 19th to get into the studio!

  • $275 Studio Time. $700 musicians honorarium, travel, rentals. $100 magnetic tape.
  • This is the ground level total needed to make it possible in such short time. Our stretch goals will add more time to track and mix and bring in additional 3rd party live talent from Los Angeles.
  • Funds are needed to rent a professional tape and digital recording studio filled with vintage gear and unique instruments and mixing console to create a rich, textured sound that will lend itself to many repeat listens and authentic human vibe.
  • Your name will be included on a this website as contributor and on any music videos that emerge from the creation of these songs.
  • If the target goal isn't met, one less song will be recorded and mastered. If less than that is acheived, only drum tracks will be captured while the opportunity it there.

The Impact

Keram has never pulled punches in his thematic ideas, but also find a lyrical style that uses turns of phrase to create multilevel meaning and metaphor that can and should be unpacked over multiple listens and consideration. This is a dangerous and volatile time in history but also one that exudes innovation and transcendance. This is a moment for artists to express powerful ideas to inspire, questions, challenge and soothe, to invoke imagination, spirit, and dreams.

Risks & Challenges

Keram finishes what he sets out to do. Having founded and run the Constant Change Music label since 1991 he has produced and licensed songs to EPCOT Centre, SONY, Disney, Hallmark, CBC, PixL, MGM, New Line and many more. His scores have appeared on television dramas and experimental short films alike. His stage shows are unpredicatable, and passionate and have earned critical acclaim.  However the music industry has changed and the traditional support structures and outlets to be heard are highly fractured and diverse. Though this is positive in many ways, it also makes financing new works daunting at best. Thus we believe in the structure of patronage to support new works. If we do not raise the funding to pay for studios, then we miss the opportunty to capture the lightining in a bottle of lifetime-musicians disocovering and capturing incredible moment together.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you really are not able to spare some change or a few dollars but still really want to make this happen you can help out by sharing this capmaign with your friends on social media and email, We recommend a few personal words from you about why you feel supporting the capture of such new works meaningful to you and to the society.

And that's all there is to it! Let's make this happen, and thank you always for your loving and incredible suppoort and encouragement to produce art and ideas and release them into the cosmos.

story:
Hello Friends,

My name is Dakota Hall Scott. For several years now I have been, accidentally, and only recently known to me, writing songs that have encapsulated what it was like for me to grow up in Bakersfield, CA. Of course, the themes found in these songs move to deeper places than simply where I grew up. They are about how home shapes you and deforms you and blesses you and curses you and does many other things to you, seen and unseen.  Though these songs are deeply personal to me, I believe that they may resonate with anyone who may listen.

After some relative success with my first full length album (My Body Longed For The Summer) I want to build off what I learned during the making of that album. With your help, I want to put what is in my mind and my fingers and soul into the world for all to hear. 

As far as where these funds will go; It has been a long dream of mine to have a vinyl record.  A bulk of the funds will go to achieving that end. With your help I will also be getting CD’s and Tapes made, something for everyone. Recording costs will also be covered if the goal is met. As well as paying the musicians that will help me make this dream reality. 

Thank you all for coming to this page and reading my ramblings and even considering donating to my cause. 

-Dakota Hall Scott

story:
The Album

This project brings to fruition a period of exploration of a new musical direction for me. It means a lot to me and my close friends and family, who have heard these songs over and over. The fact that they haven't thrown out my guitar or kicked me out of the house is a good sign! Contributing to my campaign will help make the album a reality, and by doing so hopefully touch listeners by the music. You already know music can impact people in ways few other art forms can, and my hope is these songs will dig deep into people's emotions. They convey stories that are real, sometimes too real. This music to me is at the same time inspiring, frustrating, and joyful.

Who I am

I've been a musician my whole life - since I could make sounds I was probably singing and banging on stuff. I've always been a drummer, playing music from around the world (Korea Cuba, Peru, and the US of course). But I never really considered myself a songwriter until a few years ago, when I began writing music for my kids. Then I discovered something I never really knew I had in me: writing and playing music that was really simple that could communicate to listeners aspects of regular life. I found that giving people a reflection of the world they live in can be powerful. It transforms the way I look at the world around me, and can do the same for listeners.

What I Need to Finish

I'm hoping to raise $1,200 to pay for finishing up the album. It is fully recorded, and almost entirely mixed. I'm entering the final mastering stage, which is the stage in the recording process that cleans up the sound making it really pop. Most funds will go to finishing up the mixing process and mastering the full album. Some of the funds will go to publishing the music digitally.

 

If you can't contribute financially...

Hey that's totally fine! If you are into the project and like the music you hear, you will have the opportunity to listen to the final product on various digital platforms, including Spotify, Pandora, Bandcamp, iTunes, etc. And you can share this campaign with friends that you think would be interested.

story:
BEFORE YOU START READING...

I promise that if I get all the funds I will let my hair grow until January 1st 2015 and let the contributors pick one of the 3 hairstyles shown in the gallery section for it to be my brand new awesometastic look! how does that sound? :D 
I will do a funny video of my hair cut and thanking my funders as well!
To promote this we'll use the hashtag #coolcutmusic
ALSO...ALL SHIPMENTS ARE INCLUDED IN THE PERKS 
My shortened story...

I'm Santiago Kodela and I started studying music a long ago, I used to work in an office from 9-18 but decided to quit and go after my musical dreams.

This campaign is to produce (record, release, track, master; etc) my first 4-track EP called "Wanderlust" as a solo artist with 100% own personal compositions.

By contributing to the cause you are helping me achieve a big dream by recording and sharing my music to the world, and ultimately making me happy =D

I want to clarify that this isn't about me and my ego, I want to put my music out there for people to listen to it and share it, to take them to different mind-places and through-out different emotions.  I've always liked the idea that when shared, life is better.

What I look for & your rewards

The whole funding (5500EUR) will be used as following:

  • Personal enrichment (ABSOLUTE AND GIGANTIC BIG ROUND 0%)
  • TRACKING, MIXING, EDITING, MASTERING, etc. (50%)
  • PERKS & FUNDING FEES (25%)
  • DUPLICATION & PRINTING (15%)
  • ARTWORK (10%)
  • About the perks: I always love giving more in return than what I receive so I invite you to check the perks and tell me your opinion.  I'll try to design them to make them attractive and to make sure that your contribution is well rewarded.  I want you to feel that your contribution is well placed and in trustworthy hands.
  • In case I don't meet the expected goal, all the funds will be used for the most important thing which is the recording, tracking, mixing and mastering; and I will eventually save the remaining money for the rest of the bullet-points.

The (your) Impact

I simply love sharing the music I like both listening and composing.  I believe this is a huge milestone for me as a musician, specially after taking the plunge and leaving everything behind for this cause.  This is so important for us (I include you) because:

  • I'll do my best to write and record my out-of-the-heart music.  I will try and contribute to release more real music (in a so artificial world) that hopefully will inspire more people (and hopefully you) to do so.
  • I want to inspire anybody out there to let go of the life society expects from them and actually go for the life THEY DREAM ABOUT.  I'm sure that if everybody would actually do what they want to do for living, the earth would be a better world to live in.

What if...

things happen? issues appear? unexpected situations arise? I don't get the funds?Well, that is an option I contemplate because nothing is certain in life, and if things don't turn out the way I planned I mean to stay positive and get the money one way or another.  I am determined person and know the way is upwards, but if you want something in life you must fight really hard for it, right?  Fortunately, from every experience we learn, and I think the biggest step (deciding to leave things behind for my dreams) has already been taken.

My plan for facing any possible challenge is to stay positive, open-minded to the unexpected and determined to release this baby into the world.

Non-monetary help!

I totally understand that contributing to a random internet cause may seem strange or risky, so in case you are short of money and still want to contribute or help, then I encourage you to share my story to your people:

  • Tweet about it;
  • Like and share on FB;
  • Email link to your fellow friends and family;
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

and any other thing you might think it would help! just feel as if this was your campaign and what would you do to promote it!

Tweet about it;
Like and share on FB;
Email link to your fellow friends and family; use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 and any other thing you might think it would help! just feel as if this was your campaign and what would you do to promote it!

story:
Background Info - 2013 US Air Guitar Finals

Last year Sweetness (Kyle Privette) was kind and talented enough to do a professional photo shoot of the National Finalists and additional air guitarists who had backstage access. What was even more amazing, was that he did it for FREE!

By now, many of you have seen his incredible work either on Facebook, the USAG website or in event posters - including this year's Finals artwork. He wants to do this again, but he needs a little help footing the bill to Kansas City for the weekend.

What he needs to make this happen

Plane tickets from Sacramento are expensive, and so is flying with all of his camera equipment. To help offset this cost and to pay him for his amazing work, we are offering up a series of Perks to help pay his way and help get you the most amazing air guitar photo of your career. This is a flex-fund account and we are looking to get him at least $200 for his work. 

How can I help? How do I get a photo?

If you'd like to help the cause and get a portrait, please select one of the following perks when you donate. Also, please be sure to use your Air Guitar Name when posting your donation. This is done at the end of the donation process. That way we know what Perk you selected!

  • Portrait Session 1 - $10
    This gets you a 3 minute portrait session, a digital copy of a professionally edited photo, and an 8x10 printed portrait*
  • Portrait Session 2 - $15
    This gets you everything from Portrait Session 1, plus digital copies of all of the raw photos taken during your session
  • Portrait Session 3 - $25
    This gets you everything from Portrait Session 2, plus a digital 2014 US Air Guitar Trading Card, designed by Lt. Facemelter**
*Sweetness will select the best photo from the session to edit for your official portrait. All editing and design decisions will be made solely by Sweetness. Your printed portrait will be mailed to you approximately one month after the Finals.
**The trading card will use your official portrait for the front. If a back is desired, Lt. Facemelter will work with you to get all information necessary for your attributes and bio.

I'm on a budget. Can I still get a photo taken for less than $10?

Here's the deal. If Sweetness can raise $200 or more, he will open up the photo session to ALL air guitarists. So if you can't swing $10, feel free to donate anything less to help contribute to the cause! If the $200 mark is hit, here's what happens:

  • Priority is given to those who paid for a photo session. Sweetness will have a list of who paid and will make sure they get their photos taken first.
  • If you did not pay for a photo session, you will be photographed on a first come-first serve basis. You will get a 2 minute session and you will receive a single raw digital photo, selected by Sweetness. Even without the professional design edits, it will still look pretty damn awesome!


Can I donate without getting a Perk?

Absolutely! If you'd like to donate a few dollars just to help the cause, please do so! You are also more than welcome to donate extra money on top of the Perk you've already selected.

When will the Photo Session Take Place?

The Photo Session will be held at the Midland Theatre on Saturday, August 9th prior to the USAG National Finals Competition.  The exact time is TBD, but it will most likely take place at competitor check-in time at the venue and will run for an additional 30 minutes after doors open.

We will work out a system to make sure you are able to get your picture taken at a reasonable time, and notify you in advance via email of the confirmed time frame. Please arrive to your photo session "camera ready" to help expedite the process.

story:
Mets ain't good, but I can help with that. 

See that man up there? That's Frank Wilpan, owner of the New York Mets, and he hates you. 

I mean, the fella must. Otherwise, he wouldn't be making the Mets lose so much. I don't know about you, but I think it's time that the we got some new ownership in there. Someone who was hardened and real and a freaking dude. Someone like me. 

My name is Carlton Krinkle, and I want to buy the New York Mets. 

You're probably thinking, "Who is this guy?" Well, all right, then. I'm just a dude like any other dude, only more so. I served in the military in 'Nam and then triumphed over a drinking habit and a nasty divorce. Point is I know what it's like to stare darkness in the face in the bleakest of times and come out on top. 

That's the sort of rugged lumberjacking mountain-climbing can-do-ness that I'd like to pass onto the New York Mets. The Wilpans ain't getting it done. How many losing seasons has it been now? I honestly don't feel like looking it up right, but it's been a a whole bunch. It's time to pass the baton onto a regular ol' dude who is gonna make the hard choices and put a winning ball club on the field. 

What I Need & What You Get

Most people would ask for millions of dollars or probably billions, but at least 90 percent of that would go to lawyers. Ever since my ex-wife took my house in our divorce, I would never hire a lawyer again. So that really cuts down overhead. 

What I need is simple: $5,000 and two chairs: this Wilpon fella in one of them and me in the other one. 

I have a little inside information. I heard that the Wilpons are poor from the Barney Maroff pyramid scam, so the $5,000 combined with my fierce negotiating tactics, I'm pretty sure I can get a deal done to taking controlling interest of the Mets. 

I promise that however much money we raise here, I will make a formal, written offer to the Wilpans to buy the team, and I will keep all of you in the loop on my messages, phone calls, and responses with the Mets. 

If I'm successful, you'd also get a damn good Mets team. I'm a people-person and and am sure I can deliver a team full of dudes who do nothing but throw and pole axe baseballs. I'd also like to add that you'd get a say in how the team is run and get some of the credit, but honestly I'm just doing this purely for personal gain.

    The Impact

    The Mets haven't won the World Series since 1986. Most of you kids weren't even alive! The impact of my ownership is that you'd get to see the Mets win the World Series a whole lot. I know how to spot talent, and I have a way with people where they work hard and hustle for me. 
    Day 1 on the job, I cut loose all the lawyers. We do things on a handshake agreement from now, so people can relax and just do a good job. I'd also promote catching thundermonster Kevin Platwecki to the majors because that guy is a dude. I have some other ideas, but those are the main ones for now. 

    Risks & Challenges

    I hate considering failure because that's what quitters do, but yeah, I guess that this could bomb and I can't buy the Mets. You'd be risking that they turn me down and I spent your money on whiskey. I'd like to think it takes a man to admit this, so hopefully you'll read this and be like, "Damn, this dude's a straight shooter that I can respect."

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Pretty much you can just send me some money or tell your neighbors or wealthy friends about this.

story:
Let's cut to the chase.
We need more dreamers and artists - and in today's music industry, that couldn't be more true. I'm here because I want to show the world the music that's going on in my head - but I need YOUR help to get my voice heard above the thousands. 

So, what's the plan?
Simple. I need to raise $5,000 so I can pay for a professionally produced EP. The money itself will be divided between recording session time, mixing, mastering, and hiring musicians to come and play on the tracks. $5,000 will cover 3 songs. Once the EP is finished, I plan to distribute the finished product on various platforms including Spotify, iTunes, Amazon, etc. This EP will also help garner more attention to my work and therefore open more opportunities for my music and career.

If you would like to hear what my style sounds like, check out my first single here > > > Lorelei (Kirra Vevina Demo) 

You can also hear "Lorelei" on Spotify! 

The Impact
Being able to do my music is not only a dream come true,  but it's therapeutic for me. It's just another way that I express myself - and I come alive when I do it. However, at the end of the day I really want nothing more than for people to enjoy what they hear and be inspired or comforted. Music connects us - that's really what it is all about. 

You have a voice too!
I know some people just can't contribute - and that's okay. Just letting people know who I am and what I am doing is just as helpful. Spread the word! Listen to my Soundcloud, follow my blog - and  share what you find interesting or inspiring.  


Kirra Vevina on Soundcloud
Website and Blog

story:
• "...thought-provoking, fun, and original in a seamless and simultaneous fashion...the group has a voice and a swagger that introduces a fresh international element to the (hip-hop) game" - Interview Magazine
  • "If you toned down Kanye West's ego and turned up his sonic experimentation and then coupled that with some of Yasiin Bey's lyrical content, you’d arrive at something that sounds a lot like Old Money" - VICE

Peace!

We're Old Money - a New York based electronic/rap, production and DJ duo of Jamaican and Guyanese origins. After years of free single releases and videos, we released our debut mixtape/album Fire In The Dark in 2013, which received coverage by SPIN, The Wild, and several other great outlets.

Fire In The Dark featured a unique blend of influences, ranging from the music of M.I.A., Sun Ra and Jay Electronica to the writing of Octavia Butler and Dr. Ivan Van Sertima. We have a new 4 track release out, the Mothership EP, that serves as a pre-cursor to our next and last full length + limited edition vinyl single release, which this indiegogo project is for. 


We're excited to bring you this mixtape/album that will be filled with even more experimental, forward-thinking sounds (and a couple of cool collabs!), but we need your help. The money raised by this project will fund the mixing, mastering and marketing of this record. It will also fund production fees associated with making 1-2 music videos to accompany the record and the production of the vinyl single.

If we exceed the goal? IF ONLY! If we exceed the goal, we'd be able to:

  1. Do more on the marketing end, which simply put, means more people will hear it
  2. Acquire hardware that'll help us round out the project in the best possible way
  3. Enable us to add a run of limited run of CDs to the budget

Thank you for helping us make this come to fruition.

Much Love

OLDMONEY

twitter l soundcloud

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

As with any creative project, delays are a possibility. Independent or otherwise, this is still the record biz after all! While we don't anticipate delays in our case, know that if any do occur, it will be in the service of presenting the best possible product to the world. We will be sure to be in communication as the project progresses, and thanks once again for your support!

story:
My Background...

I'm Nicole Belanus, a singer-songwriter based out of northern Virginia.  I've recorded 3 solo albums and want to record my 4th before the end of 2014.  In order to make that happen, I really need your help.    

I'm hopeful this new project will help move my career in music forward by producing a more polished sound.  This new album will feature a new collaboration with Chris Rosser: musician, singer-songwriter and producer extraordinaire as well as several other talented musicians.  I've been working really hard on the songs and can't wait for you to hear them!  

My Music...

To get a feel for my music and what I do, you can visit my Youtube channel to watch some live video of my songs.  Also, feel free to stop by www.nicolebelanus.com to listen to more of my songs!

What the money will be used for...

The projected cost of the project is $5,000.  The money will be used to pay the musicians and the producer, get the songs professionally mastered, duplicate the CDs and print the CD wallets. 

You'll notice that there are several levels for contributing. By contributing just $20, you can help financially back the project and ensure that it gets done on time and pays the many talented people helping to make it happen! Please choose a level that you are comfortable with. All donation levels are appreciated.

Rest assured that your contribution will go right to the recording project.  If I exceed my goal I will use the money to either buy more copies of the disc or for various promotional items to support this new release.  But even if I don't reach the $5,000 goal I am committed to making this happen!

I realize that not everyone will be able to contribute dollars, but everyone can help. Please share this campaign with your friends and family via email or social media. 

Thank you in advance, you are my hero!

story:
Hey Everyone! Thank you so much for even taking the time to visit our campaign. We want to make this very simple for everyone: WE really want to create amazing sounding new music to share with you and YOU can easily help us make that happen.

What We Need & What You Get

THIS IS A TWO WAY STREET! 

We really appreciate any support that you can show and we want to make sure you don't walk away empty handed. Early access to the EP, physical copies of the EP and our first album Spirit In The Machine, bonus acoustic tracks, custom cover songs, a signed Ibanez electric guitar, and even a full-blown rock show at your house can all be yours with your support! Check out the perks on the right side of the page and see what kind of cool stuff you can pick up while this campaign is up and running. 

The Impact

We raise all of our money for the band through playing live shows all over the midwest, selling CDs and getting our music on TV (Check out the American Chopper promo featuring Modern Echo below). The last part is huge for our fund raising efforts. This type of opportunity helps us pay to keep our van up and running, for our trailer, our gear, our gas, and most importantly: OUR RECORDING!


The Studio

We have always worked with Skies Fall. They are some of the best in the business and we trust them completely with our sound and our vision. Check them out! http://www.skiesfall.com/

Take a listen to how great they made us sound on If I Die Tomorrow (Modern Echo)

Quality comes with a price and that's where you can help us out! Every little bit counts as we work towards an amazing finished product ready for your ears, TV, and beyond!

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that some of you have zero money to spare. No worries! There are other ways that you can help:

  • Please Like us on Facebook and Follow us on Twitter
  • PLEEEEASE share this page with your friends, family and anyone that loves rock music!

THANK YOU ALL SO VERY MUCH!!!
