story: Update : We spent a week in Nashville and finished up recording on the album.This will be Brandon Hogue's debut album as well as SeaCork Music's first album release. The album sounds fantastic and we are ready to have CDs duplicated.We scraped the funds together to pay for the recording sessions in Nashville and it turned out great ! We never expected to find a voice to match these original songs so perfectly ! this is where we need your help ! In order to get this music out there we need product to sell ! we've got people wanting to buy cds right now however we are underfunded to accomplish this just yet We never dreamed in a million years that this project could actually become a reality.This album has something for all ages on it to enjoy. Any donation that you csn make to help us when we are so close to seeing this dream come to fruition will be greatly appreciated . This is real music written from the heart and we cant wait for everyone to have a listen .. (7-26-14). Thanks for checking out our funding site. We are SeaCork Music, a small hometown outfit with years worth of writings and world class local talent. We created this small company to bring songs and singers together. Our goal is to share our music and give these new artists an opportunity to showcase their talent and potential and go straight to the studio and produce an album. At this time, we have three albums lined up............... Our first is with Brandon Hogue. Our second is with Caitlen Lee and our third is with Matt Cowart. The genre for Brandon and Caitlen is country. Matt is a gospel singer and his will be a gospel album. Songs selected for the first two albums have already been sent to our session leader in Nashville......they have meaningful lyrics and good music behind them.....his reply was "these songs are good, a few of them may even be great! That was nice to hear from a Nashville veteran!................This campaign will do much more than just help complete three albums. This is something these young artists will have for the rest of their lives and will create a platform for these unheard songs to be shared. No song is heard until it has been sung. Our goal is to continue to seek out great talent and let them be heard............   Mississippi has long been known for it's musical writers, influence and artists. We want to continue that tradition. With your help, we can do just that! .............What We Need & What You Get.........Costs for the production of these THREE albums are $23,700.  We work out of a home office and do not need to upgrade or purchase anything for the office. Songs have already been registered and are under copyright......... Each and every amount funded will be used strictly for the production of these albums..........We offer perks that range from CD's and downloads to Skype sessions and T-Shirts to autographed CD's and Lyrics, an invitation to the studio, to Co- Producer and Co- Executive Producer credits. Any amounts funded that do not reach our funding goal will by applied to Brandon's album, Caitlen's album and Matt's album....in that order....... Any funding that exceeds our goal will be put towards the next album or albums by talented singers with our songs or theirs. We promise to bring you only the best that we can find. The IMPACT........Long before your favorite artists became popular and took the world by storm, they probably dabbled in some songwriting and played to their friends and family. The talent was there but no one had heard of them or heard their songs........ Only with your help can we get these songs and artists shared to the world. We have been searching for the right voices for over two years and I will tell you, when we heard each of these singers open their mouths to sing, our jaws dropped. Talk about talent! We were amazed and are proud to be a part of their musical lives. Your funding will impact them for life and will be life changing for them......... We are not a big record label and don't want to be. We have signed contracts and have given our artists generous royalties. If they get the opportunity to go big with another label, we will be happy for them......that fits in to our goal of bringing new artists to light....... If they go big and want to stay with us, we will do the very best that we can for them. Either way, we want them to be successful. Risks and Challenges: The RISKS we face is not being able to share our total vision and having to put any of these young artists on hold by not reaching our funding goal. It is a huge undertaking to attempt to create what has been a work in progress for many years. We are at the final stages and are hopeful that there are enough people out there that support new music and new artists....... We are 100% confident in what we can produce. What we have to work with are good songs and very talented singers along with our drive and determination to get these three albums completed. We are working with some of the best musicians Nashville has to offer and we are positive we will be extremely proud of the final product and with your help, you can be proud too for being a part of it!...........There are more ways than contributing financially that you can help us reach our goal. Just SHARE our campaign with your friends and ask them to do the same. We are running this campaign for sixty days so there is time to share it more than once if you care to......... Help us get it to those that are able and would like to contribute and don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools......thank you so much for taking an interest!
story_txt: Update : We spent a week in Nashville and finished up recording on the album.This will be Brandon Hogue's debut album as well as SeaCork Music's first album release. The album sounds fantastic and we are ready to have CDs duplicated.We scraped the funds together to pay for the recording sessions in Nashville and it turned out great ! We never expected to find a voice to match these original songs so perfectly ! this is where we need your help ! In order to get this music out there we need product to sell ! we've got people wanting to buy cds right now however we are underfunded to accomplish this just yet We never dreamed in a million years that this project could actually become a reality.This album has something for all ages on it to enjoy. Any donation that you csn make to help us when we are so close to seeing this dream come to fruition will be greatly appreciated . This is real music written from the heart and we cant wait for everyone to have a listen .. (7-26-14). Thanks for checking out our funding site. We are SeaCork Music, a small hometown outfit with years worth of writings and world class local talent. We created this small company to bring songs and singers together. Our goal is to share our music and give these new artists an opportunity to showcase their talent and potential and go straight to the studio and produce an album. At this time, we have three albums lined up............... Our first is with Brandon Hogue. Our second is with Caitlen Lee and our third is with Matt Cowart. The genre for Brandon and Caitlen is country. Matt is a gospel singer and his will be a gospel album. Songs selected for the first two albums have already been sent to our session leader in Nashville......they have meaningful lyrics and good music behind them.....his reply was "these songs are good, a few of them may even be great! That was nice to hear from a Nashville veteran!................This campaign will do much more than just help complete three albums. This is something these young artists will have for the rest of their lives and will create a platform for these unheard songs to be shared. No song is heard until it has been sung. Our goal is to continue to seek out great talent  and let them be heard............   Mississippi has long been known for it's musical writers, influence and artists. We want to continue that tradition. With your help, we can do just that! .............What We Need & What You Get.........Costs for the production of these THREE albums are $23,700.  We work out of a home office and do not need to upgrade or purchase anything for the office. Songs have already been registered and are under copyright......... Each and every amount funded will be used strictly for the production of these albums..........We offer perks that range from CD's and downloads to Skype sessions and T-Shirts to autographed CD's and Lyrics, an invitation to the studio, to Co- Producer and Co- Executive Producer credits. Any amounts funded that do not reach our funding goal will by applied to Brandon's album, Caitlen's album and Matt's album....in that order....... Any funding that exceeds our goal will be put towards the next album or albums by talented singers with our songs or theirs. We promise to bring you only the best that we can find. The IMPACT........Long before your favorite artists became popular and took the world by storm, they probably dabbled in some songwriting and played to their friends and family. The talent was there but no one had heard of them or heard their songs........ Only with your help can we get these songs and artists shared to the world. We have been searching for the right voices for over two years and I will tell you, when we heard each of these singers open their mouths to sing, our jaws dropped. Talk about talent! We were amazed and are proud to be a part of their musical lives. Your funding will impact them for life and will be life changing for them......... We are not a big record label and don't want to be. We have signed contracts and have given our artists generous royalties. If they get the opportunity to go big with another label, we will be happy for them......that fits in to our goal of bringing new artists to light....... If they go big and want to stay with us, we will do the very best that we can for them. Either way, we want them to be successful. Risks and  Challenges: The RISKS we face is not being able to share our total vision and having to put any of these young artists on hold by not reaching our funding goal. It is a huge undertaking to attempt to create what has been a work in progress for many years. We are at the final stages and are hopeful that there are enough people out there that support new music and new artists....... We are 100% confident in what we can produce. What we have to work with are good songs and very talented singers along with our drive and determination to get these three albums completed. story:
About Us

They Will Fall is a 5-piece metalcore/hardcore band based out of West Monroe, Louisiana (US). Established in 2010, They Will Fall has served as a breath of fresh air for a scene so widely saturated with repetitive and dull sounds. Having released a debut full-length entitled "Disrupt the World" in 2012 (funded through Kickstarter), followed by the groundbreaking "Misconceptions EP" in September 2013, They Will Fall has been creating waves of excitement in waters that haven't been stirred in such a manner for a long time. Playing in front of acts such as Becoming the Archetype, Mouth of the South, Colossus, Silent Planet, Darkness Divided, Kublai Khan, Stand Your Ground, The Paramedic, and many more, West Monroe's They Will Fall possesses an impressive repertoire that matches with the best of today's hottest national touring acts.

Now, They Will Fall is preparing to record a ten-song album set to release in 2015 and needs YOUR help! Bound to surpass expectations, transcend ideals, and ultimately break ground in such a dry and overplayed genre.... 

This is the album you've been waiting for.

The Scoop

We'll be heading into the studio mid-November with Eric Woolard of Premier Productions in Jackson, MS, with whom we recorded 2012's Disrupt the World and 2013's Misconceptions EP. After recording, our album will be mixed and mastered by Josh Schroeder of Random Awesome! Recording Studio in Bay City, Michigan.
This is an expensive endeavor for They Will Fall: quality recording always is. While $7,000 is a steep goal to shoot for, we are being as realistic and as transparent as we can. Every last penny of the 7,000 dollars we hope to raise will go directly toward the completion of this album; if we are able to generate more, the extra money will absolutely help to make the album and the details surrounding the process much more enjoyable for our listeners and supporters! If we don't reach our goal, we will still use every penny to make this album the best it can be. Your investment will directly benefit the overall impact and long-lasting effect that this album will have.

    What's so special about this album?

    Four years ago, They Will Fall began as a small project consisting of immature teenagers who followed their passions. From small shows in our hometown to packed out shows hours away, from touring to two different releases in just two years, They Will Fall has grown both in skill and wisdom at a furious rate. And now, as we prepare to hit the studio to record this next full-length and our third release, we look back on a year filled with some of the most challenging times in our lives for us, both as individuals and as a band. 
    Writing this album consisted of the latest nights we have ever experienced, as ideas for new material would keep us wide awake. We have spent countless hours running back and forth between riffs and lyrics in order to solidify the perfect sound, a process that has left us exhausted and breathless. Material we thought was our best 6 months ago has been trashed and replaced. Struggling between self-worth and self-defeat and trusting in God through it all... While wish we could say that finishing this album was easy, we have learned that authoring and composing quality material is nothing but difficult.
    But now, as we have reached a point of completion, we are able to say that the reward of finishing what we have started COMPLETELY outweighs the costs and the sacrifices we have made to get here. Looking forward to recording and releasing this full-length is an understatement on our end: to us, it seems that everything before this album has just been a foundation for what we are about to display. We could not be more excited about this album, and we are thrilled that you can partner with us and be directly responsible for making it happen!

      Convictions

      Our band is driven by our faith as individuals in the saving and redemptive power of Jesus Christ. We believe in seeking objective truth and not stopping until you find it. We are convinced that the Gospel of Jesus Christ and the God of the Bible is truth, and trusting in and becoming more like Christ is our lifestyle and our endeavor, both as individuals in a band and as a mouthpiece for God through music.

story:
What's this all about?

Three and a half years in Nashville has lead me to this point.  Publishers, pitch meetings, co-writes, showcases and countless four hour sets on Broadway; all of it has lead to this project and this group of songs.  I have been very fortunate to play music in Nashville full-time for about three years now and I am confidant this project will allow me to step up to the next level.  I have literally written hundreds of songs over the past few years so you can imagine how difficult it was to narrow it down to 6 songs that I believe in enough to stake my future on.  But with the help of some publishers that I trust and a great producer we did it!  Now I'm excited to share them with YOU!

So, now is where YOU come in!  I need your help...I have everything in place but the funding.  I am trying to raise $6,000 to help offset the cost of the record.  This amount is in addition to a lot of money that I am already investing personally.  

We can do it!  Anything you can do will help...if all you can do is share this page on all your social media then that’s great!  Helping to spread the word is a HUGE contribution!  Please read on for more details and THANK YOU!!

What We Need the $ for

In addition to the money already invested what you give will go to :

  • Studio time including paying the players that will work on the record (they are the best in the world...in my Nashville opinion).
  • Mixing and mastering the project.  These parts are not as glamorous but they are an essential part to a great sounding song.
  • Album design and artwork.  This part could be cool because depending the perk you invest in YOUR NAME could be in the liner notes!!
  • Pressing the CD.  This part is also cool because not long after it is pressed you will be sliding it into your CD player!

Now, those are the bare bones of what is needed BUT exceeding the goal means we can do even more...like:

  • Promotion.  Taking the music to a much larger audience is critical but can be expensive.
  • Radio.  Taking a song to radio is the same but SO important.  Rest assured these songs WILL BE radio ready so lets make it happen!
  • Shows.  Playing in front of larger audiences within the country market is a great way to build the fan base.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are lots of ways to help beyond and in addition to donating...like:

  • SHARE and SHARE again!  You have lots of people in your social networking circles that are not in mine.  Every time you share this page with your friends the possibilities of what we can do grows exponentially! 
  • Not to sound like 1980 or anything but the best way to share something you are passionate about is still WORD OF MOUTH.  Tell your friends.  I will be passing out cards with info on the campaign including a QR code at my shows and I would love to send some to you for you to pass out.  Just let me know!
  • Take advantage of the "share" tools here on Indiegogo!  They are extremely helpful and take care of the work for you.

Now, check out the perks and remember you can give whatever you want!  The perks are there to help and to show you what you will receive for helping.

THANK YOU!!

story:
My name is Julian MacDonough and I am a professional jazz drummer and educator in Bellingham Washington and I opened WJMAC in October of this past year to  present weekly concerts in an all ages venue. Artists we've presented or who are scheduled to play this year are jazz greats Eric Alexander, David Hazeltine, Steve Davis, Geoffrey Keezer, Seamus Blake, Harold Mabern, Jimmy Heath, Brian Blade, Peter Bernstein and many regional musicians. The other feature that WJMAC is proud to offer is a high school jazz combo program that instructs kids on improvisation, group playing, swing, and jazz history. Students are put in bands of 5 or 6 and given arrangements to learn and are taught how to improvise over the different song forms. They are then given the opportunity to perform in our club and open for headlining artists.

What We Need & What You Get

 WJMAC is looking to raise $14000 so that we may keep the quality teachers we have and to ensure that the students are taught by the best instructors we can offer. The funds will also go to help pay off our beautiful Steinway piano that we need to pay off ($8000) in the next month. We also are in need of music stands, stand lights, and a larger budget for more sheet music. We would also like to send these groups to various competitions around the West Coast starting in the fall so part of this money would help with those fees.


The perks we are offering are very cool. Limited release (only for contributors of this campaign!) CDs of live performances of some of the guests we've had at WJMAC. Other perks include private instruction from any of our teachers at WJMAC, live performances by our faculty trio at a location of your choosing and also a signed 1950's Zildjian Ride Cymbal signed by Miles Davis' drummer Jimmy Cobb! 

If we don't make our full goal, the funds will go through our priority list. We would fund our teachers first to make sure the kids are getting the best instruction. Then we would pay down our piano as much as we could. After that it's music stands, sheet music etc.

The Impact

WJMAC, in it's 5 months of operation, has already had a wonderful impact on the community in many ways. It has brought together a lot of different people from different walks of life that share a common love of jazz music. They don't have to drive two hours to the big city, pay high cover charges, parking, and restaurant minimums to hear some of the best jazz musicians in the world. The venue is all ages so people can turn their children on to live music in a positive, relaxed, music focused atmosphere. And our students  not only learn from their teachers at WJMAC, they can attend all of the shows for free to learn more about the music from some of the masters of this genre.

Some of the people that we have presented in the past year: George Cables, Geoffry Keezer, Seamus Blake, Harold Mabern, Eric Alexander, David Hazeltine, Louis Hayes, Jeremy Pelt, Vincent Herring, Brian Blade, Ali Jackson Trio, Peter Bernstein. Our students as well as the community have not only gotten to hear some amazing performances, but they are also learning a lot about the music, together!

Risks & Challenges

I started WJMAC on a shoe string to fill a void in terms of a lack of jazz performances in Bellingham, of knowledge about jazz music, it's musicians and it's history and also because I saw students who were interested in learning about it but didn't have access to teachers or a place to network and start bands. We are a membership based venture and while that helps bring in some money every month, we haven't achieved our membership goal yet and so we are not yet fully sustainable. This venture has also proven to have a lot of support and enthusiasm with the community on many levels, so as I race to meet our membership goals to become sustainable, I am trying to not let the quality of performances or educators slip. This has left us with very little wiggle room financially to acquire the little extras that we need that really start to add up.

I know that with the help of this campaign though, we will gain some valuable resources to help us sustain what we have started and to grow to meet our membership goals so that WJMAC will be a sustained cultural part of Bellingham

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute financially to this venture, you can help by emailing or sharing this on social media! Let people know what we are doing. Also, you can go to wjmac.org to find out more information, and if nothing else, just come to a show!

story:
I'm Neon Hitch and I'm starting the world's first Fan Label so that my music will be in the hands of the only people that really matter anymore in the music industry : The Fans.


Here's what my fans are saying : 




It's become very clear to me that my fans love my music more than any record label executive or radio DJ ever will. That's because my music is FOR them. So for that reason I have decided to put my music out through a new kind of record label that run for and by the fans. I call it The Fan Label and my specific Fan Label is called #WeRNeon. Record Labels are businesses so they are all about money. So that's why a new take on a record label has to figure out a revolutionary way to allocate the money that a traditional label dealt with. Here's our plan: the money that used to get spent on well paid executives and their staff to put out my music through a major record label will now flow into the hands of my fans who operate our Fan Label. My art department? Fans. My A&R's? Fans. My executives? Fans. My collaborators? Fans. My marketing geniuses? Fans. My radio promo team? Fans. My video producers? Fans. My photographers? Fans. I think you get the picture. Anything a record label can do ... my fans can do it betta!!! 

Why Am I Doing This? 
I spent 4 years signed to Warner Brothers. I got to see first hand what the problems are with the traditional record label. There's too many executives and they never stay the same for more than a year or so... then you are at the mercy of a whole new set of executives. Meanwhile, I've recorded enough songs with some of the world's best producers for multiple albums but only been allowed to release a handful of songs. And its not like the songs that were released weren't successful enough to warrant an album either. My singles hit #1 on Billboard twice on their Dance charts (Luv U Betta & Gold), was featured on Gym Class Heroes's smash hit "Ass Back Home", and killed the game online with over 25 Million youtube views, over 20 million Spotify streams, tons of activity on social media, and whatever else you might expect of an emerging singer songwriter. After 4 years, 2 ownership switches, the departure of all of the team that signed me to Warner Brothers, and an album delayed for 3 years, I had to face my fans and make a decision. Go independent and take full creative control over my future, or try and slug it out as a pawn to the man. Looking back, the decision should have been very easy but at the time it was a very tough one to make. Being signed to a Major Label made me, a broke, often homeless, singer songwriter who grew up on a bus travelling with the circus, feel like I had made it. My mom and family and friends all congratulated me and told me how proud they were of me. I toured all around the world and played my dream venue Madison Square Garden. And its not like the independent record labels out there were "cracking the code" to the future of the music business. But then I saw some glimpses of hope like my friend Mackelmore becoming an independent superstar and artists like Amanda Palmer going to crowdfunding to fund their albums and tours. So I asked my family and friends and most importantly fans if they would support me doing something like this and the overwhelming support made me confident that I can flourish as an independent artist. So now I am running my Fan Label www.werneon.com using the same software (NationBuilder) that people use to organize political parties and grass roots movements and we are making things betta and faster than I ever did when I was signed tot he Major. 

What Will Happen Because Your Support This Campaign 
First and foremost it will allow my fans to finally get my first album Eleutheromaniac. To release the album all of the producer fees ($50k) that were previously going to be paid by Warner Brothers have to be paid. I love my producers (they are my biggest fans and vice versa) and they deserve to be paid for the work they did and their facilities which makes my music possible. The best part about this is that once we hit this level, my Fan Label #WeRNeon will then release my album everywhere... but first all of you Indiegogo contributors will get a special edition version of the album sent to you directly from me. 
The next thing this campaign will do is allow me to bring as powerful of a live show to as many of my fans as possible. If we hit the second level of the campaign ($100k) we are going to hire the fan tour team and buy the vehicles and gear needed to keep touring until I get to sing for and meet every fan of mine around the world. I live to make my fans happy and I'm so excited to go on my upcoming Yard Sale Tour and then keep on travelling to whatever places team #WeRNeon brings me to. I am a gypsy after all! Bring me to your city or country!! 
If the campaign hits $200k then team #WeRNeon we will be shooting music videos for 3 songs and be featuring the talent and skills of my fans in each video. Fans will help with the treatment and ideas and work in each department on the video set including being featured in all of the videos. 
If the campaign gets to $300k then it will then unlock the world's first Fan Album. I'm going to make an entire album with my super talented fans. This album will be the most collaborative album ever made and will allow us to showcase all of the talents of my wonderful Fans. My fans are incredible singers, songwriters, producers, graphic designers, and idea people... We don't need anyone but each other to make magic music!
If the campaign hits $500k then my fans and I will rent a huge house for a year where all of the most active members of #WeRNeon will work and live together making music and perfecting the work of the Fan Label. This will be filmed and we will release this as our own version of Big Brother that takes people inside the future of the music business and features all of us Eleutheromaniacs.
If the campaign hits $1Million then Fan Label will take on other artists to build their own Fan Labels. Let's think about it. Warner my old label was sold for more than $3Billion. Thats 3 thousand million dollars. So with only 0.003% of that money we can take a shot at creating the future business model for musicians and their fans.

Here are some of the PERKS you will get for supporting this campaign!
IF YOU HAVE SOMETHING SPECIFIC YOU WANT THAT ISNT LISTED EMAIL CONTACTNEONHITCH@GMAIL.COM AND I WILL TRY AND MAKE IT HAPPEN FOR YOU !! NAME YOUR PRICE!!

My UPFRONT (www.beupfront.com) App that comes with every Perk and allows for direct fan communication and sharing of all the content I don't put on Facebook Instagram and Twitter



Eleutheromaniac Album Art (painted from a picture of me and my family in our bus when I was 10)


301 Necklace with WeRNeon engraved on back



Exclusive Designer Tshirts by the wonderful Geoffrey Mac

Exclusive Designer HeadScarves by Geoffrey Mac


Stonehenge Eleutheromaniac Experience


The Ultimate Eleutheromaniac Experience at The Cove on Eleuthera Island 



If you can't contribute financially to help the campaign but you still want to help please share this page on your social media accounts. And if you want to be part of the world's first FAN LABEL then go to www.werneon.com and sign up for the specific department you would like to help. And you can always email me directly at contactneonhitch@gmail.com 

THANK YOU I LOVE YOU AND CAN'T WAIT FOR YOU TO HEAR THE NEW MUSIC!!!! #WeRNeon
story_txt:
I'm Neon Hitch and I'm starting the world's first Fan Label so that my music will be in the hands of the only people that really matter anymore in the music industry : The Fans.

Here's what my fans are saying : 








It's become very clear to me that my fans love my music more than any record label executive or radio DJ ever will. That's because my music is FOR them. So for that reason I have decided to put my music out through a new kind of record label that run for and by the fans. I call it The Fan Label and my specific Fan Label is called #WeRNeon. Record Labels are businesses so they are all about money. So that's why a new take on a record label has to figure out a revolutionary way to allocate the money that a traditional label dealt with. Here's our plan: the money that used to get spent on well paid executives and their staff to put out my music through a major record label will now flow into the hands of my fans who operate our Fan Label. My art department? Fans. My A&R's? Fans. My executives? Fans. My collaborators? Fans. My marketing geniuses? Fans. My radio promo team? Fans. My video producers? Fans. My photographers? Fans. I think you get the picture. Anything a record label can do ... my fans can do it betta!!! 
Why Am I Doing This? 
I spent 4 years signed to Warner Brothers. I got to see first hand what the problems are with the traditional record label. There's too many executives and they never stay the same for more than a year or so... then you are at the mercy of a whole new set of executives. Meanwhile, I've recorded enough songs with some of the world's best producers for multiple albums but only been allowed to release a handful of songs. And its not like the songs that were released weren't successful enough to warrant an album either. My singles hit #1 on Billboard twice on their Dance charts (Luv U Betta & Gold), was featured on Gym Class Heroes's smash hit "Ass Back Home", and killed the game online with over 25 Million youtube views, over 20 million Spotify streams, tons of activity on social media, and whatever else you might expect of an emerging singer songwriter. After 4 years, 2 ownership switches, the departure of all of the team that signed me to Warner Brothers, and an album delayed for 3 years, I had to face my fans and make a decision. Go independent and take full creative control over my future, or try and slug it out as a pawn to the man. Looking back, the decision should have been very easy but at the time it was a very tough one to make. Being signed to a Major Label made me, a broke, often homeless, singer songwriter who grew up on a bus travelling with the circus, feel like I had made it. My mom and family and friends all congratulated me and told me how proud they were of me. I toured all around the world and played my dream venue Madison Square Garden. And its not like the independent record labels out there were "cracking the code" to the future of the music business. But then I saw some glimpses of hope like my friend Mackelmore becoming an independent superstar and artists like Amanda Palmer going to crowdfunding to fund their albums and tours. So I asked my family and friends and most importantly fans if they would support me doing something like this and the overwhelming support made me confident that I can flourish as an independent artist. So now I am running my Fan Label www.werneon.com using the same software (NationBuilder) that people use to organize political parties and grass roots movements and we are making things betta and faster than I ever did when I was signed tot he Major.

First and foremost it will allow my fans to finally get my first album Eleutheromaniac. To release the album all of the producer fees ($50k) that were previously going to be paid by Warner Brothers have to be paid. I love my producers (they are my biggest fans and vice versa) and they deserve to be paid for the work they did and their facilities which makes my music possible. The best part about this is that once we hit this level, my Fan Label #WeRNeon will then release my album everywhere... but first all of you Indiegogo contributors will get a special edition version of the album sent to you directly from me. 

The next thing this campaign will do is allow me to bring as powerful of a live show to as many of my fans as possible. If we hit the second level of the campaign ($100k) we are going to hire the fan tour team and buy the vehicles and gear needed to keep touring until I get to sing for and meet every fan of mine around the world. I live to make my fans happy and I'm so excited to go on my upcoming Yard Sale Tour and then keep on travelling to whatever places team #WeRNeon brings me to. I am a gypsy after all! Bring me to your city or country!!

If the campaign gets to $300k then it will then unlock the world's first Fan Album. I'm going to make an entire album with my super talented fans. This album will be the most collaborative album ever made and will allow us to showcase all of the talents of my wonderful Fans. My fans are incredible singers, songwriters, producers, graphic designers, and idea people... We don't need anyone but each other to make magic music!

Thats 3 thousand million dollars. So with only 0.003% of that money we can take a shot at creating the future business model for musicians and their fans.

story:
UPDATE #3: Twill Distilled has finished the official Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel poster! Check it out in full below. Featured are Alpha and MZ, Creeper who is played by Ekaj, Anti who is played by Phantastik the Phenom, and Denial the Servicer who is played by Forenus Mod.



UPDATE #2: We have officially hit our first stretch goal! That means we are 125% funded! Thank you guys so much for all of your support. This project means the world to us and we're happy that you're as excited about it as we are! Everybody who has donated thus far will receive a free poster featuring the talented Twill Distilled's artwork. Work on the poster is nearly finished but here's a look at the work in progress:




UPDATE #1: We have officially hit our 100% funding goal of $600! Thank you SO MUCH everyone! In celebration, we've released the next single, "The Man of a Hundred Guns featuring Ish1da as Asim Billy" at www.AlphaRiff.com! (Direct Link: The Man of a Hundred Guns ft. Ish1da) see our stretch goals below!


COMPLETED: Stretch Goal #1 - $750 - Digital Champions Poster by Twill Distilled

Our first Stretch Goal is the new Digital Champions poster being designed by Twill Distilled! Once we hit a goal of $750, everybody who donated to the IndieGoGo campaign will receive a signed version of this amazing colored poster (line art version in graphic below)!


Stretch Goal #2 - $1100 - Blue Digital Champions T-Shirt

Our second Stretch Goal is a brand new blue Digital Champions T-Shirt! For those who have a base contribution of $25 (Trading Cards + Physical Album + Red Digital Champions Shirt), you will also receive this shirt in your package! The blue Digital Champions shirt features MZ and Alpha from Twill Distilled's amazing poster work in black, white, and red! This perk will be unlocked at $1100!


Stretch Goal #3 - $??? - To Be Announced

What is our third stretch goal and when does it unlock? That will be announced close to the second stretch goal, but it's a doozy!



Who We Are

Hello everyone! Alpha Riff here! I'm an Indie Hip-Hop/Nerdcore Artist who loves telling great stories via incredible music. I'm on IndieGoGo again to tell you guys about my brand new full-length album, Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel.

Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel is a 23 track Hip-Hopera about two digital bounty hunters, Alpha Riff and MZ,  and their quest to figure out why a strain of lethal C.O.D.E. is ravaging their world. Through the tale, they meet an array of incredible characters played by amazing emcees and singers. Some become allies, others enemies, but all will leave you breathless with their energetic and emotive deliveries.

This time around, we are looking to take the story beyond the album. We want to create trading cards, games, and more. With your help, we can achieve all of that!


What We Need & What You Get

To achieve this, we are looking to raise $600. While Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel has already been completed and we are ramping up for the marketing push, we still need help with the physical side. With your help, we can make it come to fruition much faster.

There are several levels of donation, from $2.50 to $100, but each one gets you their respective perks at cheaper than retail price. It also helps lock down future parts of the project, such as the mobile game that is in prototyping stages and music videos to coincide with the album.

Everyone who donates receives ringtones and text tones from the album, including the various instrumental themes. All of those who donate enough to get the album will get a free week of streaming before the album is released! *NEW* You will also get my other full length album, From Beta to Alpha Riff, AND VI: Final Fantasy VI Tribute, a 3 track instrumental album releasing on October 20, 2014 for free! As for what you get at each level:

- $2.50 (+$4.50 Shipping) funding: All 20 of the character trading cards, which allow 15% off Alpha Riff merchandise + codes allowing free in-app purchases in the Digital Champions mobile game coming in 2015 - Card art courtesy of Thor Angelus (https://www.facebook.com/mjolnirincpins)

Example trading card - Design not final


- $5.00 funding: The Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel digital album at discount

Album Cover and Back


- $7.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel digital album at discount + all 20 trading cards

- $10.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Physical copy of Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel + everything above

- $25.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Brand new red Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel T-shirt + everything above

Shirt Design:


- $50.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Beta invites to Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel mobile games + everything above

- $100.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Associate Producer for Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel + Future song shoutout + YOUR OWN DIGITAL CHAMPIONS CHARACTER ( in an album, game, videos, Etc) + Voice-over acting for said character + everything above

If we are unable to meet our goal, we will still have physical merchandise! It will take longer to become available, however, so we hope you can help us get it out much faster!


VI: Final Fantasy Tribute Instrumental Album Perk!

As a huge thank you to everyone, I am including a new perk for those who donate. Anyone who has a base donation contribution of $5 or more (all perks except 20 Trading Cards ONLY perk) will ALSO receive the brand new Alpha Riff album, VI: Final Fantasy VI Tribute, for FREE. Slated to release on October 20, 2014 for the 20th Anniversary of the US release of Final Fantasy VI (III US), VI: Final Fantasy VI Tribute is a 3 track instrumental album dedicated to 3 of my favorite characters of all time: Locke, Cyan, and Shadow. It will be priced at $3 at release! I can't wait to get this one into your hands! It's been a fun project I've been working on alongside Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel and I think you will really enjoy putting it into rotation! Download links will be sent out on October 20th for all those who donate!



BRAND NEW PERK!

What's better than getting one amazing Alpha Riff album plus a 3 track instrumental? How about getting ANOTHER Alpha Riff album completely free? As a huge thank you for all of this support, anyone who has a base contribution of $5 or more will get my previous full-length album, From Beta to Alpha Riff, for FREE today! This perk is retroactive, so check your email if you've already donated (check your email shortly). You will receive a code for the album in your email (this email is not published or shared with anyone and will only be used to deliver the codes for any digital goods; you will not be placed on a mailing list from this IndieGoGo).


The Cast & The World

Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel is set in the world of Digitalia, a computer based world where the Flux, humanoid-like beings, live their day to day lives. Within Digitalia are hundreds of continents and it is on the continent known only as The Zone where our story takes place. The Zone is divided into two areas: the DMZ and the Fire Wall. The DMZ is a wasteland where it is said no one can return. The Fire Wall is a tall barrier encircling an enormous area at the edge of The Zone. Within the Fire Wall is the city of I.P. It is inside of I.P. that Alpha Riff and MZ live.

I.P. is not the only city within the Fire Wall, but it the largest and most important. I.P. is home to billions of Flux, who go about their lives working, eating, sleeping, living, laughing, and loving just as humans do. They are ruled by a parliament, they have a military, and there is a seedy underground network of bounty hunters, mercenary, drug and arms dealers, and more doing the dirty work of corrupting politicians and assassinating their enemies.

It is in I.P. that we meet most of the characters in the story:

B. B. Stuart - Played by TekForce (https://soundcloud.com/tek45), B. B. Stuart is the go-to for those looking for information on anything in I.P. Owner of the Hypertext Cafe, a club known for the hottest women, the best drinks, and the loudest music in all of I.P, B. B. Stuart is Alpha and MZ's go-to whenever they're in a jam.

Asim Billy - Played by Ish1da (https://soundcloud.com/ish1da), Asim Billy is one of the most prominent arms dealers in all of I.P. If you need a weapon that can take out a tank, Asim Billy is your man.

Principal T. C. - Played by 1UP (https://soundcloud.com/creativemindframe), Principal T. C. is the power hungry military General who heads up Protocol Academy and the military. Alpha has a very sorted history with the man. 

Klass - Played by TV's Tyler Boyco (https://soundcloud.com/tvstylerboyco), Klass is Alpha's old mentor in all things bounty hunting. Now retired, Alpha and MZ seek his advice during their quest.

Captain Proxy - Played by 2 Mello of Chrono Jigga and Nastlevania fame (https://soundcloud.com/2mello), Captain Proxy is the crotchety old man guarding the Gates of Fire Wall, not allowing anyone to leave or enter.

But that is not all! They meet many others throughout their journeys, both good, evil, and neutral. These are played by the following:

Mysterious Caller - Played by Tyefighter. Sends Alpha on his initial quest.

Keyware - Played by MC Ohm-I (https://soundcloud.com/mc-ohm-i). Just one of the many bounties they have to collect.

Fate - Played by Zilla Persona (http://zillapersona.com/). A broken program floating through the world.

Creeper - Played by Ekaj (https://soundcloud.com/ekaj-daverbal-miraje). One of Anti's most loyal henchmen.

Death - Played by Matt Mead of Kingdoms Burn (https://www.facebook.com/KingdomsBurn). A sub-routine written into Creeper's code.

Destiny - Played by 2-Ton 21 (https://www.facebook.com/2ton21). A broken program floating through the world.

Crimelord B. Net - Played by Nyte (https://nyte.bandcamp.com/). One of the most notorious of crimelords in I.P.

Harbinger - Played by Jollimus (https://soundcloud.com/jollimus). An experiment gone wrong. It now wanders the DMZ looking for prey to quiz with riddles from its 7 faces.

Christian Proxy - Played by Midi-Boss of The Last Wordbenders (https://soundcloud.com/thelastwordbenders). Lost explorer.

Ravager - Played by Kordlyss (https://soundcloud.com/kordlyss). Unabashed serial killer.

Denial the Servicer - Played by ForneusMod of Hanna Barbaric (https://soundcloud.com/hanna-barbaric). Excommunicated military General with a chip on his shoulder.

Forgiveness - Played by Susan Davis. A sub-routine built into MZ's programming.

Anti - Played by Phantastik the Phenom (https://soundcloud.com/phantastikthephenom). Alpha's very first bounty.

Prog - Played by Aramis (https://soundcloud.com/aramis616). Does he truly exist?


    Risks & Challenges

    What risks are there to donating? None! Whether the goals are met, there will be merchandise. But, with your help, we can obtain it much faster! And what do you get for it? More discounts, a hand in future pieces of Digital Champions, and the chance to become a part of the series!


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Not able to donate? Thats okay!

      Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel could still use your help. Are you interested in telling people about the Hip-Hopera? Share our IndieGoGo page with your friends or the Youtube video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QKesAz_EoRw. 

      Want more people to know more about the world of Digitalia and the characters? Check out the Digital Champions Video Diaries here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLQFBVyUczYc8fe-8naFsQwaMDMgpSODe6.

      What else can you do? Check out my official music page at www.AlphaRiff.com. You'll find free EPs and my previous full length, From Beta to Alpha Riff, as well as ringtones, wallpapers, and more.

      Thanks for all of your support! We're very excited about getting this project into your hands and can't wait for you to experience more about Digital Champions in the coming year.


      More Alpha Riff Press

      Want to know more about Alpha Riff? Check out these awesome press links!

      Nerdcore Now

      http://nerdcorenow.com/2013/02/15/album-alpha-riff-n-e-r-d/

      http://nerdcorenow.com/2013/02/15/music-video-alpha-riff-superhero-swag/

      http://nerdcorenow.com/2013/06/26/album-alpha-riff-from-beta-to-alpha-riff/

      The Unheard Nerd

       http://www.theunheardnerd.com/2013/02/alpha-riff-superhero-swag-ft-brie.html

      http://www.theunheardnerd.com/2013/02/alpha-riff-liberty-of-beast-demo-video.html

      http://www.theunheardnerd.com/2013/04/alpha-riff-liberty-of-beast-single.html

      http://www.theunheardnerd.com/2013/04/the-unheard-nerd-podcast-21.html

      http://www.theunheardnerd.com/2013/02/the-unheard-nerd-podcast-16.html

      http://www.theunheardnerd.com/2013/06/the-unheard-nerd-podcast-23.html

      http://theunheardnerd.blogspot.com/2013/10/alpha-riff-final-boss-video.html

      Gettin' Pixelated

       http://gettinpixelated.com/2013/02/20/gettin-pixelated-02202013/

      http://gettinpixelated.com/2013/03/20/gettin-pixelated-03202013/

Some become allies, others enemies, but all will leave you breathless with their energetic and emotive deliveries.
This time around, we are looking to take the story beyond the album. We want to create trading cards, games, and more. With your help, we can achieve all of that!


What We Need & What You Get To achieve this, we are looking to raise $600. While Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel has already been completed and we are ramping up for the marketing push, we still need help with the physical side. With your help, we can make it come to fruition much faster.

There are several levels of donation, from $2.50 to $100, but each one gets you their respective perks at cheaper than retail price. It also helps lock down future parts of the project, such as the mobile game that is in prototyping stages and music videos to coincide with the album.
Everyone who donates receives ringtones and text tones from the album, including the various instrumental themes. All of those who donate enough to get the album will get a free week of streaming before the album is released! *NEW* You will also get my other full length album, From Beta to Alpha Riff, AND VI: Final Fantasy VI Tribute, a 3 track instrumental album releasing on October 20, 2014 for free! As for what you get at each level:
- $2.50 (+$4.50 Shipping) funding: All 20 of the character trading cards, which allow 15% off Alpha Riff merchandise + codes allowing free in-app purchases in the Digital Champions mobile game coming in 2015 - Card art courtesy of Thor Angelus (https://www.facebook.com/mjolnirincpins)

Example trading card - Design not final


- $5.00 funding: The Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel digital album at discount
Album Cover and Back

- $7.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel digital album at discount + all 20 trading cards
- $10.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Physical copy of Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel + everything above
- $25.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Brand new red Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel T-shirt + everything above
Shirt Design:




- $50.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Beta invites to Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel mobile games + everything above
- $100.00 (+ $5.00 Shipping) funding: Associate Producer for Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel + Future song shoutout + YOUR OWN DIGITAL CHAMPIONS CHARACTER ( in an album, game, videos, Etc) + Voice-over acting for said character + everything above
If we are unable to meet our goal, we will still have physical merchandise! It will take longer to become available, however, so we hope you can help us get it out much faster!


VI: Final Fantasy Tribute Instrumental Album Perk!

As a huge thank you to everyone, I am including a new perk for those who donate. Anyone who has a base donation contribution of $5 or more (all perks except 20 Trading Cards ONLY perk) will ALSO receive the brand new Alpha Riff album, VI: Final Fantasy VI Tribute, for FREE. Slated to release on October 20, 2014 for the 20th Anniversary of the US release of Final Fantasy VI (III US), VI: Final Fantasy VI Tribute is a 3 track instrumental album dedicated to 3 of my favorite characters of all time: Locke, Cyan, and Shadow. It will be priced at $3 at release! I can't wait to get this one into your hands! It's been a fun project I've been working on alongside Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel and I think you will really enjoy putting it into rotation! Download links will be sent out on October 20th for all those who donate!





BRAND NEW PERK!
What's better than getting one amazing Alpha Riff album plus a 3 track instrumental? How about getting ANOTHER Alpha Riff album completely free? As a huge thank you for all of this support, anyone who has a base contribution of $5 or more will get my previous full-length album, From Beta to Alpha Riff, for FREE today! This perk is retroactive, so check your email if you've already donated (check your email shortly). You will receive a code for the album in your email (this email is not published or shared with anyone and will only be used to deliver the codes for any digital goods; you will not be placed on a mailing list from this IndieGoGo).




The Cast & The World Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel is set in the world of Digitalia, a computer based world where the Flux, humanoid-like beings, live their day to day lives. Within Digitalia are hundreds of continents and it is on the continent known only as The Zone where our story takes place. The Zone is divided into two areas: the DMZ and the Fire Wall. The DMZ is a wasteland where it is said no one can return. The Fire Wall is a tall barrier encircling an enormous area at the edge of The Zone. Within the Fire Wall is the city of I.P. It is inside of I.P. that Alpha Riff and MZ live.
I.P. is not the only city within the Fire Wall, but it the largest and most important. I.P. is home to billions of Flux, who go about their lives working, eating, sleeping, living, laughing, and loving just as humans do. They are ruled by a parliament, they have a military, and there is a seedy underground network of bounty hunters, mercenary, drug and arms dealers, and more doing the dirty work of corrupting politicians and assassinating their enemies.
It is in I.P. that we meet most of the characters in the story:
B. B. Stuart - Played by TekForce (https://soundcloud.com/tek45), B. B. Stuart is the go-to for those looking for information on anything in I.P. Owner of the Hypertext Cafe, a club known for the hottest women, the best drinks, and the loudest music in all of I.P, B. B. Stuart is Alpha and MZ's go-to whenever they're in a jam.
Asim Billy - Played by Ish1da (https://soundcloud.com/ish1da), Asim Billy is one of the most prominent arms dealers in all of I.P. If you need a weapon that can take out a tank, Asim Billy is your man.
Principal T. C. - Played by 1UP (https://soundcloud.com/creativemindframe), Principal T. C. is the power hungry military General who heads up Protocol Academy and the military. Alpha has a very sorted history with the man. 
Klass - Played by TV's Tyler Boyco (https://soundcloud.com/tvstylerboyco), Klass is Alpha's old mentor in all things bounty hunting. Now retired, Alpha and MZ seek his advice during their quest.
Captain Proxy - Played by 2 Mello of Chrono Jigga and Nastlevania fame (https://soundcloud.com/2mello), Captain Proxy is the crotchety old man guarding the Gates of Fire Wall, not allowing anyone to leave or enter.
But that is not all! They meet many others throughout their journeys, both good, evil, and neutral. These are played by the following:
Mysterious Caller - Played by Tyefighter. Sends Alpha on his initial quest.
Keyware - Played by MC Ohm-I (https://soundcloud.com/mc-ohm-i). Just one of the many bounties they have to collect.
Fate - Played by Zilla Persona (http://zillapersona.com/). A broken program floating through the world.
Creeper - Played by Ekaj (https://soundcloud.com/ekaj-daverbal-miraje). One of Anti's most loyal henchmen.
Death - Played by Matt Mead of Kingdoms Burn (https://www.facebook.com/KingdomsBurn). A sub-routine written into Creeper's code.
Destiny - Played by 2-Ton 21 (https://www.facebook.com/2ton21). A broken program floating through the world.
Crimelord B. Net - Played by Nyte (https://nyte.bandcamp.com/). One of the most notorious of crimelords in I.P.
Harbinger - Played by Jollimus (https://soundcloud.com/jollimus). An experiment gone wrong. It now wanders the DMZ looking for prey to quiz with riddles from its 7 faces.
Christian Proxy - Played by Midi-Boss of The Last Wordbenders (https://soundcloud.com/thelastwordbenders). Lost explorer.
Ravager - Played by Kordlyss (https://soundcloud.com/kordlyss). Unabashed serial killer.
Denial the Servicer - Played by ForneusMod of Hanna Barbaric (https://soundcloud.com/hanna-barbaric). Excommunicated military General with a chip on his shoulder.
Forgiveness - Played by Susan Davis. A sub-routine built into MZ's programming.
Anti - Played by Phantastik the Phenom (https://soundcloud.com/phantastikthephenom). Alpha's very first bounty.
Prog - Played by Aramis (https://soundcloud.com/aramis616). Does he truly exist?


  Risks & Challenges What risks are there to donating? None! Whether the goals are met, there will be merchandise. But, with your help, we can obtain it much faster! And what do you get for it? More discounts, a hand in future pieces of Digital Champions, and the chance to become a part of the series!


  Other Ways You Can Help Not able to donate? Thats okay!
Digital Champions: Migdal Bavel could still use your help. Are you interested in telling people about the Hip-Hopera? Share our IndieGoGo page with your friends or the Youtube video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QKesAz_EoRw. 
Want more people to know more about the world of Digitalia and the characters? Check out the Digital Champions Video Diaries here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLQFBVyUczYc8fe-8naFsQwaMDMgpSODe6.
What else can you do? Check out my official music page at www.AlphaRiff.com. You'll find free EPs and my previous full length, From Beta to Alpha Riff, as well as ringtones, wallpapers, and more.
Thanks for all of your support! We're very excited about getting this project into your hands and can't wait for you to experience more about Digital Champions in the coming year.


More Alpha Riff Press

Want to know more about Alpha Riff? Check out these awesome press links!


Nerdcore Now

story:
À l'aube d'un nouveau jour...

C'est le titre de travail du nouvel album des MALPRIS. Le groupe entre en studio pour l'enregistrement de ce deuxième effort ces jours-ci. Une douzaine de titres constitueront ce cd qui sera entièrement composé des pièces originales.

Ce moment crucial dans la vie des Malpris ne pourra se faire sans le soutien des fans du groupe et de leurs amis. C'est pourquoi nous avons décidé de se tourner vers vous afin de nous aider à relever ce défi si important.

Le premier album, La Bouée, a été entièrement financé par le groupe. Cette fois, les attentes sont plus élevées. Notre musique a pris un chemin inattendu et nous avons la ferme intention d'aller au bout de nos efforts de création et sans vous, il sera très difficile d'y arriver. 

Honnêtement, la sécurité financière de vos contributions permettra cette paix d'esprit que nous recherchons. 

La production

Produire un album de qualité nécessite beaucoup d'efforts mais aussi un environnement propice à la réussite du projet. Malheureusement, tout cela coûte très cher. L'objectif de notre campagne de financement sur Indiegogo est de 4000$. Avec cette somme, nous pourrons défrayer les coûts du studio. 

Cela peut paraître énorme pour un projet musical indépendant. Mais sachez que cette somme ne représente qu'une partie de la production. Si l'on tient compte que la réalisation d'un album implique au minimum 200 heures de travail, un calcul tout simple nous indique qu'il nous en coûtera 25$ de l'heure. 

Il n'en tient qu'à vous de décider combien d'heures vous avez envie de nous offrir!

Notre engagement

Selon le montant que vous aurez envie d'investir dans notre aventure, nous aurons une contrepartie équivalente à vous offrir. Parmi ces «contreparties», vous pourriez recevoir un album autographié, un t-shirt, une invitation à venir en studio, une invitation VIP au lancement et si on trouve que vous êtes vraiment généreux, on vous offrira un petit concert privé en version acoustique dans le confort de votre foyer!

Sachez que tous les sous recueillis dans le cadre de cette campagne iront à la production de l'album. Ne vous inquiétez pas, nous ne prendrons pas l'avion pour Nashville afin de se payer le Studio B de RCA Victor! Toutes les sommes investies le seront dans la région de l'Outaouais. De par votre engagement dans notre projet, vous aiderez du même coup des petits entrepreneurs de Gatineau.

Deadline

Après avoir vécu l'expérience lors de la production du premier album, nous avons décidé de ne pas s'attacher à un échéancier précis, sauf pour ce qui est de cette campagne de financement.

Nous croyons que, cette fois et grâce à vos contributions, nous pourrons travailler plus à notre aise. Mais, vous devez aussi savoir que la réalisation de ce genre de projet amène son lot d'écueils et de difficultés. Par contre, nous nous engageons à vous tenir bien au fait de l'évolution de notre travail.

Concernant cette campagne, nous n'allons pas attendre d'avoir atteint notre objectif de financement (5000$) avant de se mettre au travail. Nous sommes confiants d'atteindre notre objectif mais si ce chiffre n'est pas atteint dans les 40 jours de la campagne, nous redoublerons d'efforts afin de vous offrir un produit de qualité, peu importe les moyens financiers mis à notre disposition.

D'autres façons d'aider

Nous savons très bien que certains d'entre-vous ne pourront pas contribuer financièrement à notre projet mais cela ne veut pas dire que vous ne pouvez pas nous aider. Passez le mot dans votre entourage et encouragez les gens à nous aider. Ce sera votre façon de contribuer à notre projet. Et il y a plusieurs outils de partage sur ce site qui vous aideront à promouvoir nos efforts.

Enfin, nous avons mis la barre très haute pour ce deuxième opus et sans vous, nous ne pourrons pas y arriver.

Enfin, nous avons mis la barre très haute pour ce deuxième opus et sans vous, nous ne pourrons pas y arriver.

story:
Who we are:

We're an independent seven piece horn fueled band based in Ottawa that performs original music in the “jump blues” style of late swing/early R&B artists like Louis Jordan or Wynonnie Harris or more modern acts like Big Bad Voodoo Daddy.     Billed as “the missing link between swing & rock 'n roll”  we deliver a high energy show with an emphasis on cookin' grooves, fun satirical lyrics and improvised solos from the many great players in the band.

What' we've done and what's going on now:

Over the years we've toured in Europe and the United States as well as around central Canada and spring 2015 marks the release of our 5th album of music called “Drive Me Sane”.   With a reformed band of excellent musicians, we've written a great album and created a fine studio recording.  Good enough (and lucky enough) to have two songs from “Drive Me Sane” placed in a movie called “Prisoner Of Time” by local production company Siloam Entertainment which has now been picked up by Castlerock Entertainment in LA.   We appear in the movie as a band (I know, it's a bit of a stretch for us) performing at a club in Seoul during the Korean War in the early 50's.   The song picked for that scene is called “Fine, Fine, Fine” and the video Siloam made for us of that song is posted above.   They've since made a second video of “Jazz, Blues & Dancin' Shoes”, the other song used in “Prisoner Of Time” and we'll be releasing that in late April 2015.

We've booked a date at Centerpointe Theatre, a great venue in Ottawa to perform a CD release show and we're busy getting ready to release our new album.   We put all the money we had into producing “Drive Me Sane” and so right now the bank account is dry.   The costs we'll be covering with this funding campaign include the extra fees for the technicians at Centerpointe to work with video production but mostly for the cost of digital video recording equipment, camera people and post production of the footage.

Max and the Siloam Team:

Siloam has an excellent cameraman/production editor named Max Moskal who is a joy to work with and a very creative talent.   As we've grown comfortable with Max and Siloam's production crew, we'd love to have them come in and tape the release show.   Of course this comes with some costs and so we're launching this Indiegogo campaign to get that extra funding.    To that end we've decided to do something we've never done before: produce official Jivewires t-shirts and offer them as perks specifically for this funding drive.   The t-shirts will have our logo with the name of the album underneath so it will read “The Jivewires Drive Me Sane”.   Here's a link you can click to see a mock up of the shirt.

We hope you'll be interested in being a part of our project and contribute whatever you'd like to help us produce a great professional taping our release show. Everyone who contributes $5 or more will be listed as a "Generous Supporter "in the credits of the final concert video or any videos made from the concert footage. 

Thanks so much for your time and consideration,

Steve Berndt/The Jivewires

story:
Short Summary

Hi!! and thanks for checking out our crowd-funding campaign. Live Wire! Podcast Radio is an award winning show that hosted by Savvy. It has been in the World Podcast Awards in 2012 and 2013, and was nominated as one of the top Ten "Podsafe" Music Podcasts in the world. 

Live Wire! podcast radio is a music podcast that is designed to nurture new music from all over the world, and of any genre. It has been broadcasting for about 7 years and has been a platform where musicians can showcase their music and get heard to a large audience.


What We Need & What You Get

This crowd-funding campaign is to raise the much needed funds to create a new website for Live Wire! Podcast Radio, which will bring a positive and unique experience for the user. It will also boost our services and production that we have to offer. At present, the show is hosted on a dedicated podcast site that also hosts thousands of other Podcasts, but now we feel that the time is right to branch away from this host site, and have our own stand alone website, streaming service and servers.  

It is really important that we raise the required funds as Live Wire! Podcast Radio does not currently make any money from it's content and is produced purely through passion of broadcasting and music. Please donate generously and anything you donate will be greatly appreciated. Of course, the more you donate, the better the perks will be for you :)

The Impact

Your donation will go towards building a brand new website for the show. We are looking to make your visit to the site an experience that is cutting edge in todays New Media world, and to provide you with the best audio content around that you are able to download and enjoy. We are hoping that our large listening base around the world will support us with this campaign and assist us in continuing to put unsigned music from all over the world into the spotlight. This new website will improve our service to you and also assist us to deliver more incredible shows for you to enjoy.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a Gun website developer, or know someone who is and willing to help, and  they can also host the show on their servers, please tell them to get in touch, as we would love their help in creating our website.

Once again a huge THANK YOU to everyone who donates and supports this campaign.

Savvy :)

Host.

Live Wire! Podcast Radio. 

email: livewirepodcastradio@gmail.com

web: www.livewire.podomatic.com
story_txt:
Short Summary Hi!! and thanks for checking out our crowd-funding campaign. Live Wire! Podcast Radio is an award winning show that hosted by Savvy. It has been in the World Podcast Awards in 2012 and 2013, and was nominated as one of the top Ten "Podsafe" Music Podcasts in the world. 
Live Wire! podcast radio is a music podcast that is designed to nurture new music from all over the world, and of any genre. It has been broadcasting for about 7 years and has been a platform where musicians can showcase their music and get heard to a large audience.    What We Need & What You Get 
This crowd-funding campaign is to raise the much needed funds to create a new website for Live Wire! Podcast Radio, which will bring a positive and unique experience for the user. It will also boost our services and production that we have to offer. At present, the show is hosted on a dedicated podcast site that also hosts thousands of other Podcasts, but now we feel that the time is right to branch away from this host site, and have our own stand alone website, streaming service and servers.  
It is really important that we raise the required funds as Live Wire! Podcast Radio does not currently make any money from it's content and is produced purely through passion of broadcasting and music. Please donate generously and anything you donate will be greatly appreciated. Of course, the more you donate, the better the perks will be for you :)
    The Impact Your donation will go towards building a brand new website for the show. We are looking to make your visit to the site an experience that is cutting edge in todays New Media world, and to provide you with the best audio content around that you are able to download and enjoy. We are hoping that our large listening base around the world will support us with this campaign and assist us in continuing to put unsigned music from all over the world into the spotlight. This new website will improve our service to you and also assist us to deliver more incredible shows for you to enjoy.  

    Other Ways You Can Help If you are a Gun website developer, or know someone who is and willing to help, and  they can also host the show on their servers, please tell them to get in touch, as we would love their help in creating our website.
Once again a huge THANK YOU to everyone who donates and supports this campaign.
Savvy :)
Host.
Live Wire! Podcast Radio. 
email: livewirepodcastradio@gmail.com
web: www.livewire.podomatic.com

story:
Help Independent Ear send Jerry Dale Harris to LA in Jan 2015 to record an album at KSM Studios with Alex Kane!

  • Jerry Dale Harris is a singer/songwriter with a rock edge who delivers raw emotion in his personal, intimate songs. His songs deal with life, death, love and loss. Jerry is signed to the Independent Ear label who represents artists internationally. Jerry has teamed up with Alex Kane who will be producing the album and handling guitar and backing vocal duties as well!
  • Jerry wants to share his music with the world, and you can help him do so by making a contribution of any amount. In return you will receive a copy of the album when it's done!

What We Need & What You Get

All monies raised will be used to make the album. It will be used towards studio time, mixing/mastering costs, travel to LA and accommodations. Any additional monies raised will be put into additional studio musicians, special guest stars and potentially more songs. The more money we have to work with, the more we can give you in the final recording!

We have 7 awesome perks!

  • $1 or more = Digital copy of the album!
  • $15 or more = Signed CD and Guitar Pick + previous perks!
    Personalized by Jerry to you!
  • $30 or more = Custom Guitar Pick Jewelry Set + previous perks!
    GUITAR PICK NECKLACE AND EARRING SET!
    Customized by Jerry just for you!
  • $75 or more = Custom Lego Mini-figure + previous perks!
    YOUR OWN LEGO MINI-FIGURE! Customized by Jerry to look just like you!
  • $150 or more = One On One Guitar Lesson From Alex Kane + previous perks! 30 MINUTE SKYPE GUITAR LESSON WITH ALEX KANE!
  • $300 or more = Your Poem or Story made into a song by Jerry + previous perks! You supply the story or poem, Jerry will do the rest!
    A Live performance video of the song will be posted on YouTube with your name and story included in the description!
  • $600 or more = Be on the album with Jerry and Alex + previous perks!
    We will find a place for you on the album, a speaking role, backing vocals, playing an instrument, whatever your talent!

Risks & Challenges

This campaign is to "help" fund the album to make it bigger and better. Even if the goal is not met, the album will be recorded and released and all perks will be delivered in full!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let your friends know!
  • Like and Share Jerrys facebook page!

THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! We are the GW Troubadours and we are the original and premiere a cappella group at the George Washington University. Started in 1925, the Troubadours have been bringing beautiful music to the Foggy Bottom and DC communities for many years. 

As a group, we love making new music. Recording albums helps us preserve our work, which is extremely important to us. In the past, the Troubadours have received substantial funding from the GW Music Department's choral budget to record our biennial album. However, due to administration changes and budget cuts, we no longer will receive this funding. Therefore, we especially need your help this year to be able to pay for our album.

Please consider making a donation - no matter what size - to help us record our best album yet! We thank you in advance for your generosity! 

What We Need & What You Get

One hundred percent of the funds raised from this campaign will go directly to the costs of recording our new album! We are aiming to raise at least $1000 to supplement what we have already fundraised. To thank everyone for their generosity, we will be providing the following perks:

Loyal Fan - $25

If you donate $25, we will send you a handwritten thank you note signed by our group!

Aca-Awesome Fan - $50

If you donate $50, we will send you a personal video singing a song of your choice from our repertoire!

Troubs Groupie - $100

If you donate $100, you will be part of an exclusive group to download our album for free before it is officially released! In addition, we will send you a personal video singing a song of your choice from our repertoire.

Honorary Troub - $200

If you donate $200, you will receive all of the perks above: a handwritten thank you note, a free download of the album, and a personal video singing a song of your choice from our repertoire!

Legendary Troub Fan - $500

If you donate $500, first of all - YOU ROCK! We will send you a handwritten thank you note, you will get a free download of the album before it is officially released, and we will give you a private concert!

The Impact

The GW Troubadours seek to enrich The George Washington University by brining enjoyable and accessible music to the student body. Too often, we hear stories of artistic groups losing funding, and this time it's our story. 
Until this year, the Troubadours have received over $2000 in funding from the GW Music Department to record our album. However, due to significant choral budget cuts, we no longer will receive this funding. 
Your contribution is extremely important to us, as it will help us fund what will be our best album yet. You can listen to our previous album here: https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/studio-226-ep/id658606317

Risks & Challenges

Recording an album is expensive. We have to pay for studio time, as well as editing, mixing, and mastering of the recorded tracks. Not to mention, we have to pay for transportation and food during our week-long recording sessions. 

In order to pay for this expensive undertaking, we need your help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute today, please help spread the word! 

Share this campaign via social media, email, or simply tell your friends. We can't thank you enough for your support!

story:
Sadly, after a tour across the country over the last couple months, through many big cities and small towns, within hours of being back to our houses in Portland, our trailer lock was snipped and most of our gear was stolen. This is somewhat of a major blow for us. After taking what was certainly one of the saddest inventories we’ve ever taken, the total cost came out to over $15,000. Basically that means that Boyd’s drums are gone, Roger’s bass and amp, all of our pedals, mics, cords, sound system, and even our merchandise. I’m sure they will get some solid use out of our 80 shirts. As a band, I am proud that we have made it to a point where each member can live off of doing what we love. However, it doesn’t leave much for the savings account, and our gear was our biggest and most important investment. We are in a bit of a bind. We are reaching out to you for any help you can give. Many of you have supported us in countless different ways, and we couldn’t be more grateful. It is very hard for us to ask for something like this, but we are overwhelmed. Once again, anything helps. We are happy with any amount; we would be ecstatic to reach our goal of 1/3 of the cost, $5000, and amazed to receive even more toward the total cost. But we know this is life and these things happen. Thank you for your continued support, we love you all.

-DCSA

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone, thanks for visiting our page to raise money for recording our next album!!! We are so excited to record this year, but making an album takes a lot of work. From transportation, mixing, recording, and production we need your help to make this CD happen. 

We can't tell you how excited we are to share all of the completely new arrangements we've been working on. The music ranges from an R&B Frank Ocean song to a jazz inspired Lake Street Dive song; from Mumford and Sons to Kimbra. And that's just the beginning.

Despite having completed so much already, there is still much more to be done before the album is completed, and that is why we are reaching out to you: our friends, fans, and family. 

We need $5,000 in order to kickstart the process of recording our album. This breaks down into roughly two areas, the first being studio time. It takes a long time to get a song right--to get all the parts recorded, edited, mixed, and mastered with a professional sound engineer. This is the process that makes sure the tracks are the absolute best they can be. 

The second main cost of completing the album is the physical production itself, which includes photography, layout, and pressing the CD's into the nice finished product, the "pressing" being the most expensive part. 

In donating to this project, you are not only helping us achieve our goal of creating a fantastic  album, but by donating $30 or more, you are pre-ordering the album! Check out the donation levels on the right side of this page for more perks of donating, including t-shirts, sweatshirts, and more! 

So, thank you so much for considering a donation to Shere Khan. You're going to love the music.
